solution: This paper proposes a load-balancing based 'cloud-edge-end' integrated edge network solution. Specifically, first, considering the bandwidth pressure and real-time computing difficulties of the cloud architecture, a short-range ring network mode and a remote backup mode are adopted to reduce dependence on the cloud center and enhance system real-time performance through flexible topology design and efficient local transmission. Second, addressing the load and performance issues caused by the surge in device numbers, edge node distribution design and dynamic load monitoring mechanisms are introduced to ensure task allocation and system stability through optimized node topology and dynamic weight adjustments. Finally, in response to the deployment requirements in complex scenarios, a dynamic task scheduling strategy and dynamic weight load balancing algorithm are employed to efficiently schedule computational resources and balance node load, further enhancing network scalability and overall performance. This solution has been successfully applied in the No. 2 tunnel of the Ren-Zun Expressway in Guizhou Province, achieving low latency, high stability, and cross-scenario edge network support, providing a solid foundation for the development of intelligent transportation.

explanation.content: In response to analysis0, considering the bandwidth pressure and latency issues faced by traditional cloud architectures, technology3 (short-range ring network mode) and technology4 (remote backup mode) are adopted to reduce bandwidth consumption through flexible deployment and efficient data transmission, combined with technology5 (dynamic load balancing algorithm) to further optimize task allocation and ensure efficient real-time computation.

For analysis1, considering the surge in equipment numbers and the need for real-time data processing, technology0 (edge node distribution design) and technology1 (dynamic load weight monitoring mechanism) are used to monitor the real-time load of each node, while technology5 (dynamic load balancing algorithm) is employed to adjust task allocation strategies to prevent performance degradation and ensure system responsiveness and processing capability.

For analysis2, considering the need for flexible and stable computing capabilities due to the special deployment of the scenario, the task assignment weights are optimized using technology2 (dynamic scheduling strategy) and the node computing power is flexibly expanded with technology3 (short-range ring network mode) to meet the demands of complex scenarios while ensuring system stability and scalability.

title: Research on the design scheme of Huizhong Wharf in Huangmei Port based on the comprehensive protection of the Yangtze River.
requirement: Research on the design scheme of Huizhong Wharf in Huangmei Port based on the comprehensive protection of the Yangtze River. Against the backdrop of weak infrastructure at Huangmei Port, a surge in demand for sand and gravel transportation, and complex water level conditions, design and construct an efficient, energy-saving, and pollution-free Huaitong Terminal that meets the requirements of the Yangtze River's major protection strategy, aiming to achieve an annual throughput of 7.82 million tons for bulk sand and gravel, enhance the bulk cargo transportation capacity of Huangmei Port, and optimize the coordinated development with local economy and environmental protection.
solution: This article presents a design plan for the Huangmei Port Huitong Dock based on the Yangtze River Protection Strategy. Specifically, first, considering the rapid growth of Huangmei Port's throughput demand and the significant gap, techniques for optimizing the overall layout of the dock and automated loading and unloading processes were employed. By reasonably distributing berths and implementing efficient, pollution-free systems, the dock's throughput was achieved at 7.82 million tons per year. Secondly, in response to the Yangtze River protection policies and local ecological environmental protection requirements, green and eco-friendly architectural design was adopted. By optimizing the foundations of hydraulic structures and environmental protection facilities, the project's impact on the environment was significantly reduced. Finally, to address operational issues under the complex water conditions of the Yangtze River, a floating dock structure was used, with four 3,000-ton-grade berths arranged along the flow direction to adapt to changes in water depth during flood and dry seasons, ensuring normal vessel operations and continuous port efficiency. This plan achieves integrated optimized design from the perspectives of infrastructure functionality, local economic development, and environmental protection, providing certain reference value for the planning of similar docks in the middle and lower reaches of the Yangtze River.

explanation.content: In response to analysis0, considering the challenge of insufficient throughput capacity for bulk sand and gravel at the terminal, technology1 is used to optimize the overall layout of the terminal. Combined with the automated loading and unloading process of technology2, and through the reasonable distribution of export/import berths and an efficient distribution system, the throughput is increased to 7.82 million tons per annum, addressing the improvement demand of 17.1 million tons per annum.

In response to analysis1, considering the needs for the Yangtze River protection and ecological environment protection, use technology3 to ensure that the design of marine engineering structures at the terminal is green and environmentally friendly, in order to reduce disturbances to the ecosystem during construction, while minimizing the negative impacts of wastewater and emissions on the environment. Coupled with the efficient and pollution-free loading and unloading process of technology2, it can further respond to environmental protection requirements.

For analysis2, considering the challenge of complex water level conditions, a flexible structure based on a floating dock is designed using technology0 to ensure that the berth can adapt to different water depth conditions during flooding and drought periods, ensuring the continuity and stability of operations in the river section.

title: Design of a Filling-Type Large-Particle Cement-Stabilized Crushed Stone Base Plan
requirement: Design of a Filling-Type Large-Particle Cement-Stabilized Crushed Stone Base Plan Under the conditions of easily shrinkage-cracking cement-stabilized gravel base, heavy traffic on Shanghai roads, and serious diseases, design and implement a renovation plan for filling-type large particle size cement-stabilized gravel base to enhance stability and durability, thoroughly address the existing diseases, while also ensuring high load-bearing capacity.
solution: This article proposes a modification plan for large-particle filled cement-stabilized gravel base. Specifically, first, considering the inherent shrinkage characteristics of cement-stabilized gravel bases that easily lead to cracks, it employs large-particle filled cement-stabilized gravel technology to modify material performance through the locking of the main aggregate skeleton and the continuous grading of filler, enhancing crack resistance and reducing water damage; secondly, addressing the heavy traffic and damage issues on Shanghai roads, it adopts joint filling refinement technology and mechanical paving and compaction techniques to ensure density by optimizing the filling ratio of joint materials and mechanized construction, thereby improving the bearing capacity and durability of the pavement and thoroughly resolving issues with cracks and potholes.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that traditional cement-stabilized gravel bases are prone to shrinkage cracks and rainwater infiltration leading to defects, use technology0 to improve the shrinkage performance of the material and enhance its crack resistance by utilizing a coarse aggregate skeleton and continuously graded filler to reduce rainwater infiltration.

In response to analysis1, considering issues such as heavy traffic loads and the exacerbation of long-term diseases, technology1 and technology2 are employed to improve compactness by filling joints, combined with mechanical paving and precise compaction techniques, enhancing load-bearing capacity and durability, effectively preventing the expansion of future diseases.

title: Research on the design of access roads and bridge-tunnel solutions for water conservancy projects in complex terrain areas.
requirement: Research on the design of access roads and bridge-tunnel solutions for water conservancy projects in complex terrain areas. Under the conditions of significant terrain fluctuations, dense vegetation, high requirements for surrounding ecological environment protection, and considerations for construction and operational needs, complete the construction task of the access road to the Luotian Pump Station in the Pearl River Delta water resource allocation project. This must meet the requirements for access management during the operational phase, transportation of large equipment and materials during the construction phase, while also coordinating with the landscape of the forest park.
solution: This article proposes the 'three bridges and one tunnel' plan. Specifically, first, considering the conditions such as significant ground undulation and dense vegetation, there may be challenges related to the ecological damage caused by excavation and filling, as well as adverse effects on the forest park landscape. The three bridges and one tunnel solution, through the combined design of bridges and tunnels, aims to reduce forest land occupation and environmental damage. Secondly, in response to the high requirements for actual construction and operation, as well as strong landscape coordination challenges, the optimized design of the tunnel and the three bridges covers technical details. For example, the two-lane bidirectional design of the short single-tube tunnel ensures safe driving, while the sunflower arch shape of Bridge No. 1, the semi-arch shape of Bridge No. 2, and the decorative function of Bridge No. 3 combine aesthetics and functionality. Ultimately, it forms a technically feasible, ecologically friendly design plan for the access road of a hydraulic engineering project in complex terrain areas, providing a reference for similar projects.

explanation.content: In response to analysis0, considering the significant ground fluctuations, lush vegetation, and high conservation requirements for the ecological environment, the "Three Bridges and One Tunnel Scheme" using technology0 was implemented. This approach combines bridges and tunnels to minimize land occupation in forested areas, reduce the amount of excavation and fill, achieve protection of the ecological environment, while also optimizing the travel route and reducing damage to the landscape of the forest park.

In response to analysis1, considering the requirements for both construction and operational phases as well as the aesthetic appearance, a single-hole short tunnel design using technology1 and three different bridge techniques (technology2 to technology4) was employed to address the issues of traffic functionality and landscape coordination in complex terrain. These technologies achieved high operational safety and met architectural landscape requirements by optimizing bridge forms and material selection.

title: Design of Deformed Plane Intersection Scheme Under Multiple Influences
requirement: Design of Deformed Plane Intersection Scheme Under Multiple Influences Design a reasonable solution for the intersection area of National Route 208 and Provincial Route 206, addressing the current issues of low traffic conversion efficiency and frequent traffic congestion between the two roads. The solution must meet 75% of the traffic conversion demand under the peak hourly traffic volume of 2733 pcu/d in the last year of service, while also considering technical and economic rationality and social and environmental acceptability. Conduct a comprehensive analysis, comparison, and selection of the optimal plan.
solution: This paper proposes an optimal design scheme for deformed planar intersections under multiple influencing factors. Specifically, first, addressing the current issues of the intersection of National Route 208 and Provincial Route 206, it considers that simply using a twisted approach or adding turning lanes cannot meet traffic demand and alleviate congestion under existing conditions. Therefore, the dual-T planar intersection technology is employed, reasonably distributing traffic flow through a 140-meter lateral connector, while also being small in scale and economically feasible. Secondly, considering that the peak hour traffic demand at the end of the service life exceeds 2733 pcu/d, with a significant proportion being traffic conversion demand, the issue of insufficient traffic capacity at circular intersections is addressed by adopting a simple interchange scheme. This is achieved through the design of directional ramps and the construction of overpass bridges, realizing efficient and conflict-free traffic conversion, further enhancing the service level of regional traffic. In the scheme evaluation phase, this paper not only focuses on technical and economic indicators but also incorporates indicators such as social and environmental coordination, public opinion compliance, and adaptability to sustainable development. A scheme comparison method is used for selection, ultimately concluding that the dual-T planar intersection is the preferred option for this project.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the high grade of intersecting roads, large volume of turning traffic, and a high proportion of heavy trucks in the traffic composition, the technology0 double T-type plane intersection meets the turning needs through a 140-meter lateral connecting line, while also requiring a small amount of work and occupying less land, adapting to the existing terrain conditions and economic characteristics of the project.

For analysis1, considering that the peak hour traffic volume at the end of the service period reaches 2733 pcu/d with a high proportion of medium and large vehicles, a circular planar intersection is not feasible due to low operational speed and easy congestion. Instead, a simple overpass using technology2 is adopted, which enhances long-term usability through high throughput efficiency and the elimination of traffic conflict points. However, the addition of an overline bridge is needed to resolve the problem of ramp crossings.

title: Research on Hydrodynamic Analysis and Mooring Scheme Design for Large Vessel Terminal Dual Berth Mooring
requirement: Research on Hydrodynamic Analysis and Mooring Scheme Design for Large Vessel Terminal Dual Berth Mooring Under the conditions of large ship sizes, complex typhoons, and hydrological conditions, complete the hydrodynamic analysis and optimal mooring scheme design for parallel mooring of two vessels in the dock area, ensuring the anchor system is safe and reliable, especially possessing the ability to withstand wind and waves during typhoon events.
solution: This article presents a hydrodynamic analysis and typhoon-resistant mooring scheme design for large vessel berthing at a terminal with dual-ship mooring. Specifically, first, considering that large vessels are prone to exceed anchor cable tension limits under the combined effects of wind, waves, and currents, the AQWA hydrodynamic analysis method (technology0) is used to assess the impact of wind, wave, and current loads on vessel motion through mathematical modeling. Secondly, to optimize the cable configuration scheme (technology1), a braid nylon rope with a breaking strength of 2060KN is employed, and based on simulation results, four additional ropes are added to the bow and stern of the internal and external vessels to enhance stability. Finally, using anchoring force calculation and optimization methods (technology2), in conjunction with outfitting formulas and environmental conditions, a reasonable layout of anchoring devices is planned to ensure the safety and typhoon resistance of the mooring system.

explanation.content: In response to analysis0, considering the issue of excessive anchor cable tension for large vessels under the combined effects of wind, waves, and current, modeling research on vessel motion and forces under specific conditions is conducted using the AQWA method (technology0), providing data support for the subsequent optimization of the cable configuration plan (technology1).

Based on analysis 1, considering the significant changes in anchor cable tension caused by hydrodynamic and wind power effects under complex hydrological conditions, design the arrangement of anchor cables through anchor force calculation and optimization (technology 2) to reduce the risk of failure due to excessive tension, while leveraging the high tensile strength of nylon ropes to construct a stable anchoring system (technology 1).

title: Design of large outfitting wharf and mooring scheme.
requirement: Design of large outfitting wharf and mooring scheme. Under the conditions of outfitted vessels with small displacement, shallow draft, large wind surface area, and no power while needing to dock for extended periods, complete the design of the mooring and wind resistance schemes for double-berthing at the outfitting dock, ensuring that the vessel's movement and the forces on the ropes and mooring posts meet safety and regulatory requirements.
solution: This article presents the design of a dual-ship berthing and wind-resistant mooring scheme for outfitting docks. Specifically, first, considering the large wind area and high lateral loads on outfitting vessels, a dual-ship berthing layout and OPTIMOOR simulation analysis are employed to resolve issues of cable stress and uneven mooring post stress by coordinating internal and external mooring lines and optimizing their arrangement. Second, to address the collision risk during the berthing process, inflatable rubber fenders are used to provide effective cushioning between the two ships, absorbing berthing energy. Finally, facing extreme natural loads under wind-resistant conditions, a wind-resistant mooring layout is utilized, improving the cable stress angle through the use of mooring posts along the dock's rear side in storm conditions, combined with OPTIMOOR simulation to validate mooring safety, achieving wind resistance capacity up to level 10 wind, and meeting the safety requirements for outfitting docks.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that outfitted vessels are subject to significant lateral wind load and restricted mooring line arrangements, technology1 (dual vessel mooring arrangement) and technology3 (OPTIMOOR mooring simulation analysis) are used to coordinate the forces on the internal and external mooring lines, while simulation analysis is employed to ensure that the forces on the mooring lines and the mooring pillars are balanced and safe.

For analysis1, considering that uneven load transfer between the inner and outer vessels may lead to collisions, technology0 (floating inflatable rubber bumpers design) is used to arrange high-pressure bumpers between the two vessels to absorb docking energy and buffer vessel movements. At the same time, technology1 is used to optimize the rope arrangement to ensure stable force on both vessels.

For analysis2, considering the high stress risk to the mooring lines and mooring pillars caused by extreme weather under wind-resistant mooring conditions, technology2 (wind-resistant mooring arrangement) is used to distribute the stress across the rear mooring pillars, combined with technology3 (OPTIMOOR mooring simulation analysis), to optimize the cable length and angle, ensuring that the wind resistance capability meets the standard requirements.

title: Design of a model test scheme for the three-dimensional deformation characteristics of large shield tunnel segments in the most unfavorable floating state.
requirement: Design of a model test scheme for the three-dimensional deformation characteristics of large shield tunnel segments in the most unfavorable floating state. During the tunnel excavation process, due to the non-constancy of slurry buoyancy and complex mechanical coupling effects, a model testing plan targeting the three-dimensional instantaneous deformation characteristics of large shield tunneling segment under the most unfavorable floating state was designed and implemented to study the deformation patterns and mechanical characteristics of the segment and to provide technical support for practical engineering.
solution: This article proposes a study of the three-dimensional instantaneous deformation characteristics of large shield tunnel segments under the most unfavorable buoyancy conditions through a three-dimensional loading model test system. Specifically, first, considering the non-constant buoyancy of the slurry and the uneven pressure distribution that may lead to tunnel deformation issues, a three-dimensional loading model test system and spring simulation technology are employed to accurately simulate the non-uniform upward buoyancy and surrounding pressure, reflecting the construction mechanical characteristics; second, addressing the complex coupling effects among jacking force, surrounding rock pressure, and synchronized grouting buoyancy, a segment model and connecting bolts similar to actual engineering are designed based on similarity theory, and combined with high-precision measurement technology to ensure consistency between the model test and actual engineering; finally, through the measurement and analysis of segment crown displacement, segment invert displacement, and convergence deformation, the longitudinal deformation laws and changing mechanical characteristics of the tunnel are summarized, validating the feasibility of the model test scheme, and providing technical support for the buoyancy resistance design and construction of segments during shield tunnel construction.

explanation.content: In response to analysis0, considering that the non-constant buoyancy of the slurry and uneven pressure distribution may lead to complex mechanical properties of tunnel deformation, technology0 and technology1 were adopted. Through a three-dimensional loading model testing system and spring simulation technology, the effects of slurry buoyancy and stratum resistance on tunnel segments under actual construction conditions were accurately reflected.

Regarding analysis1, considering the complex mechanical issues caused by the coupling effects of jack thrust, surrounding rock pressure, and the buoyancy of synchronous grouting, we use technology2 and technology3 to ensure that the model tests accurately reflect the actual engineering through refined design based on similarity theory and high-precision measurement technology, while optimizing loading and measurement accuracy.

title: Research on the Design of Construction Monitoring Plan for Long-Span Prestressed Concrete Rigid Frame Bridges
requirement: Research on the Design of Construction Monitoring Plan for Long-Span Prestressed Concrete Rigid Frame Bridges Under the conditions of a large-span rigid frame bridge (75+120+75) m span, C55 concrete single-box single-chamber flat slab box girder structure, and piers taller than 30 meters, complete the monitoring of the entire construction process, ensure that the alignment in the completion phase is consistent with the design, avoid cracking caused by hydration heat, and simultaneously monitor the elevation, stress, and alignment of the bridge to ensure that the main girder splice condition meets the design requirements.
solution: This article proposes a construction monitoring plan for long-span prestressed concrete rigid bridges based on full-parameter monitoring. Specifically, first, considering the high risks of bridge alignment control and stress state, beam elevation monitoring technology and stress monitoring technology are employed to ensure the accuracy of the construction process through real-time measurement and control of elevation and stress. Second, to address the risk of cracks caused by hydration heat during large-volume concrete construction, concrete hydration heat monitoring technology is applied to control internal temperature differences and cooling rates, preventing crack formation. Finally, for conditions with high requirements for axis deviation and pier verticality, axis deviation monitoring technology and pier verticality monitoring technology are used, combined with total station monitoring and positioning equipment layout, to ensure that the axis is controlled within ±10mm and the verticality deviation does not exceed 10mm. This plan effectively ensures that the bridge closure state is consistent with the design, providing technical support for the long-term service safety of the bridge.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the complex issues of alignment control and stress state in the construction of large-span rigid-frame bridges, technology0 is used for monitoring the elevation of the main beam, combined with the stress monitoring technology of technology1. By measuring and adjusting in stages during construction, it ensures that both elevation errors and stress changes remain within the design range.

For analysis1, considering the potential risks of high temperatures and cracking in large volume concrete during construction, technology3 will be applied to the hydration heat monitoring of bridge piers and caps, utilizing temperature sensors to detect temperature changes and adjust the cooling system, thereby preventing cracking.

For analysis 2, considering the high requirements for the closure state of the main beam regarding linear accuracy and axis deviation, real-time adjustments will be made through the axis offset monitoring of technology 2 and the elevation monitoring technology of technology 0, combined with the stress monitoring of technology 1, to ensure that the bridge's linear shape and stress performance meet the design requirements.

In response to the vertical precision construction requirements mentioned in analysis0 and analysis2 for the pier, technology4 is used to monitor the verticality of the pier body to ensure that the bottom of the pier and the top point of the pier are aligned vertically during the construction process, thereby reducing the amount of deviation adjustment work required later.

title: Stress analysis and scheme design for seamless widening of large-span concrete continuous box girder bridges.
requirement: Stress analysis and scheme design for seamless widening of large-span concrete continuous box girder bridges. Under the conditions of widening a long-span concrete continuous box girder bridge, complete the seamless widening design of the bridge and address the issue of joint stress concentration caused by shrinkage, creep, and differential deformation, ensuring the integrity of the bridge, improving the durability of the joints, and preventing problems such as longitudinal cracking at the joints.
solution: This paper proposes a comprehensive solution for seamless widening of large-span concrete continuous box girder bridges. Specifically, first, considering that large-span bridges are prone to joint stress concentration problems due to poor deformation, the use of reinforcement technology is proposed to optimize the shear performance of the splicing structure by embedding reinforcement bars in the flange plates; second, in response to the significant vertical deformation at mid-span, rigid beam technology is employed to connect the beams and reduce the vertical shear stress difference at the joints, enhancing the integrity of the joints; finally, to address the adverse stress conditions on the edge spans, transverse prestressing technology is introduced by applying transverse prestress between the new and old bridges to enhance the shear resistance of the bridge's flange plates and prevent cracks in the splicing seams caused by transverse tensile stress. This solution effectively improves the stress and deformation conditions of the seamless widening structure, ensuring the overall durability and safety of the bridge.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the significant differences in longitudinal stress and vertical deformation at the splice joints of long-span bridges, technology0 was used in conjunction with flange plate reinforcement technology to reduce the stress concentration at the joints caused by deformation between the old and new bridges by providing additional shear strength.

For analysis1, considering the potential for significant stress differences and destruction risks in the mid-span area after splicing, the technology1 mid-span rigid beam technique is utilized to enhance the stability of the splice acceptance capacity in the mid-span area, effectively reducing joint damage caused by vertical shear stress.

For analysis2, considering the adverse loading conditions of the splice seams in the transverse direction, use technology2 transverse prestressing technology to enhance the shear resistance of the flange plates, and improve the long-term durability of the seams through overall load optimization.

title: Analysis of the diseases of large-span prestressed concrete continuous rigid frame bridges and design of reinforcement schemes.
requirement: Analysis of the diseases of large-span prestressed concrete continuous rigid frame bridges and design of reinforcement schemes. Under the conditions of increasing traffic volume year by year, significant crack expansion, and dynamic changes caused by loading, complete the repair and reinforcement tasks of the large-span prestressed concrete continuous rigid frame bridge to ensure the long-term safety and stability of the bridge.
solution: This article proposes a reinforcement plan for the diseases of large-span prestressed concrete continuous rigid frame bridges. Specifically, first, considering the issue of overloaded operations caused by the annual increase in traffic volume, detailed mechanical performance simulations of the crack area are conducted using ANSYS finite element simulation technology to assess the structural stability after crack repair. Secondly, to address the issues of reduced stiffness and widening cracks in the junction area, external concrete and external steel plate reinforcement technologies are used, along with crack repair materials to fill the wide cracks, effectively restoring the stiffness and strength of the junction area. Finally, to handle the uncertainty in structural performance caused by dynamic changes in cracks, static and dynamic load tests are implemented, and the deformation and strain data of the bridge are monitored in real time, verifying the load-bearing capacity and long-term stability of the reinforced bridge to ensure its safe operation.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that the increase in traffic volume may lead to a decrease in the bridge's load-bearing capacity, perform finite element analysis using technology0 to simulate the stress distribution under regular load and standard load conditions, providing a design basis for the reinforcement scheme in the crack propagation area.

For analysis1, considering the issue of significantly reduced stiffness in the intersection area, a combination reinforcement technology of outsourced concrete and externally wrapped steel plates is adopted, while addressing wide cracks, effectively restoring the stiffness of the intersection area to meet design standards.

For analysis2, considering the dynamic changes in cracks leading to local displacement deviations, conduct load testing and real-time monitoring after construction using technology3 to verify the reinforcement effect, ensure stable structural performance, and monitor further crack propagation.

title: Design and research on the expansion and renovation plan for the Bama Hub interchange on the Tianba Expressway.
requirement: Design and research on the expansion and renovation plan for the Bama Hub interchange on the Tianba Expressway. Under the constraints of a complex low mountainous terrain in the interconnection area, the need to coordinate multiple expressway traffic flows, and existing semi-directional T-interchange limitations, complete the design of the expansion and reconstruction of the Bama hub interchange formed by the Tianba Expressway, Duba Expressway, and Hebai Expressway in a cross shape, including tasks such as route design, terrain adaptation, construction organization, and devising a traffic maintenance plan.
solution: This article proposes an optimized design plan for the renovation and expansion of the Bama interchange hub. Specifically, first, considering the complex low mountain terrain in the region and the construction difficulty of crossing the Panyang River, a rigid frame bridge crossing technology is adopted, utilizing prestressed concrete rigid frames to achieve large span crossings, ensuring suitable construction technical conditions; second, addressing the complex traffic flow issues at the intersections of multiple highways, ramp route optimization technology is applied, introducing circular ramps and collector-distributor road designs to improve traffic organization efficiency and reduce the risk of service level degradation; third, in response to the design limitations imposed by existing interchanges, a deformed cloverleaf exchange method is employed to simplify structural design, optimize land use, and reduce costs; finally, to address the need for traffic maintenance during construction, phased construction techniques are introduced, setting up temporary maintenance ramps at each stage and gradually shifting existing traffic flow to ensure uninterrupted passage for the main traffic direction during the construction period.

explanation.content: In response to analysis0, considering that the complex low mountain terrain in the area may restrict construction procedures and increase the difficulty of bridge spanning, technology1 is adopted to implement the construction of a large-span bridge over the Panyang River using rigid frame bridge technology, ensuring that construction conditions meet topographical requirements.

For analysis1, considering the increased complexity of traffic flow in areas where multiple expressways intersect, use technology2 to optimize ramp routes and design distribution roads to ensure smooth traffic, and provide specific route solutions for maintaining traffic during construction.

In response to analysis2, considering that the existing semi-T interchange limitations may increase costs and project scale, use technology0 to replace the original structure with a deformed alfalfa leaf-shaped exchange method, directly connecting the main traffic directions to achieve a simple and low-cost design while reducing internal traffic flow conflicts at the interchange.

Regarding the traffic maintenance issues of analysis1 and analysis2, considering the complexity of construction and existing traffic flow interference, technology3 will be adopted. A phased construction and maintenance plan will be introduced during the renovation and expansion process, with phased traffic diversion measures in place to ensure the traffic flow remains uninterrupted during construction.

title: Design scheme for natural gas pipelines crossing highways.
requirement: Design scheme for natural gas pipelines crossing highways. Under the conditions of a design pressure of 6.3 MPa and a pipe diameter of DN700, complete the task of crossing the highway with a natural gas pipeline using the shield tunneling method, ensuring the accuracy of the pipeline crossing, stability of the highway embankment, and construction safety, while also meeting long-term performance requirements.
solution: This article presents the design and construction plan for natural gas pipelines crossing highways. Specifically, first, considering the importance and accuracy requirements of the highway, non-excavation pipe-jacking technology was used, and precise pipeline crossing was completed through measurement correction and a high-precision guide rail system. Secondly, to address complex geological conditions, L485M PSL2 steel pipes and enhanced corrosion protection technology were adopted, along with DRCP III standard reinforced concrete casings, to adapt to soil resistance and long-term load effects. Finally, construction safety was prioritized, employing foundation settlement monitoring and highway protection markings to ensure the protection of the highway base and the long-term structural safety during the pipe-jacking construction process. Through the combination of these technologies, a high-pressure natural gas pipeline safety crossing plan that meets GB 50423-2013 and Anhui provincial local standards was ultimately achieved.

explanation.content: In response to analysis0, considering the importance of highways and the high requirements for precision and subgrade stability, the technology0 trenchless pipe jacking technology is used. This technology achieves precise and safe casing crossing construction through jacking correction measures and guide rail precision control, while avoiding surface disturbance of the highway.

For analysis1, considering that the friction characteristics of sandy fill and clay may affect the pipe jacking construction, and combining the geological design parameter values, technology0 was adopted along with the well-adapted DRCP III standard reinforced concrete casing (technology2). By optimizing the pushing equipment and guide rail accuracy to accommodate different soil layer friction, smooth construction was achieved.

For analysis2, considering that the casing needs to withstand long-term soil pressure and Class I highway loads, we use technology2 reinforced concrete casing combined with load verification calculations to ensure that the casing meets long-term load-bearing requirements and can adapt to construction conditions. Meanwhile, technology3 foundation settlement monitoring and protective measures are supplemented to ensure the safety of the casing and surrounding highway facilities.

title: Design Study of the Huixian South Interchange Scheme for the Anyang to Xinxiang Expressway
requirement: Design Study of the Huixian South Interchange Scheme for the Anyang to Xinxiang Expressway Within the scope of the Huixian South Interchange on the Anyang to Xinxiang Expressway, comprehensively consider the existing dense distribution of highways and interchanges, high-voltage lines, and village control factors, combined with future traffic flow demands and the long-term widening plan for the Hebao Expressway, to complete an interchange design scheme that meets traffic transfer needs, is economically viable in terms of engineering costs, saves land, and ensures high safety.
solution: This article proposes a single trumpet + half-T hybrid interchange design scheme for the Huixian South Interchange. Specifically, first, considering the issues of land use and cost caused by the high demand for highway intersections and ramp layout, a single trumpet + half-T design is adopted, achieving the interaction of multiple highway flow lines while saving costs and reducing land use by layering the design on the existing Huixian South Interchange; second, in response to the main traffic flow of the Anxin Highway and local road usage needs, high-standard ramps are designed and the relocation of toll station positions is optimized to ensure that the interchange operational capacity meets future traffic flow demands while improving traffic diversion efficiency; lastly, combined with the surrounding terrain and topography of the interchange and the future expansion plans for the He-Bao Highway, the scheme avoids adding new entrances and exits on the He-Bao Highway, ensuring minimal impact on the safety of existing highway operations while accommodating future renovation and expansion needs. The scheme provides a safe and efficient traffic plan while saving construction costs and shortening construction periods, and can serve as a design reference for similar projects.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the demand for the number of interchange ramps due to multiple high-speed intersections, as well as cost and land occupation issues, a single trumpet + semi-T-shaped composite interchange design using technology0 is adopted. This design reduces the number of ramp layouts through superimposed design, saves project volume, enhances the rationality of traffic flow lines, and prevents excessive ramps from interfering with the current high-speed operation; while also addressing the impact of high-voltage lines and existing village control points.

For analysis1, considering the complex traffic flow diversion requirements, use technology1 high-standard ramp design to achieve efficient traffic interchange between Anxin Expressway and Zhenghui Expressway, and rationally distribute traffic flow in all directions through a composite interchange; furthermore, optimize the relocation of the toll station using technology2 to ensure that vehicles on Changcheng Avenue can smoothly enter and exit the expressway service, avoiding peak congestion.

For analysis2, considering the flat terrain of the interchange area and the future engineering needs, use technology0 and technology3 to design without adding new exits for the Hebao Expressway, reducing land occupation and ensuring safety impact on the existing interchange distribution while maintaining the friendliness towards the dual-direction 8-lane widening of the Hebao Expressway, ensuring compatibility with construction and future planning.

title: Reflections on the design scheme for converting separated roadbeds into integral roadbeds.
requirement: Reflections on the design scheme for converting separated roadbeds into integral roadbeds. Under the existing separated roadbed conditions, through retrofit design, merge it into a unified roadbed while completing the widening of the roadbed and overlaying of the pavement, enhancing the road's drainage capacity and driving safety, and improving the relevant drainage facilities to meet the standards for a two-way six-lane first-class highway (roadbed width 31 m, design speed 80 km/h).
solution: This article proposes a design plan for transforming a separated roadbed into a unified roadbed. Specifically, first, considering the varying heights of the separated roadbed and the different widths of the central dividing strip, the roadbed widening and stepped treatment technology is used. By clearing slopes, excavating steps, gradually filling, and using cement-modified fill, the overall stability of the new and old roadbeds is achieved. Secondly, addressing the issue of insufficient roadbed width in some sections, the pavement structure overlay technology is employed, which involves milling the old pavement and then layering asphalt concrete and cement-stabilized gravel to achieve a uniform design width and thickness using regenerated materials. Finally, for the absence of a drainage system, drainage facilities are optimized and new drainage ditches are constructed, reinforced with 30 cm of stacked stone to ensure proper drainage requirements for the road maintenance section while avoiding adverse effects on the existing irrigation and drainage systems and the environment.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the differences in elevation between the two pavements, the varying widths of the central median strip, and the complexity of the fill, the technology0 embankment widening and step treatment technology was used. By excavating steps on the old road slope, filling layer by layer, and employing cement-modified fill material technology, the challenges of insufficient stability at the junction of the old and new embankment materials and poor connection effects were addressed, ensuring the overall integrity and durability of the embankment.

For analysis1, considering the issues of insufficient roadbed width and excessive fill height on certain segments, the overlay technology of technology1 was used. By leveling the surface of the roadbed, asphalt concrete and cement-stabilized crushed stone were added layer by layer according to the degree of elevation difference. At the same time, the use of crushed old materials helped reduce costs, resolved the issue of roadbed elevation differences, enhanced the load-bearing capacity of the road, and formed a unified integral roadbed structure.

In regard to analysis2, considering the occupation of the drainage ditch and the complex flood frequency issues, optimization technology 2 for drainage design is employed. By constructing a new type of drainage ditch and using asphalt sand water-retaining belts and drainage channel technology, the efficient operation of the drainage system for the overhaul road is ensured, avoiding challenges of subgrade seepage and environmental pollution.

title: Design of overhead line scheme for railway underpass bridge at small angles
requirement: Design of overhead line scheme for railway underpass bridge at small angles Under the conditions of the Detian Railway being a single-line ballast track, with an intersection angle of 45° at the bridge position and requirements for wide skew, complete the construction task of the railway underpass bridge at Changxing Street in Mianzhu City, ensuring the normal passage of existing railways while optimizing construction duration and costs.
solution: This article presents a comparative analysis of three overhead schemes (D-beam overhead line, portal pier overhead line, and large excavation after the line is cut off) and ultimately selects the large excavation after the line is cut off as the primary solution. Specifically, first, considering the conditions of limited train numbers and simple equipment on the Detian Railway, there may be challenges such as a long construction period and interference with railway operations. Therefore, the method of large excavation after cutting off the line is used, achieving rapid blocking of a 62-meter section of the line and safely carrying out large excavation operations to complete the jacking. Secondly, alternative options include the use of D-type low-height construction beam technology, which can achieve stable overhead construction without interrupting train operations but has a longer construction period. Lastly, the portal pier overhead scheme was also explored to further optimize construction efficiency and avoid the inconveniences and risks associated with manual pile drilling. Based on a comprehensive analysis of the three schemes, the large excavation method was chosen according to local conditions, as it involves significant equipment investment but minimizes the time affected on the railway, while also being competitively viable in the industry.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that the Detian Railway is a single-line track with few trains, as well as construction demands under small intersection angles and gradient restrictions, the technology used is technology0, which is the D-type low-height construction beam technology. By installing several sets of construction beams, it meets the requirements for overhead construction, reduces railway operation interference, and maintains stability.

For analysis1, considering the small oblique angle and the wide road (24 m), priority will be given to using technology1, which is the portal frame aerial solution. The supporting pier will be positioned away from the track and connected with beams to reduce the risk of track damage during traditional construction and to enhance construction safety and efficiency.

In response to the simultaneous existence of analysis0 and analysis1, due to the low technical level of the De Tian railway and its infrequent operations, technology2 (strategy of large excavation following line disconnection) is employed. Through a short-term blockade of the railway, a series of rapid construction techniques such as subgrade grouting reinforcement, pile foundation support, and open-cut foundation pit work will be carried out to achieve stable recovery of the railway line and the advance of the tunnel bridge.

title: Route scheme design for the feasibility stage of the mountainous highway project.
requirement: Route scheme design for the feasibility stage of the mountainous highway project. Under the conditions of complex terrain and significant elevation changes in mountainous areas, complete the design of the route scheme for the feasibility study of a 23 km mountain road, which requires full utilization of existing roads, overcoming terrain and ecological challenges, optimizing the route alignment, and ensuring compliance with safety, economic, and ecological environmental protection requirements, ultimately achieving the technical standards for a secondary road.
solution: This article proposes an optimized design scheme for the route plan at the feasibility stage of highway construction in mountainous areas. Specifically, first, considering the complex terrain and significant elevation differences in mountainous areas, the control of passes and slopes faces major challenges. Therefore, pass optimization layout technology is used to achieve overall slope optimization by adjusting the layout of passes and alignment design, ensuring elevation difference control. Second, addressing the issues of insufficient curve radius and continuous turns in the existing road, old road optimization techniques are employed to effectively improve the utilization of the original route through measures such as adjusting the curve radius, adding transition curves, and increasing the roadbed width, thus reducing workload and construction costs. Finally, considering the fragile ecological environment and the need for coordination with the distribution of land resources in surrounding villages and towns, green and environmentally friendly design techniques are employed to avoid villages, water sources, and protected areas, reducing large-scale construction's impact on natural resources and ultimately achieving a balance between ecological protection and construction goals.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the complex terrain and significant elevation differences in mountainous areas, the layout of the passes and longitudinal slope control present challenges. Therefore, technology0 was used to achieve overall slope optimization by adjusting the pass layout, design of the alignment, and optimizing the slope, thereby improving the feasibility of the route layout.

For analysis1, considering the issues of insufficient curvature radius and excessive turns in the original road, technology1 was utilized to optimize and adjust the curvature radius, transition curves, and width, improving the utilization of the original route and reducing both the amount of work and investment costs.

For analysis2, considering that construction may impact villages, water source areas, and ecological protection zones, technology2 is used to minimize environmental damage by avoiding ecologically sensitive areas, reducing large-scale construction, and optimizing route layout.

title: Research on the Route Scheme Design for the Suburban Highway in Mountainous Areas
requirement: Research on the Route Scheme Design for the Suburban Highway in Mountainous Areas Under the complex geological conditions of the mountainous areas in Chongqing, along with the rapid road network in Jiangjin's suburban areas and urban planning controls, design a highway route plan for Jiangjin's suburbs that meets the requirements of minimizing the scale of demolition, reducing geological damage, and adhering to the development regulations of Jinyun Mountain, while ensuring optimal technical and economic benefits.
solution: This article proposes a highway route design plan that covers complex geological conditions and controlling factors in suburban areas. Specifically, it first considers the planning of expressway networks, urban planning control, and management of Jinyun Mountain by using planning area avoidance and ecological alignment techniques to reasonably circumvent restricted areas through optimized interchange designs and tunnel crossing techniques. Secondly, regarding the relocation issues of the Degan Industrial Park, it employs planning area avoidance techniques to control the scale of relocation, ensuring it aligns with planning and optimizing the overall project benefits. Finally, taking into account the complex geological conditions in mountainous areas, it uses geological alignment and reinforcement techniques to avoid adverse geological zones, designs anti-slide piles and support projects, and controls excavation heights to ensure geological stability in the construction area. Ultimately, the G line is recommended as the preferred scheme to reduce project costs and achieve the best results.

explanation.content: Regarding analysis0, considering the impact of the expressway network and urban planning, as well as the management requirements of Jinyun Mountain, technologies technology0 and technology1 are used to avoid planning areas and ecological line selection techniques, allowing the route to bypass the restricted construction area of Jinyun Mountain and the industrial park, thus meeting planning restrictions and ecological requirements.

For analysis1, considering the impact of the planning of the Degan Industrial Park and surrounding towns, which may lead to significant demolition and land disturbance, use technology0 to optimize the routes and interchange designs to reduce the scale of demolitions, minimize the impact on planned land use, and select the optimal solution to reduce costs.

For analysis2, considering the landslide and hydrological issues brought by the complex mountainous geological conditions, technology2 is adopted. Through geological route selection and reinforcement measures, areas prone to landslides and collapses are avoided. Anti-slide piles and other supporting projects are designed to enhance the stability of the line, while controlling the fill and excavation heights to mitigate the risks of large-volume excavation.

title: Research on the Design of Co-construction Plans for Traffic Facility Poles on Mountain Highways
requirement: Research on the Design of Co-construction Plans for Traffic Facility Poles on Mountain Highways Under the conditions of mountainous terrain constraints and the centralized layout of traffic facilities, complete the optimized construction design plan for traffic facility poles on mountainous expressways, reducing the number of poles, improving resource utilization efficiency, while ensuring the completeness of facility functions and driving visibility.
solution: This article proposes an optimization solution for the design and construction of traffic facility poles on mountainous expressways. Specifically, first, considering the limited space for pole deployment due to the mountainous terrain, the multi-pole integration technology is used to reduce land occupation and lower foundation installation costs by consolidating functional poles. Secondly, to address the issues of visual interference and information overload for drivers caused by dense short-spacing deployment, a gantry-type integrated structure and small facility attachment scheme are adopted, optimizing pole arrangement and improving visibility through a five-crossbar truss structure and integrated power supply and distribution system. Finally, to meet the complex requirements of pole functions and specifications, cantilever components are optimized in design, and the layout is flexibly adjusted by combining gantries and small facilities, ultimately achieving a significant reduction in the number of poles, intensified functional layout, and enhanced driving comfort.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the limited space for member layout due to the mountainous terrain restrictions, technology0 is used to reduce the footprint by integrating functional members and optimizing the allocation of space resources, thereby lowering the foundation installation costs.

For analysis1, considering the issue of short-distance dense layout interfering with the driver's line of sight, use technology1 and technology2, optimize the pole arrangement through gantry-type co-construction structures and small facility attachment schemes, reduce information overload, and improve visual recognition effects.

For analysis2, considering the need to balance the functionality of components with regulatory requirements, use technology1, technology2, and technology3 to refine the distribution patterns of functional components, optimize the design of the portal and cantilever components, and enhance the overall layout's integration and compatibility.

title: Stability analysis of rock-filled subgrade slopes and design of protection schemes.
requirement: Stability analysis of rock-filled subgrade slopes and design of protection schemes. Under natural conditions and during heavy rainfall, conduct a stability analysis of the rock-based roadbed slope for the Wangcang County Luojia-Du to Huangyang highway project and design a protection plan to ensure long-term stability of the road slope, guaranteeing safety during construction and operation.
solution: This article proposes solutions to the stability issues of slopes under natural conditions and during rainstorms. Specifically, for the potential hazards of landslide morphology under natural conditions, a scheme involving clearing and unloading, step-by-step excavation and slope reduction, and protective measures with anchor beam frameworks is adopted to preliminarily enhance slope stability by timely clearing unstable sections and reducing stress concentration on the slope. Furthermore, under conditions of high instability due to rainstorms, a protective scheme utilizing anti-slide piles is proposed. By setting up anti-slide piles that measure 2.5m in length and 2.0m in width, the supporting force at the front edge of the landslide is increased to prevent further sliding expansion. Additionally, geological observation and water management efforts are strengthened during construction, thereby achieving long-term slope stability and providing a reference example for design and construction in similar projects.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that the overall stability of the slope is natural, but there may be risks in the shape of the landslide body and the slip surface, technology0 is used to effectively reduce stress concentration on the slope by clearing and unloading and incrementally reducing the slope, ensuring the preliminary stability of the slope.

In response to analysis1, considering that landslides are prone to instability during heavy rainfall, with a significant reduction in the cohesion of the sliding surface and the supporting force at the front edge, technology1 is employed. By designing anti-sliding piles to enhance the support at the front edge of the slope, it suppresses the development of landslide movement and ensures that the safety factor of the slope increases to a stable state.

title: Analysis of Typical Disease Types and Route Scheme Design for the G318 Sichuan-Tibet Highway
requirement: Analysis of Typical Disease Types and Route Scheme Design for the G318 Sichuan-Tibet Highway Under the conditions of complex geological hazards, mountainous terrain, complicated strata lithology, and extreme plateau climate, complete the quality improvement project for the segment of the G318 Sichuan-Tibet Highway from Tiantou Village to Genyao Village, ensuring the safety, reliability, comfort, and smoothness of the entire 42.569 km route.
solution: This article proposes an engineering plan for upgrading the G318 route of the Sichuan-Tibet highway under complex geological disasters, terrains of deep valleys and high mountains, complex geological lithology, and extreme plateau climate conditions. Specifically, firstly, considering the impact of various geological disasters on route safety, tunnel optimization design technology and bridge spanning technology are utilized to reduce the effects of landslide zones and karst geology on the route by optimizing the tunnel alignment and bridge forms; secondly, to address the risks of layer-parallel slope instability that may arise from the high mountain and deep valley terrain, protective technologies for layer-parallel slopes are employed in conjunction with bridge solutions to enhance the overall stability of the route; thirdly, considering the construction difficulties posed by complex geological lithology and sinkholes, bridge pile foundations penetrate and tunnel drainage reinforcement designs are adopted to ensure construction and operational safety; lastly, responding to the hazards of snow accumulation and avalanche ice due to extreme plateau climate conditions, timely snow removal, ice planing, and the establishment of intercepting blind ditches are implemented to enhance roadway capacity and driving safety.

explanation.content: In response to analysis0, considering the impact of various geological hazards on line safety, technology0 and technology1 are employed to optimize tunnels and reduce the impact of landslide zones, while bridges are used to span collapse and karst areas to ensure safe passage.

For analysis1, considering that the steep terrain of mountains and deep valleys can easily lead to the instability of layered slopes, technology2 will be used for mesh-spraying and anchoring reinforcement protection of the slopes, while leveraging bridge technology to bypass high-difficulty slope areas.

For analysis 2, considering the issues of karst caves and faults caused by complex stratum lithology, technology 1 is used to penetrate the pile foundation in the karst development section, and the tunnel drainage design is strengthened to prevent the risk of sudden water influx.

For analysis3, considering that snow accumulation and glacial melt in plateau areas may threaten transportation safety, use technology4 to mitigate the adverse effects of natural conditions through timely snow removal, diversion, and other measures.

title: Design and calculation analysis of the construction support scheme for municipal viaduct composite beams.
requirement: Design and calculation analysis of the construction support scheme for municipal viaduct composite beams. During the construction period of the simply supported composite beam, under the conditions where the scaffolding bears a heavy load, reaches a maximum height of 8m, and has a complex arrangement, complete the design, calculation, and verification of the construction scaffolding for the 1-60m composite beam of the elevated bridge, ensuring that the scaffolding's stress and deformation meet construction regulations and that the safety and uniform distribution of the load during bridge construction are ensured.
solution: This article proposes a scheme for the design of construction supports for 1-60m composite beams. Specifically, first, considering that the high stress conditions on the supports may cause deformation and additional stress, a truss-shaped column support scheme is used to improve stiffness through high-strength vertical columns and lateral bracing, allowing the support to effectively bear temporary loads; secondly, to address the risk of concentrated foundation reaction due to the high height of the supports and complex spacing arrangement, an enlarged foundation design is adopted, enhancing the foundation's bearing capacity through reasonable dimension layout and C30 concrete construction to prevent foundation instability; finally, in conjunction with the comprehensive load issues borne by the supports, precise calculations and verifications of the supports' various stresses are conducted using Midas Civil 2021 software, confirming that the combination stresses (maximum 185 MPa), shear stresses (maximum 110 MPa), and displacement deformations (maximum 4.75 mm) all meet the standards required for construction, thus ensuring construction safety and uniform load distribution.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the significant stress on temporary supports that may lead to deformation and instability, a technology0 truss-shaped column support is used, which significantly enhances the overall stiffness through high-strength vertical columns and lateral connections, thereby reducing the additional deformation and stress concentration effects caused by the applied load.

For analysis1, considering the issue of insufficient load capacity due to the large height of the supports and different spacing arrangements, an expanded design based on technology2 is adopted. This involves accurately placing a 3.4m or 5.4m wide foundation and using C30 concrete for pouring, ensuring that the foundation bearing capacity meets construction requirements and effectively avoiding local voids or foundation collapse.

For analysis2, considering that the comprehensive load may lead to excessive displacement or shear stress instability, the technology1 Midas Civil 2021 spatial analysis software is used to conduct precise calculations and verifications of the forces at each node of the support, ensuring that the combined stress, shear stress, and displacement deformation all meet the construction standards (combined stress ≤ 215 MPa, shear stress ≤ 125 MPa, displacement deformation ≤ 6 mm).

title: Traffic remediation plan design for the ShaBei interchange section of the Guangzhou North Ring Expressway.
requirement: Traffic remediation plan design for the ShaBei interchange section of the Guangzhou North Ring Expressway. Under the conditions of oversaturated traffic flow, a high incidence of accidents, and unreasonable lane markings, design traffic improvement measures for the Shabei interchange section of the Guangzhou North Ring Expressway, with the goal of alleviating traffic congestion, improving traffic efficiency, reducing accident rates, and achieving an overall enhancement of road safety and efficiency.
solution: This article proposes a comprehensive optimization plan for traffic management at the Shabei Interchange section of the Northern Ring Expressway in Guangzhou. Specifically, first, considering that oversaturated traffic flow may lead to severe congestion, improved road marking techniques and optimized navigation language are used to reduce vehicle weaving points through channelization line design, and to enhance route selection guidance via navigation language, thereby improving traffic efficiency; second, in response to sections with high accident rates that may pose serious safety hazards, additional traffic sign technology and lateral vibration speed reduction markings are adopted to decrease the occurrence of collision accidents through clear identification and speed reduction reminders; finally, to address issues caused by unreasonable lane markings that lead to traffic conflicts, reflective signs and solar-powered flashing lights are employed to enhance visibility, especially at night or in adverse weather conditions, effectively reducing vehicle weaving and minimizing accident risks. After two rounds of modifications and optimizations, traffic order at the Shabei Interchange has significantly improved, with a 30% year-on-year reduction in accident rates and reduced parking delay times, making it a successful example of traffic management.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that traffic flow saturation may lead to severe congestion, use technology0 and technology2 to reduce vehicle weaving conflicts by improving line design, while optimizing navigation language to reduce route selection errors during peak traffic periods, thereby enhancing traffic efficiency.

Regarding analysis1, considering that high-frequency accidents may lead to property loss and traffic interruptions, technology1 and technology3 are used to install additional traffic signs and transverse speed-reducing markings to alert drivers in advance, reduce the risk of vehicle scrapes and collisions, and enhance safety.

In response to analysis2, considering the issues of unreasonable lane markings and weaving traffic in the merging area, technology0 and technology4 were used to optimize the changes in lane markings and add reflective signs to enhance the driving experience and visibility of the signage, ultimately reducing vehicle weaving and accident risks.

title: Discuss the design and handling techniques for emergency rescue plans in road cut slope landslides.
requirement: Discuss the design and handling techniques for emergency rescue plans in road cut slope landslides. Under the conditions of complex geological structures and heavy rainfall in landslide-prone areas, complete the design and implementation of the emergency response plan for landslides, ensuring the safe removal of landslide hazards and the maintenance of slope stability within the timeframe for reopening the road.
solution: This article proposes an emergency rescue plan for landslides in complex geological conditions and heavy rainfall. Specifically, first, considering the high and steep terrain of the landslide mass, which is prone to water accumulation, a surface drainage system design and surface sealing measures (technology2 and technology4) are employed to drain and stabilize the slope using interception ditches, rapid flow slots, and clay sealing techniques; secondly, in response to the strong weathering of the landslide rock and soil and the weak stability of the sliding mass, anchor bolt frame reinforcement technology (technology1) and internal and external drainage management (technology3) are used to increase the slope's resistance through drainage holes and graded reinforcement; thirdly, addressing issues such as the heavy weight of the landslide mass and high fissure water pressure, excavation for load reduction (technology0) is utilized in conjunction with internal drainage to expel fissure water; finally, ongoing construction monitoring (technology5) is conducted throughout the project to ensure safety by real-time monitoring of surface and internal deformation and displacement. The final plan effectively stabilized the landslide mass, avoiding secondary landslides and successfully completing the road clearance task within the given timeframe.

explanation.content: In response to analysis0, considering the challenges of steep terrain and the easy accumulation of surface water, technology2 and technology4 are utilized to address the issues of rainwater circulation and infiltration by setting up interception ditches and rapid flow channels, and compacting the surface at the top of the slope to reduce the driving force of landslides.

For analysis1, the geological characteristics of the landslide area are not conducive to slope stability. Using technology1, the slope is reinforced in stages with anchor rod framework reinforcement technology to stabilize the rock structure, enhance the resistance of the landslide body, and slow down the expansion of the landslide.

For analysis2, the landslide soil is highly weathered and loose. Technology0 is used to remove part of the landslide material, and technology3 internal porous drainage technology is employed to reduce the load and decrease the self-weight of the landslide, eliminate fissure water, and prevent further softening of the geotechnical properties.

In response to analysis3, heavy rainfall leads to the instability of the landslide body. By using technology2 and technology3, surface and internal drainage designs will guide surface runoff and fissure water discharge to avoid the landslide risk caused by rainfall.

For analysis4, to address the impact of human-made slope cutting on slope stability and surface water infiltration, technology1 is used to reinforce the slope, combined with surface sealing and drainage measures (technology2 and technology4) to repair the slope and reduce water infiltration pressure.

title: Research on the Design of a New Y-shaped Main Beam for Long-span Bridges
requirement: Research on the Design of a New Y-shaped Main Beam for Long-span Bridges Under the conditions where the main beam is Y-shaped, the geographical constraints and navigation requirements do not allow for the placement of bridge piers at the junction of the three branches, and it is necessary to meet the load conditions of passing vehicles, design a new type of long-span bridge structure.
solution: This article presents a new design scheme for Y-shaped main beams in large-span bridges that adapt to complex construction conditions. Specifically, first, considering that the main beam is Y-shaped and that bridge piers cannot be placed at the junction of the three branches, a strut-main beam combination structural system is used, with steel struts providing support and achieving self-balancing load transfer. Secondly, to address the non-equivalent angles of the main beam, finite element analysis is employed to optimize the branch angles of the main beam, along with a cable tension transmission system and lightweight tensile steel structure design to ensure uniform distribution of internal forces. Finally, this design utilizes high-strength steel, economical cross-sections, and optimized structural forms to meet specific requirements for large spans and vehicular traffic. Research results show that the new structure performs well in terms of stability and load-bearing performance, providing an effective reference for bridge design under similar conditions.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the special stress conditions of the Y-shaped main beam and the challenge that bridge piers cannot be set below the three-branch intersection, use technology0 to provide support through a strut-main beam combination structural system, transferring the load of the main beam to the strut and achieving self-balancing, ensuring structural stability and implementation feasibility.

Regarding analysis1, considering that the unequal angles of the main beam's three branches may cause uneven stress distribution, use technology3 in conjunction with finite element analysis to optimize the angles of the main beam branches. Simultaneously, use technology1 and technology2 to adjust the internal force distribution through a cable transmission system and lightweight tensile steel structure design, avoiding localized abnormal stress.

title: Design of the construction solution for the new bridge steel sheet pile cofferdam.
requirement: Design of the construction solution for the new bridge steel sheet pile cofferdam. Under complex environmental conditions such as the bridge pier being submerged, a foundation pit excavation depth of 6m, and a water level difference of 8m, complete the construction task of the steel sheet pile cofferdam. The cofferdam construction must comply with the relevant specifications for buoyancy resistance, uplift resistance, and structural strength stability, while also ensuring construction quality and safety.
solution: This article presents a solution for the construction of a bridge steel sheet pile cofferdam in water. Specifically, first, considering the water depth and the requirements for buoyancy resistance of the cofferdam, there may be challenges related to insufficient buoyancy stability. Therefore, steel sheet pile cofferdam support technology and concrete anti-buoyancy design are used to enhance buoyancy capacity through precise cofferdam structural design and concrete buoyancy verification. Secondly, to address potential heave and leakage issues during the excavation of the foundation pit, heave verification technology and pumping leak-proof techniques are employed, ensuring the stability of the foundation pit through optimized soil pressure calculations and water pumping leak-proof treatments. Finally, to tackle the pressure and stability issues caused by the large water-soil pressure that the cofferdam must withstand, strength verification design of the bracing and internal support system and concrete sealing technology for the guide tube are used. By employing high-strength bracing and underwater concrete sealing operations, the compressive and stability performance of the cofferdam is improved.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the requirements for water depth and the anti-floating stability of the cofferdam, using technology0 and technology1, the design of the steel sheet pile support structure and the verification of anti-floating stability of the bottom concrete were carried out, enhancing the anti-floating capability of the cofferdam.

For analysis1, considering the potential issues of heave during excavation and the risk of leakage, technology2 and technology5 were employed, ensuring safety during excavation and bottom sealing construction through heave resistance verification and pumping leakage control techniques.

For analysis2, considering that the cofferdam needs to withstand significant water and soil pressure, use technology3 and technology4, through internal support strength design and concrete construction technology for conduit sealing, to ensure the stability and compressive strength of the cofferdam structure.

title: Design and Case Analysis of Construction Footbridge Solutions
requirement: Design and Case Analysis of Construction Footbridge Solutions Under the complex terrain, span, and resource conditions at the construction site, complete the design and construction tasks for a construction footbridge that can accommodate pedestrian, vehicle traffic, or special functions (such as navigation or railway transportation), meeting the requirements for safety, economy, and convenience.
solution: This article proposes a design plan for temporary bridges that meets different construction conditions and requirements. Specifically, first, considering that the selection of bridge locations is influenced by terrain and hydrological geological conditions, construction convenience can be achieved by avoiding risk areas and implementing beam bridge technology; second, in response to site material constraints and economic cost limitations, the use of large sectional steel, Bailey beams, and other materials, combined with the optimized design of beam bridges, cable-stayed bridges, and arch bridges, satisfies the usage and turnover needs in different scenarios; third, specific bridge types are designed according to the size of the span, such as using beam-type temporary bridges for spans of 9 to 15 meters, cable-stayed bridges for 60 to 150 meters, and arch bridge technology for 30 to 60 meters, to cope with complex terrain construction conditions; finally, for special cases where navigation channels or railway tracks need to be accommodated, design techniques such as lifting-type and steel temporary beams are employed, using lifting towers, winches, and interface temporary beam designs to achieve the overall design objectives, ensuring safety, economy, and convenience in construction, providing effective reference and guidance for similar engineering projects.
