explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the complex terrain and landforms, as well as hydrological and geological data that take into account the height difference between the two banks and the flatness of the valley, the bridge location is chosen to avoid geological disaster risks. The beam bridge technology (technology0) is employed to meet the requirements for load-bearing and construction convenience.

In response to analysis1, considering the limitations on material acquisition at the construction site and economic cost constraints, suitable materials such as large-section steel and Bailey beams have been used. Coupled with targeted solutions for beam bridges (technology0), cable-stayed bridges (technology1), and arch bridges (technology2), the goals of economic viability and subsequent reusability have been achieved.

For analysis 2, considering the differences in the requirements for various spans and the complexity of construction, the design adapts to the needs of small-span bridges using beam bridge technology (technology 0), uses cable-stayed bridge technology (technology 1) for large-span crossing functions, employs arch bridge technology (technology 2) to address deep valley construction challenges, and utilizes lift bridge technology (technology 3) to meet the clearance requirements for channel bridges, ultimately completing the adaptive design for the span scale of the task.

title: Design of the integration scheme for tourism vehicle company's business and finance.
requirement: Design of the integration scheme for tourism vehicle company's business and finance. Under the conditions where the business and finance departments operate independently, personnel capabilities vary, some business staff evade supervision, and there is low participation from finance staff, complete the integration of business and finance tasks for Yunnan J Tourism Automobile Company, improve operational efficiency, eliminate contradictions between business and finance, and enhance enterprise value.
solution: This article proposes a design scheme for the integration of business and finance at J Travel Automotive Company. Specifically, first, considering the departmental barriers and goal conflicts between business and finance, process optimization techniques and internal management report design are employed. Through the reengineering of processes in procurement, services, and sales, as well as statistical transparency, the efficiency of information sharing and work collaboration is improved. Secondly, in response to the issue of low participation of financial personnel leading to information asymmetry, management information system technology is utilized to automate the processes of order generation, expense reimbursement, and approval payments, enhancing the supervision and support role of finance within the processes. Thirdly, to address the issue of business personnel avoiding supervision, an integrated management information system and internal transparent report design are used to improve the supervision mechanism and close management loopholes. Finally, to address the discrepancies in capabilities among business and finance personnel, systematic training and job rotation mechanisms are implemented to strengthen cross-domain skills, enhance overall capabilities and integration awareness, fundamentally reducing integration resistance and ensuring consistency in business-finance collaboration goals and efficiency improvement.

explanation.content: Regarding analysis0, considering the departmental barriers between business and finance, the conflicting objectives lead to inefficiency. By using technology0 to optimize procurement, service, and sales processes, as well as internal management reports from technology1, the collaborative difficulties were addressed through process reengineering and data division.

In response to analysis1, considering the low involvement of financial personnel and the issue of information asymmetry, optimize the process design using technology0 and technology3, leveraging management information systems to achieve information sharing on orders, expenses, reimbursements, etc., and enhance the supervision and involvement of finance in business operations.

For analysis2, considering the issues of business personnel evading regulation and concealing information, the systematic approval process of technology3 and the transparent report design of technology1 will be used to close regulatory loopholes, enhance data transparency, and achieve control over management gaps.

For analysis3, considering the varying capabilities of the finance and business departments and the lack of cross-domain skills, use technology4's training and job rotation system for finance and business personnel to improve overall capabilities through systematic learning and job rotation, promoting a shift in thinking patterns.

title: Design of the reconstruction and reinforcement scheme for existing bridges.
requirement: Design of the reconstruction and reinforcement scheme for existing bridges. In the case of a 30m prestressed concrete composite box girder bridge, where longitudinal and transverse cracks and other defects were detected, the renovation and reinforcement of the bridge shall be carried out to ensure that the bending resistance capacity and stress of the cross-section meet the requirements of the "Code for Design of Highway Reinforced Concrete and Prestressed Concrete Bridges and Culverts" (JTG 3362—2018).
solution: This article proposes a comprehensive reinforcement scheme for the modification and strengthening of existing bridges. Specifically, first, in consideration of the insufficient load-bearing capacity of the bridge and the impact of crack propagation, external prestressing technology is adopted, combining short and long tendons to enhance the overall stiffness and load-bearing capacity of the bridge. Secondly, to address the crack issues caused by insufficient prestressing and temperature gradients, steel plates are bonded to the bottom of the beams to increase the strength of the lower edge of the beams, enhance tensile capacity, and inhibit crack propagation. Experience-based calculations for the reinforcement scheme show that the positive moment bending capacity of both the mid-beam and edge beams has been significantly improved, with the main stress meeting the requirements for Class A components in regulations, making the design results reasonable and valuable for reference.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the insufficient bearing capacity of the bridge and the stiffness reduction due to crack propagation, the external prestressing method of technology0 is employed to enhance the bending stiffness of the bridge by configuring short and long tendons. At the same time, the steel plate bonding method of technology1 is used to increase the strength and bearing capacity of the box girder's bottom edge, addressing the issues of reduced stiffness and inadequate stress transfer caused by crack propagation.

For analysis1, considering the insufficient prestress and temperature gradient causing cracking at the bottom of the beam, additional prestress is applied through technology0 to improve tensile performance, combined with technology1 to further enhance fatigue performance and improve the stress conditions of the bridge to meet the regulatory requirements.

title: Research on the Design of Renovation Plans for Existing Reinforced Concrete Bridges
requirement: Research on the Design of Renovation Plans for Existing Reinforced Concrete Bridges Under the conditions of increased load, severe existing structural damage, and the need to control traffic impact, redesign the existing 16-meter span reinforced concrete bridge in Zhongshan to ensure that the modified bridge meets the highway Class I load standards, while satisfying the requirements for durability, construction economy, and minimal traffic disruption.
solution: This article presents a demolition and reconstruction design scheme for existing reinforced concrete bridges. Specifically, first, considering the limited bearing capacity problem of the piled foundation, it is recommended to use lightweight prestressed concrete T-beam technology, which reduces dead load effects and pile head reaction forces to meet the design requirements; secondly, since the number of cracks in the bridge is high, develops rapidly, and the damage is severe, it is suggested to adopt demolition and reconstruction technology, replacing the severely damaged concrete T-beams to enhance safety and durability; finally, to minimize traffic interference, a highly efficient and cost-effective prefabricated prestressed concrete T-beam scheme is adopted, ensuring construction convenience and economic viability, completing half-span maintenance construction in just 112 days.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that the modification needs to meet the Highway Class I load standards and the bearing capacity limitations of the pile foundation, it is recommended to adopt lightweight prestressed concrete T-beams and steel-concrete composite plate beam technology (technology3), which will reduce the requirements for the pile foundation by minimizing the permanent load effect, thereby meeting the design specifications.

For analysis1, the bridge has severe damage, rapid crack development, and insufficient bending and shear load-bearing capacity. The reinforcement technology is difficult to completely eliminate structural risks. It is recommended to adopt the demolition and reconstruction technology (technology2) to ensure safety and durability through a new structure.

For analysis2, to control the disruption to traffic caused by construction while meeting economic requirements, the demolition and reconstruction can utilize prefabricated prestressed concrete T-beams (technology3), which facilitate construction, reduce maintenance workload, and ensure that traffic is only partially disrupted for 112 days.

title: Design of renovation plans for old concrete road subgrade and pavement.
requirement: Design of renovation plans for old concrete road subgrade and pavement. Under the conditions of old concrete structures that are relatively thin and severely damaged, significant impacts from frost heave and spalling, and the need for jointing new and old concrete roads, complete the renovation of the subgrade and pavement of the old concrete road, ensuring that the load-bearing capacity of the renovated pavement structure is above 516.7 MPa, while also improving crack resistance and overall service life.
solution: This article proposes a reconstruction plan for old concrete highway subgrades and pavements. Specifically, first, considering that the old structure is thin and severely damaged, mechanical parameters are obtained using deflection value calculations and modeling analysis techniques, combined with the optimized design of SBS modified asphalt overlay structures to improve the bearing capacity and crack resistance of the pavement; secondly, addressing diseases such as frost heave and pumping, repair and reinforcement techniques for old concrete broken surfaces are employed, including compacting damage, laying gravel base layers, and spraying penetration oil, effectively enhancing the compressive strength of the subgrade and pavement; finally, in the junction of new and old sections, new and old concrete highway joint techniques are applied, such as replacing with the same material, adding blind ditches, and optimizing joint widths to stabilize the connection performance at the joint and ensure construction quality. By comprehensively applying such a construction plan, the bearing capacity of all sections exceeds 516.7 MPa, significantly improving the overall compressive strength and performance of the pavement, meeting the reconstruction needs under complex conditions.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that the old pavement structure is relatively thin and has poor compressive strength, technology0 is used to determine the mechanical properties of the pavement through deflection value calculation and two-dimensional modeling analysis. Combined with technology1, AC-16C type SBS modified asphalt overlay material is utilized to improve the pavement's crack resistance and load-bearing capacity.

For analysis1, considering the effects of frost heave and mud pumping issues, use technology2 for the repair of damages through crushing and reinforcement measures, including compacting the fractured surface, uniformly laying a gravel base, and spraying a primer oil, to further enhance the compressive performance of the subgrade and pavement.

For analysis2, considering the difficulties in connecting new and old roadbed and pavement, technology3 will be utilized, including replacing with the same materials as the old base layer, adding drainage blind ditches, while controlling the joint width and strengthening the joint treatment to ensure the firmness and drainage performance of the joints.

title: Design and Analysis of Smart Light Pole High-strength Lightweight Solution
requirement: Design and Analysis of Smart Light Pole High-strength Lightweight Solution Under the conditions that the lamp pole needs to simultaneously bear its own weight, additional facility loads, and wind loads, while meeting the various facility installation requirements of the city, complete the high-strength lightweight design of the smart lamp pole, requiring a maximum displacement of no more than 400mm, a maximum stress not exceeding the allowable stress of the material, and an overall lightweight rate of 21%.
solution: This article proposes a design scheme for high-strength lightweight smart lamp poles. Specifically, first, considering the challenges of deformation, insufficient strength, and instability that the lamp pole may face under its own weight and external loads, high-strength steel materials are used for replacement technology. By selecting high-strength steel with a strength of 620 MPa and reducing the wall thickness to 6 mm and 4 mm, a lightweight goal of reducing the overall mass of the pole by 21% has been achieved; second, in response to the demand for multiple facilities to be mounted and transportation and installation convenience, finite element simulation analysis technology is used to assess the stiffness, strength, and stability of the lamp pole under combined loads to validate the feasibility of the design scheme; finally, the results of the scheme show that the maximum displacement is 287 mm, the maximum stress is 556 MPa, and the first-order buckling characteristic value is 8.1, all of which meet the design specifications and actual functional requirements.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that the lamp post needs to bear its own weight and external loads (additional facilities and wind loads), and facing challenges such as deformation, insufficient strength, and instability, technology0 was employed. By selecting high-strength steel to reduce the wall thickness, the overall mass of the pole was reduced by 21% while maintaining its load-bearing capacity.

For analysis1, considering that the smart lamp pole needs to reduce its weight to lower transportation and installation costs while ensuring the capacity for multiple facilities, it may face issues of material limitations and insufficient load-bearing capacity. Therefore, using technology1, finite element simulation was employed to analyze the stiffness, strength, and stability of the lamp pole under combined loads, providing precise validation for different material options and cross-sectional dimensions to ensure rational design.

title: Design of the implementation plan for the underground tunnel passing under the existing railway station.
requirement: Design of the implementation plan for the underground tunnel passing under the existing railway station. Under the influence of shallow buried strata, complex surrounding rock, and groundwater distribution, complete the construction task of a long tunnel with a 16.1-meter span running under a railway station, ensuring the normal operation of the railway, driving safety, and structural safety of the tunnel, while also controlling the deformation of the tunnel and railway line within a reasonable range.
solution: This article presents a construction plan for shallow buried strata, complex surrounding rock conditions, and the undercrossing of existing railway stations. Specifically, first, considering the difficulties of surrounding rock fracturing and hole formation, the plan employs advanced large pipe shed support technology combined with grouting reinforcement technology to enhance the stability of the surrounding rock through pre-support and high-performance grouting body, achieving tunnel hole formation and deformation control. Secondly, in response to the operational needs of existing railway stations and the requirement for track deformation control, the plan utilizes grouting reinforcement and track fastening technology to increase the foundation stiffness and track structure strength, ensuring the normal operation and safety of the railway. Finally, combined with finite element numerical simulation technology, the plan optimizes construction through dynamic monitoring and computational verification, ensuring the safety of tunnel and railway structures in complex environments.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that the fractured surrounding rock and shallow burial conditions may make tunneling difficult, the technology0 advanced large pipe shed support technology is used to provide preliminary support, reinforcing the surrounding rock support. At the same time, technology1 grouting reinforcement technology is applied to enhance the foundation bearing capacity and the stability of the surrounding rock, achieving control over the safety of the tunnel structure.

For analysis1, considering that railway station operation needs to minimize construction disruptions, the technology1 grouting reinforcement technique is employed to reduce railway bed deformation by forming a high-performance stone body, combined with technology2 track fastening reinforcement technology to enhance the structural stiffness of the track, ensuring normal railway operation and travel safety.

For analysis2, considering the issues of groundwater seepage and the resulting soil instability, utilize technology1 grouting reinforcement technique to fill the leakage areas to prevent water damage, and perform dynamic monitoring and analysis of groundwater and ground deformation through technology3 finite element simulation technology to ensure the structural stability of the tunnel and railway.

title: Analysis of the Causes of Roadside Slope Slides Induced by Heavy Rain and Design of Remediation Plans.
requirement: Analysis of the Causes of Roadside Slope Slides Induced by Heavy Rain and Design of Remediation Plans. Under the conditions of complex slope geology, frequent heavy rainfall, and damage to the cliff face leading to a reduction in soil strength, complete the emergency management of highway cutting slope sliding and the task of permanent stabilization treatment, ensuring slope stability and preventing further landslides.
solution: This article presents a comprehensive management plan for the causes of slope slip induced by heavy rainfall. Specifically, first, considering that rainwater infiltration weakens soil strength and increases slope weight, slope unloading techniques are applied to reduce the load by adjusting the slope gradient, combined with an inclined anti-slip retaining wall to enhance slip resistance, thereby achieving a safety factor of 1.2 under heavy rainfall conditions. Second, in response to the weakened support effect of the toe slope due to landslide accumulation, grass planting and greening protection are employed on the slope surface to limit crack expansion and erosion caused by sparse vegetation. Finally, to prevent further precipitation infiltration from affecting slope stability, a system including an annular intercepting drainage ditch, platform drainage ditch, and swift flow grooves is designed, along with cement-soil sealing treatment for cracks. Through these measures, slope management has achieved the anticipated goals of slope stability and resistance to rainwater erosion.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the reduction in soil strength and the issue of water infiltration into the lubricated slope, use technology0 for slope unloading by adjusting the slope angle to reduce the weight of the slope body, while integrating technology1 for the design of inclined anti-slip retaining walls to enhance sliding resistance and improve slope stability.

For analysis1, considering the instability of the slope caused by cracks in the slide body and the fragmentation of accumulated soil, use technology2 to implement grass planting and greening protection on the slope to limit crack development, while improving the drainage system through technology3 to reduce the further impact of precipitation infiltration on the slope body.

title: Design scheme for the landscape bridge on Yuanshan Lake Avenue.
requirement: Design scheme for the landscape bridge on Yuanshan Lake Avenue. Under the conditions where the bridge needs to serve both traffic functions and aesthetic effects, with the southern side of the bridge being close to high-voltage lines and a wide river channel, complete the design and construction plan for the Yue Mountain Lake Avenue landscape bridge while meeting requirements for cost-effectiveness, safety, and integration with the landscape. The bridge design must align with the tourism theme positioning of the Wutong Lake New Area and ensure structural stability and practical construction feasibility.
solution: This article proposes the nine-arch continuous bridge as the recommended solution for Bridge No. 1 of the Moon Mountain Lake Avenue. Specifically, first, considering that the bridge needs to balance aesthetic appeal with transportation functionality, a nine-arch continuous bridge design has been chosen, utilizing reinforced concrete structures to ensure the stability of the bridge while enhancing its landscape effect through landscape design and decorative techniques. Secondly, in light of the high-voltage power line restrictions and the complex river environment, an arch bridge combined with water-based support cast-in-place construction technology has been selected, ensuring spatial utilization and construction safety through cast-in-place structures. Finally, considering economic factors and landscape integration, structural calculations have been carried out using "Bridge Doctor" to control costs and construction time, while ensuring that the bridge's performance indicators meet regulatory requirements. In summary, this plan not only meets the functional needs of Wutong Lake Avenue but also aligns closely with the surrounding waterfront greenway, water town landscape, and tourism positioning.

explanation.content: Regarding analysis0, considering that the bridge needs to balance aesthetic appeal and transportation functionality, as well as match the characteristics of the water town, technology0 and technology3 were used to achieve a harmonious unity of function and landscape through the design of a nine-hole connected arch combined with a steel decorative railing and stone surface decoration.

Regarding analysis1, considering the restrictions on the superstructure design due to the proximity of high-voltage lines to the southern side of the bridge, technology0 and technology2 were used. By selecting an arch bridge as the main bridge type and employing in-situ casting technology with aquatic support frames, the feasibility and safety of construction were ensured while taking spatial layout into account.

For analysis2, considering that the design must meet the issues of economy, safety, and landscape integration, the use of technology1 and technology2 ensured the stability of the bridge through the verification of reinforced concrete structures and reasonably controlled construction costs and timelines; at the same time, the design of the nine-hole continuous arch optimized various costs and project processes.

title: Design of a rehabilitation plan for the diseases of the movable supports of the ballasted high-speed rail continuous beam.
requirement: Design of a rehabilitation plan for the diseases of the movable supports of the ballasted high-speed rail continuous beam. Under the conditions of uneven support pads and bottom steel plates, cavities in the cast concrete of the beams, significant deformation during beam dropping in the construction process, rusting of the stainless steel plates on the pier tops, and accumulation of a large amount of debris, complete the remediation of the high-speed rail continuous beam movable support issues to ensure railway transport safety and normal bridge operation.
solution: This article presents a plan for the remediation of damage to movable supports of high-speed rail continuous beams with ballast. Specifically, first, considering the issues of uneven bearing pads and steel plates at the bottom of the beams, as well as the presence of voids in the cast concrete of the beams, a concrete defect repair technology will be used to remove the honeycomb concrete layer, inject mortar, and reinforce the interface to repair the bridge's foundational structure; second, to address the risk of support deformation during construction when the beam falls, synchronous jacking technology will be employed to precisely control the lifting force and height (10 mm), ensuring smooth construction; third, to solve the problems of debris accumulation on pier tops and abnormal sliding of supports due to stainless steel plate rusting, new force-expanding steel plates and high-precision supports will be designed and installed, ensuring construction accuracy through specialized grouting and fine adjustment; additionally, to address insufficient support at the bottom of the beams and the risk of voids, temporary support technology will be applied to provide force distribution support to the beams, preventing secondary damage during construction. The entire construction plan significantly reduces the impact on high-speed rail operations by ensuring railway transport safety and bridge structural stability while conducting rapid work with only two maintenance windows.

explanation.content: For analysis0, taking into account the issues of support voids and poor concrete consolidation, use technology0 for comprehensive defect repair of the concrete at the bottom of the beam. Address the issue of concrete hollowness through methods such as chipping away the defective layer, grouting, and surface repair to ensure the stability of the foundation.

For analysis 1, considering the issue of shear deformation of supports caused by unstable construction processes, technology 1, namely the synchronous jacking technology, is used to smoothly control the jacking force and height (10 mm) to reduce shear deformation during construction.

For analysis2, considering the issues of debris accumulation on the pier top and abnormal bearing sliding, technology3 is used in conjunction with cleaning the pier top and installing new stainless steel plates. Through professional construction and leveling assembly, the sliding performance of the bearing is restored.

For analysis3, considering the issues of voids and structural weaknesses in the concrete at the bottom of the beam, use technology2 to set up temporary supports and add reinforcement steel plates to prevent secondary damage to the beam during the lifting or replacement process, and ensure safety through stress dispersion design.

title: Design and research on the widening renovation plan for the Shanghai-Chongqing Expressway bridge in the future.
requirement: Design and research on the widening renovation plan for the Shanghai-Chongqing Expressway bridge in the future. Over the bridge of the Shanghai-Chongqing Expressway, complete the bridge widening modification task under complex boundary conditions, taking into account the passage of vehicles on the highway below, the protection of national defense optical cables, and high-pressure gas pipelines, as well as future demands for highway widening, ultimately achieving a bidirectional six-lane design, and constructing a pedestrian bridge to enhance traffic conditions and overall aesthetics.
solution: This article proposes a bridge widening modification plan. Specifically, first, considering the protection of high-speed traffic and related equipment under the bridge, a separated lower structure design is used. Independent bridge foundations for widening are set up to avoid interference with existing facilities while reserving conditions for highway widening. Second, in addressing the connection issues between the old and new bridges, a wet joint connection technology and a single-box single-chamber prestressed concrete box beam widening scheme, coordinated with the unit width moment of inertia, are adopted to ensure smoothness of the bridge and achieve load coordination. Finally, for functional expansion and aesthetic needs, a steel box beam pedestrian bridge combined with a bridge architectural tower is implemented, forming a modified structure of a two-way six-lane road coupled with a pedestrian bridge, simultaneously enhancing the area's landscape effect.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the need to protect the Shanghai-Chongqing Expressway and the facilities above and below the bridge site, use technology2 to implement a separated lower structure design, independently arranging the widened bridge foundation to avoid interference with existing facilities, while reserving conditions for future highway widening.

For analysis1, considering that the new and old bridge structures need to be connected but the lower parts need to be separated, technology0 and technology1 were used to connect the upper bridge through wet joints, along with a design that widens the single-cell, single-chamber box beam coordinated with the width inertia moment, thus resolving the issues of smoothness and deformation coordination.

For analysis 2, considering functional expansion and landscape design, use technology 3 and technology 4 to enhance passage capacity while ensuring aesthetics through the construction of new pedestrian steel box girders and building towers.

title: Design and application of traffic diversion schemes for construction sections in airport arrival areas.
requirement: Design and application of traffic diversion schemes for construction sections in airport arrival areas. Under the condition that construction requires the occupation of some road resources in the airport B arrival area, complete the traffic diversion task to ensure the normal operation of the airport arrival area traffic system, meeting the requirements for public transportation operations, vehicle and pedestrian passage, and peak period demand.
solution: This article proposes a traffic diversion plan for the construction section of the airport arrival area. Specifically, first, considering that the construction occupying the B arrival area may affect vehicle flow and traffic functions, a phased construction diversion plan is implemented, adjusting vehicle flow and parking points to ensure the functional area gradually recovers; secondly, in response to the congestion risk caused by overflow of taxis during peak night hours, a tidal lane borrowing measure is implemented, utilizing one lane of Airport Avenue West to solve the queue overflow problem; finally, combined with scenario analysis methods to predict the impact of construction on road traffic capacity, calculations and analyses are performed for different traffic flow scenarios to ensure that major roads meet service levels of grade C and above, ensuring the normal operation of the arrival area's traffic functions.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that the construction occupying the pedestrian and auxiliary road in area B may affect vehicle flow and public transportation parking, potentially causing congestion, technology1 is adopted to alleviate the situation by implementing phased construction to adjust vehicle parking locations and traffic paths, allowing for a gradual recovery of functional areas and ensuring orderly operation of traffic flow.

In response to analysis1, considering that the overflow of taxis during peak night hours may lead to congestion on Airport Avenue West, technology0 is adopted to implement tidal lane borrowing measures. One lane of Airport Avenue West will be temporarily borrowed to alleviate the pressure of queuing overflow and ensure smooth traffic during peak hours.

For analysis0 and analysis1, considering the potential decrease in traffic capacity on Airport Avenue during construction, scenario analysis using technology2 is conducted to predict the saturation and service levels under future traffic flow changes, ensuring that the mitigation plan meets Class C and above service requirements.

title: Discussion on the Key Points of the Design of Mechanical Bus Stereoscopic Parking Garage solution
requirement: Discussion on the Key Points of the Design of Mechanical Bus Stereoscopic Parking Garage solution Under the conditions of limited land resources, large bus sizes, height restrictions, and peak access demands, complete the design of a mechanical bus parking garage, including the design of the overall layout, selection of parking equipment, parameter determination, and efficiency optimization, to address issues such as difficulty in parking buses, low safety, and low scheduling efficiency.
solution: This article proposes a comprehensive design scheme for a mechanical multi-story bus parking garage. Specifically, first, considering the challenges of limited land resources and insufficient parking spaces, it employs vertical lifting and simple lifting technologies, gradually addressing storage needs by maximizing the utilization of space; second, in response to the large size of buses and height restrictions, it flexibly applies different types of garage technologies based on varying site conditions to achieve an optimal combination of height limitations and performance; third, to tackle traffic complexity and utilization efficiency, it incorporates a multi-entrance and exit design with a right-in-right-out control mode during peak times to avoid traffic conflicts through reasonable traffic optimization; finally, addressing the efficiency of vehicle retrieval during peak hours, it relies on intelligent operation and management technologies to prioritize the scheduling of vehicle storage and retrieval processes, meeting various demands for peak efficiency and nighttime charging, thereby laying an important technical foundation for the intensive and efficient development of bus multi-story garages.

explanation.content: In response to analysis0, considering the tight land resources and parking difficulties, using technology0 and technology1, the problem of insufficient storage space for buses has been effectively addressed through the use of vertical lift and simple lift-type public transport multi-story parking technologies, making efficient use of limited land.

For analysis1, considering the large size of buses and height restrictions, adopt technology0, technology1, and technology2 respectively, designing suitable garage types based on different land conditions, and achieving a balance between height restrictions and parking requirements through the reasonable selection of equipment types.

In response to analysis2, considering the complex traffic at the construction site and the need for operational safety, technology3 is used to design multiple entry and exit points, and traffic flow is optimized through signal control, addressing the issues of low entry and exit efficiency and traffic conflicts.

For analysis3, considering the high demand for parking access efficiency during peak hours, technology4 is used, combined with intelligent operation and management techniques, to optimize the priority mode for parking and exiting vehicles during peak times, achieving maximum efficiency and efficient operation of nighttime charging and rotation work.

title: Design Analysis of a Certain Hub Interchange Scheme
requirement: Design Analysis of a Certain Hub Interchange Scheme In the intersecting sections of a bidirectional six-lane and bidirectional four-lane highway, complete the design optimization task for the traffic flow lines in the A-C direction and B-C direction, ensuring the rationality of the merging and diverging of ramps with the mainline, coordinating the traffic capacity and service level between ramps and the mainline, addressing potential congestion and safety risks caused by excessive traffic flow, achieving or exceeding the design requirements of service level D, while also reducing the land area and cost of the project.
solution: This article presents a design scheme for hub interchange aimed at optimizing traffic flow lines in both the A-C and B-C directions. Specifically, first, considering the large traffic flow in the A-C direction that may exceed standards, the ramp layout needs to be optimized using a merging and diverging flow approach, adopting a Y-shaped mainline merging and diverging structure to address the coordination issues between the mainline and ramps; second, in light of the large traffic flow in the merging area of the A-C direction, a technical method is employed to scientifically verify the traffic performance of the connection points between the ramps and the mainline, optimizing the design through parameters like PFM values to ensure service level compliance; finally, to tackle the vehicle concentration problem caused by high flow in the diverging area, techniques are applied to optimize ramp entrance and exit designs and reasonably control the service level in the diverging interference zone, ensuring the minimum service level of the ramp entrance and exit reaches level D, and ensuring smooth operation between the ramps and the mainline, thereby achieving a comprehensive enhancement of traffic safety, fluidity, and economy.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that the flow from direction A to C exceeding the design limit may lead to ramp congestion, while the flow from direction B to C is low and needs to maintain the continuity of the main line, technology0 is applied. By using a Y-shaped mainline merging structure, the layout of ramps in both directions is optimized. The ramp connection is adopted for the A-C direction, while the continuous mainline form is used for the B-C direction, thereby coordinating the traffic demands from different directions.

For analysis1, considering that the flow rate in the merging area from A to B exceeds the standard value, there is a risk of concentrated traffic flow. By using technology1, the parameters such as the PFM value and Q12 value of the merging area will be scientifically calculated to assess traffic performance, optimize the connection form between the on-ramp and the mainline, ensuring that the traffic capacity of the merging area meets the standards and avoiding actual congestion.

For analysis2, considering that the high traffic volume in the diversion area may lead to congestion issues, technology2 is adopted to enhance the service level of the ramp entrances and exits through design optimization and service level control, improving the service level of the diversion interference area to D level or above, ensuring smooth traffic flow in the diversion area.

title: Design and analysis of the reinforcement scheme for a certain steel box girder suspension bridge.
requirement: Design and analysis of the reinforcement scheme for a certain steel box girder suspension bridge. Under the conditions of a main span of 1108m and significant local cracks and weld issues at the anchor points of the steel box girder suspension bridge, complete the design and implementation of the reinforcement plan to ensure the effective reduction of stress at the crack locations and the safe operation of the bridge.
solution: This article proposes a reinforcement plan for a certain steel box girder suspension bridge. Specifically, first, considering the severe crack issues and welding quality defects at the supports of the main span of 1108m, the cow leg stiffening extension technology is used to optimize the design of the end cross girder cow leg stiffening, reducing stress concentration by extending it to 0.1m away from the bottom plate. Second, to address the stress concentration at the junction of the cross girder stiffening and the longitudinal stiffening, arc corner stiffening technology is applied, replacing the original 10mm steel plate with a 16mm plate, while setting up arc corners specifically to reduce stress concentration. Finally, to create a more integrated structural loading, the longitudinal stiffener is extended to the top plate and welded to it, while ensuring construction quality, especially during the overhead welding process. Ultimately, all reinforcement measures reduce the maximum stress at the crack from 543MPa to 46MPa, effectively maintaining the safe operation of the steel box girder suspension bridge for many years.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the main span of 1108m, the concentration of cracks in specific locations, and the poor quality of weld treatment, technology0 is used to reduce stress concentration and minimize the risk of further crack propagation by extending the strut stiffening technique.

For analysis1, considering the significant stress concentration at the supports under fatigue loading, technology1 is used to optimize the stress distribution by setting up arc-shaped steel plates, while also enhancing fatigue performance.

In response to analysis2, considering the limited construction environment and difficulties in welding, use technology2 to enhance the overall mechanical performance of this area through longitudinal diaphragm welding technology, while strictly controlling the welding quality to avoid secondary hazards.

title: Analysis of the causes of water ingress in a certain tunnel and the design of a drainage tunnel scheme.
requirement: Analysis of the causes of water ingress in a certain tunnel and the design of a drainage tunnel scheme. Under the conditions of karst development, complex underground river pipelines, severe changes in surface water conditions, and construction blasting disturbances, complete the design for water inflow management in the Chuan Dong Tunnel, ensuring the safety of tunnel construction and operation, further improving the tunnel drainage system, and reducing drainage risks.
solution: This article proposes a drainage tunnel solution for the water inflow problem in the Chuanlong Tunnel. Specifically, first, considering the development of karst and the complex water storage structures that may lead to sudden mud inflow, the technical reform includes a special hydrological investigation and support design to comprehensively assess the karst and underground river system, and adopts an anchor-spray composite lining structure to ensure the stability of the surrounding rock. Secondly, to address safety hazards brought by heavy rainfall and concentrated underground water pressure, a drainage tunnel is laid in parallel on the right side of the main tunnel, utilizing a drainage channel designed with a baseline spacing of 43.5 meters and a slope of -2.25% to ensure a maximum inflow capacity of 676,000 m³/day. Finally, a water collection corridor is set up to direct concentrated influx to the drainage tunnel outlet, and a gate grid protection design is employed to achieve effective drainage while ensuring convenience for later maintenance, ultimately improving drainage capacity and ensuring the safety of tunnel operations.

explanation.content: In response to analysis0, considering the risk of water inrush and mud due to karst development and water storage structures, conduct a special hydrogeological investigation using technology0 to reveal the distribution of underground river pipelines and fracture zones, and use technology3 to optimize the support structure to reduce tunnel safety risks.

For analysis1, considering that concentrated heavy rainfall and the surge of groundwater from hidden rivers may cause flooding, the use of technology2 for drainage corridor technology will divert groundwater into drainage tunnels, ensuring that the pressure of the drainage system is controllable.

For analysis2 and analysis3, considering the concentrated water flow path formed by the drainage hole and blasting interference, the drainage hole scheme of technology1 is adopted, combined with the topographical conditions to ensure the reasonable design of the drainage hole's net distance and longitudinal slope, thereby mitigating sudden inflow.

For analysis4, considering the risk of a rapid water level rise after the blockage of the underground river, design a large-section drainage tunnel with high drainage capacity using technology1, combined with technology2 for quick diversion and pressure reduction, to ensure that the main tunnel is not affected.

title: Design and comparison of a certain highway interchange scheme.
requirement: Design and comparison of a certain highway interchange scheme. At the intersection of the Zengtian Expressway and Yonglong Avenue, design and select a long-term feasible interchange scheme that considers the terrain, physical features, and land use conditions. Under the constraints, address the challenges posed by the elevation difference between the expressway main line and the intersecting road, which limits ramp slope and land use, while also meeting traffic volume demands and reducing impacts on the surrounding environment.
solution: This article proposes a single horn + inverted T-shaped interchange scheme. Specifically, first, considering that the complex terrain and spatial limitations may restrict the layout of ramps, a compact circular ramp design is adopted to effectively control space usage through optimized layout methods. Second, to address the issue of steep gradients between the high-speed main line and Yonglong Avenue that may limit ramp slope, the optimization of the circular ramp alignment ensures that the ramp design meets slope regulations while achieving a shorter total ramp length. Finally, in response to regional land use restrictions and farmland protection requirements, reasonable ramp configuration and reduced land occupancy minimize the impact on the surrounding environment and land resources, achieving an effective combination of economy, functionality, and sustainability.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that complex terrain and spatial limitations may restrict the layout of the ramps, a compact layout using technology0 was adopted. By employing a single trumpet shape and a circular ramp design, flexible space utilization was achieved, reducing the impact of insufficient clearance.

Regarding analysis1, considering the significant elevation difference and limited slope between the high-speed mainline and Yonglong Avenue, technology0 is used to optimize the alignment of the circular ramp. The ramp meets the maximum slope condition of 4%, and the total length is 3881 meters, which is shorter than other options and effectively reduces construction costs.

For analysis2, considering the land use restrictions and farmland protection requirements in the area, technology0 is adopted, which reduces the land area to 303,000.2 square meters and lowers the basic farmland occupancy to 44,400 square meters, making it more compliant with environmental protection and land use policies than other options.

title: Design of the super-large bridge construction heavy-load trestle and drilling platform for the Maojiacun Reservoir.
requirement: Design of the super-large bridge construction heavy-load trestle and drilling platform for the Maojiacun Reservoir. In Maojiacun Reservoir, Qujing City, Yunnan Province, with a water depth of 24m and a complex construction environment, a 230m long trestle bridge must support bi-directional passage of heavy vehicles weighing up to 130t, while meeting the requirements for the strength and stiffness of the bridge deck and structure. Additionally, a drilling platform must be designed in parallel that can support a working load of 120t for the drilling rig, completing the design and calculation tasks for the construction trestle and drilling platform.
solution: This article presents the design scheme for the construction of the Maojia Village Reservoir's super-large bridge, specifically, first, considering the deep water at the construction site and the long span of the trestle, which may face issues with the setting of expansion joints and the stability of the long bridge, a three-linked structural design with steel sections and Bailey beam main structures is adopted, solving the construction difficulties through segmented design and the layout of expansion joints; second, in response to the complex geological conditions that may affect the stability of the steel pipe piles, the design technology of steel pipe pile foundations is employed, and the pile length is reasonably designed according to the standard values of side resistance and end resistance; finally, addressing the potential issue of insufficient bridge strength caused by the heavy loads of construction vehicles, refined modeling and elastic connections are used to mimic actual working conditions, verifying the structural strength and stability, ultimately achieving safe and economical construction guarantees for the trestle and platform.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that the construction site is a deep-water area and the length of the trestle is long, the truss structure design of technology0 and the steel main beam and Bailey beam structure of technology1 were utilized. Through reasonable arrangement of expansion joints and design of sub-main beams, the issues of main beam expansion and load passage were solved.

For analysis1, considering the requirements for steel pipe pile foundations in complex geological environments, technology3 steel pipe pile design is adopted. The reasonable determination of pile depth and embedded points is based on the calculation of stratum resistance to ensure that the stability and axial load capacity of the pile foundation meet construction requirements.

For analysis2, considering the enormous load of construction vehicles, design the main beam of the bridge deck and drilling rig platform using technology1 and technology4, while incorporating the elastic connection treatment of technology2 and the refined finite element analysis of technology5 to ensure that the strength and deflection design of the bridge deck and main beam meet the regulatory standards under the impact of heavy vehicles.

title: Research on the design scheme of the Fen Shi Expressway interchange hub.
requirement: Research on the design scheme of the Fen Shi Expressway interchange hub. Under the conditions of eroded bedrock in low and medium mountainous areas, the presence of distributed mineral resources, and a high forecast for future traffic volumes, complete the design task for the Jiaokou hub, which includes optimizing the hub type, ramp layout, and assessing the impact of overlying resources, ensuring smooth traffic transfer, minimizing resource conflicts, and achieving a balance between feasibility and economic viability of the plan.
solution: This article presents a recommended plan for the design of the Jiao Kuo hub, specifically the modified alfalfa leaf type plan two. Specifically, first, considering the erosion of the bedrock in the low and middle mountainous areas and the complex distribution of mining areas, which may lead to construction difficulties and resource conflicts, a design combining the modified double T type plan and part of the modified alfalfa leaf type plan is proposed. This design, placed east of the Xi Highway and shifted overall northward, mitigates the impact of geological constraints; second, to address the issue of long detour distances for main traffic flows, the modified alfalfa leaf type plan two eliminates the circular ramp and optimizes the design of primary and secondary traffic flows, reducing detour distances and ensuring smooth vehicle operation; finally, regarding the safety issues of overlying mineral resources and mined-out areas, this plan reduces the risk of mining resource pressure and structural safety by designing the bridge layout to avoid the mined-out area of Zhenghua Coal Industry and arranging the ramp that passes through the boundary of the open-pit aluminum mine at Niucao Gully. Based on the above optimizations, this article recommends the modified alfalfa leaf type plan two as the preferred option to achieve a balance between the efficiency and economy of the Jiao Kuo hub design.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the challenges posed by the distribution of eroded bedrock in the low and mid-mountain areas and mining regions on hub layout, technology0 was employed, which, by being laid out on the east side of the Xu Highway and utilizing the terrain slope, reduced the length and scale of the mainline tunnel, and initially addressed the constraints of geological and land resources.

For analysis 1, considering the main traffic flow is between Xixian and Fenyang, there is a problem with the long detour distance. Using technology 1, by optimizing the design of the ramp layout and separating the main and secondary traffic flows, the detour distance for the main flow was reduced by 360m and 890m, thereby improving traffic conversion efficiency and smoothness.

For analysis2, considering the complexity of mineral resource distribution and mined-out areas, using technology1, the arrangement of ramps avoids the mined-out area of Zhenghua Coal Industry and circumvents the mining area of bauxite in Niucao Gully, ensuring the safety of the bridge structure and minimizing the resource overlay.

title: Design and research of the interchange scheme at the Baoling interchange on the Shu-Yu Expressway.
requirement: Design and research of the interchange scheme at the Baoling interchange on the Shu-Yu Expressway. Under the conditions of significant traffic volume growth, the need to connect tourism areas, and the requirements for natural environment protection, complete the design of the Huhang Expressway Balin Interchange, ensuring safety, economy, energy efficiency, and environmental protection, while meeting future traffic demands and optimizing the connection with surrounding road networks and tourism areas.
solution: This article presents a design proposal for the Eight Ridge Interchange on the Hu-Yu Expressway, with specific details as follows: First, considering the issues of multiple turning points, long ramps, and local traffic impacts, an A-type trumpet interchange layout is designed. By optimizing the main line (1,365 m) and the ramp alignment, local traffic interference is minimized. Second, in response to the significant growth in traffic volume, an optimized L-shaped ramp design (total length 1,543.172 m) and a 3-in-5-out layout for the toll plaza are adopted to enhance traffic diversion capacity and avoid congestion. Lastly, addressing the need for connecting tourist areas and ecological environment protection, ramps are designed to directly connect the planned tourist road from the at-grade intersection. An integrated scoring evaluation system is used to optimize environmental compatibility based on four indicators: alignment, economy, energy conservation, and environmental protection. The assessment results indicate that Scheme One performs better than Scheme Two across all indicators and is ultimately recommended as the best design scheme to meet long-term traffic demands and tourism development needs.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the conditions of multiple interchanges, long ramps, and large engineering quantities, use technology0 to optimize the layout design of Type A trumpet interchange, reasonably arrange the ramps and toll stations to reduce disturbances to local traffic and the environment, while ensuring diversion capacity.

In response to analysis1, considering the significant increase in future traffic volume leading to the risk of overload on the ramp and toll station, technology1 is used to reasonably set up a longer L ramp (1,543.172 m) and a toll plaza with high capacity (3 in and 5 out) to optimize traffic flow diversion and improve future carrying capacity.

For analysis2, considering the need for tourist vehicles to quickly access the tourist area via ramps, use technology1 to design an L ramp that connects directly to the tourist highway, and optimize the connectivity between the tourist area and the main line using a concentrated intersection diversion method. At the same time, use technology2's comprehensive evaluation system to ensure coordination between environmental protection and planning requirements.

title: Discussion on the Design of a Solution for the Repair of Erosion Damage on Roadbed Slopes Using Foam Concrete.
requirement: Discussion on the Design of a Solution for the Repair of Erosion Damage on Roadbed Slopes Using Foam Concrete. Under the conditions of loose soil on the slope, poor erosion resistance (IP≤10, qu<100 kPa), and significant rainfall erosion, complete the repair task of erosion damage on the highway subgrade slope, ensuring the stability of the slope and preventing further erosion and collapse.
solution: This article proposes a design scheme for the repair of erosion damage on embankment slopes using foam concrete. Specifically, first, considering the loose soil in the slope and its poor erosion resistance (IP≤10, qu<100 kPa), as well as the actual conditions of strong rainfall causing erosion damage, foam concrete filling technology (technology0) is adopted. Through layered and segmented construction, utilizing the lightweight, good fluidity, and high load-bearing characteristics of foam concrete, the self-weight of the embankment structure is effectively reduced, preventing differential settlement and enhancing slope stability. Secondly, a gravity-type foam concrete retaining wall design (technology1) is employed, adjusting parameters such as wall density, width, and height to allow the wall's own weight to resist the active pressure of the soil, ensuring the wall’s anti-sliding performance meets the K_s≥1.3 standard. Finally, to further prevent the sliding and erosion damage of the soil cover on the surface of the retaining wall, landscaping with grass and a stepped structure (technology2) is used. The retaining wall surface is covered with 300 mm thick clay and landscaped with grass, while a step of 15 cm wide and 10 cm high is set to improve the stability of the surface soil, achieving long-term stability upgrades for the slope.

explanation.content: In response to analysis0, considering the weak erosion resistance of the roadbed slope and its vulnerability to rain erosion damage, the technology0 foam concrete filling technique is employed, which effectively improves the filling quality and soil stability of the slope through layer-by-layer and segmental filling. At the same time, foam concrete has the characteristics of being lightweight, having good fluidity, and excellent load-bearing performance, which can significantly reduce the self-weight of the roadbed structure, decrease lateral displacement, and enhance the durability of the slope structure.

For analysis0, considering the low plasticity index and unconfined compressive strength of the slope soil, as well as the significant scouring effect of rainfall, a gravity foam concrete retaining wall was designed using technology1. The weight of the wall and its anti-slip stability meet the stability requirements, with specific dimensions adjusted based on calculations to ensure economic efficiency and structural stability.

For analysis0, considering that the surface soil may be affected by external sliding forces and erosion after slope repair, and supplemented by technology2, further enhance the stability of the surface cover soil and improve the overall erosion resistance by applying surface clay coverage and greening, as well as incorporating step structures in the design of retaining walls.

title: Design study of the reconstruction plan for the Liuxi River Bridge main span.
requirement: Design study of the reconstruction plan for the Liuxi River Bridge main span. Under the conditions of partially constructed foundations at the bridge site, land use restrictions for the embankment, high landscape and environmental protection requirements, and complex geological conditions, complete the design and reconstruction tasks for the main bridge of the Liuxi River Bridge, ensuring it meets traffic functional requirements, coordinates with the surrounding environment, and enhances economic efficiency.
solution: This article presents a reconstruction plan for a single-span 125-meter through arch concrete tied arch bridge as the main bridge. Specifically, first, considering the partially constructed foundations and structural conditions, the technology of a through concrete tied arch bridge and overall box-shaped cross-section design is adopted. By reusing existing substructures and optimizing the main beam height, cost savings and longitudinal slope optimization are achieved; secondly, in response to the height difference restrictions of the dam top and aesthetic requirements, an arch bridge curve design is employed to balance functionality and scenic beauty; additionally, addressing complex geological conditions and water source protection requirements, precise rod arrangements and arch rib structural reinforcement designs are utilized to ensure the bridge's stability and environmental friendliness; finally, through optimizing construction techniques to reduce interference with the construction environment, a bridge reconstruction plan that balances economy, aesthetics, and efficiency is provided.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the limitations of the original bridge position, the constructed foundation, and the deformation issues of the zero block, a type 0 cantilever reinforced concrete tied arch bridge will be used in conjunction with technology 1 for the overall box cross-section design to optimize the bridge structure, fully utilize the existing foundation, and achieve stable loading.

For analysis1, considering the restrictions on the net height of the dam crest and the longitudinal slope issue, technology0 is used to reduce the height of the main beam, while technology1 is employed for the optimized design of the stringer to reduce the longitudinal slope, meeting the linear requirements of the bridge and improving driving comfort.

For analysis2, considering the high landscape requirements of the tourist resort, combine the aesthetic design of the arch bridge curve with the composite landscape requirements of technology0, while optimizing the process in the construction plan to reduce the impact on the surrounding environment.

For analysis3, considering the settlement risks brought by the complex geological conditions of the bridge site, a design using technology2 reinforced concrete arch ribs and technology3 hangers is adopted, enhancing the bridge's stability and durability through precise stress distribution and structural optimization.

title: A Brief Discussion on the Design of Traffic Relief Plan during the Construction Period of Municipal Works in the Old City Area.
requirement: A Brief Discussion on the Design of Traffic Relief Plan during the Construction Period of Municipal Works in the Old City Area. Under the conditions of significant land use restrictions, high demands for protection of poles, pipelines, and trees, saturated current traffic volumes, and involvement of important bus stops and plot entrances, complete the design of the traffic diversion plan during the municipal engineering construction period in the old urban area, ensuring traffic flow capacity, safety, and construction progress.
solution: This article proposes a plan for traffic management during municipal engineering construction in old urban areas. Specifically, first, considering that land use restrictions may complicate detour road design, step-by-step enclosure technology and typical cross-section design are utilized to achieve a balance between road traffic capacity and construction needs through phased enclosures and reasonable arrangement of construction sections. Secondly, to address congestion issues that may arise from saturated traffic flow, a traffic diversion design is implemented to alleviate pressure in the construction area by guiding traffic through the regional road network. Thirdly, for the construction areas involving bus routes and stops, temporary bus stops and route optimization techniques are employed to ensure normal bus operations through route adjustments and stop placements. Finally, simulation optimization technology is used to refine the details of the plan, enhancing overall traffic safety and efficiency, ensuring efficient traffic organization and convenience for residents during construction.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that land use restrictions may limit the design of temporary diversion roads, technology0 phased enclosure technology was employed. By implementing phased enclosures and optimizing the occupied width, efficient utilization of road resources was achieved.

Regarding analysis1, considering the high demand for pole and line protection which may cause detours, combined with technology0 and technology3, avoid important facilities and ensure construction requirements through reasonable layout of construction enclosures and typical cross-section designs.

For analysis2, considering that high traffic flow may lead to congestion risks, technology1 traffic diversion design technology is employed to eliminate the main traffic pressure by choosing diversion routes and arranging guiding signs to disperse the flow.

For analysis3, considering that the bus stop and the entrances and exits of the plot may cause disruptions in circulation, use technology2 for temporary bus stops and route optimization. By negotiating with the bus company to adjust the routes and add temporary stops, maintain the normal operation of public transportation in the area. At the same time, combined with the principles of diversion and prioritizing slow-moving traffic, ensure that the needs of residents and students for pickups and drop-offs are met.

title: Design and structural calculations for the overpass at Impression City in Jinan.
requirement: Design and structural calculations for the overpass at Impression City in Jinan. Under the conditions of a small span of the side span, complex geology, and complex load effects, complete the design and structural verification of the Jinan Impression City overpass, ensuring structural safety, durability, and compliance with relevant standards.
solution: This article presents the design and verification plan for the pedestrian bridge at Jinan Impression City. Specifically, first, considering that the ratio of edge spans to mid-span may lead to negative reaction issues, a counterweight technology was adopted for the edge spans, and the problem of bearing detachment was resolved by setting up ear plate limit devices and optimizing counterweight design. Secondly, in response to high load demands in a busy commercial area, steel box girder bridge design technology and stepped design techniques were employed, utilizing high-strength steel Q355qD and meticulous design to ensure that the bridge meets requirements for load, deflection, and natural frequency. Finally, addressing complex geological conditions and deep pile foundation requirements, pier pile foundation design technology was applied, ensuring reliability and normal operational status through crack resistance verification and load-bearing capacity checks.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the challenge of negative power caused by the small edge-to-span ratio, the technology0 edge span weight-increase technique was adopted. By adjusting the gravity of the bridge's edge span and setting up limit devices on the ear plates, the problem of bearing voiding was successfully resolved and safety margins were improved.

For analysis1, considering the challenge of high load that bridges need to withstand in busy traffic areas, technology1 and technology3 are adopted. By optimizing the design of steel box girders and enhancing stairway design, the structural stability and user comfort of the bridge under high loads and crowd effects are ensured.

In response to analysis2, considering the challenges posed by complex geological conditions that may lead to insufficient bearing capacity of the pile foundation, technology2 is used to design a pile foundation with good crack resistance and bearing capacity that meets standards. Through verification calculations and layered parameter optimization, the stability and reliability of the pile foundation are ensured.

title: Design of the Intelligent Traffic System for Phase One of the Jining City Expressway Project
requirement: Design of the Intelligent Traffic System for Phase One of the Jining City Expressway Project Under the conditions of lagging signal control, insufficient coverage of monitoring systems, and a lack of construction experience, design an intelligent traffic system for the first phase of the expressway project in Jining City. This system must include subsystems such as video monitoring, traffic information collection, intelligent checkpoints, entrance ramp control, information guidance release, traffic signal control, and automatic red-light violation recording. It must also interface with the urban intelligent traffic command system to ensure safe and efficient traffic management and service levels.
solution: This article presents an intelligent traffic system solution for the first phase of the expressway project in Jining City. Specifically, first, considering the challenge of a lack of coordinated signal control systems, multipoint coordinated signal control technology is used to improve the network's passing efficiency by optimizing signal cycles and green signal ratios; secondly, to address the shortcoming of low coverage of traffic video monitoring, aerial and segmented video monitoring technologies are employed to achieve comprehensive monitoring of expressway traffic; then, facing the issue of building an intelligent traffic system for the expressway from the ground up, technologies such as intelligent checkpoints, entrance ramp control, and information induction release are leveraged to enhance traffic control and information services on the expressway; finally, to meet the demand for secure data and video resource exchange, government data security exchange technology is adopted to establish a seamless docking mechanism with the public security platform.

explanation.content: In response to analysis0, considering the challenge of the lack of interactivity in the signal control system, technology0 multi-point interlocking signal coordination control technology is used to solve the issues of non-unified signal control and low traffic efficiency through adaptive signal coordination.

In response to analysis1, considering the challenges of low coverage rate of traffic video surveillance and insufficient equipment availability, the use of technology1 for elevated and segmented traffic video monitoring has improved the accuracy and coverage of surveillance by comprehensively covering all monitored blind spots.

For analysis2, considering the challenges of developing an intelligent expressway system from scratch, the technology2 intelligent toll system, along with the technology3 entrance ramp control system, has been combined with the technology4 information induction release system to enhance the vehicle passage control and induction management functions on the expressway.

In response to analysis3, considering the challenges of secure data and video resource exchange, technology6 data and video secure exchange technology has been utilized. By integrating the public security intranet and exchange mechanisms, the security of data transmission and the efficiency of command and scheduling have been optimized.

title: Research on the Design of the Qingkouyuan Interchange Plan
requirement: Research on the Design of the Qingkouyuan Interchange Plan Under the conditions of considering ecological protection, control factors, and future traffic distribution in the micro-hill area, complete the design task for the Qingkouyuan interchange to achieve rapid traffic conversion between Provincial Road S223 (Xianqing Line) and Provincial Road S210.
solution: This article proposes three design schemes for the Qingkouyuan interchange and recommends the optimal scheme through comprehensive comparison. Specifically, first, considering the challenges of insufficient construction space and significant environmental impact due to the undulating terrain and ecological protection requirements, a single trumpet interchange design technique is proposed to conform to the terrain characteristics through the design of merging and diverging flows (with a ramp length of 1.569 km and a total land area of 14.19 hm²); second, in response to the issue of the tunnel entrance being too close to the intersection, it is recommended to use diamond interchanges and "tunnel to embankment" technology to optimize vehicle safety (with a ramp length of 1.182 km, occupying 13.51 hm²); finally, to reduce project scale and cost, T-shaped at-grade intersection technology is proposed, which, while having the smallest scale (total land area of 9.34 hm²), also has the lowest traffic capacity and service level. Through the comparison of the economic and technical indicators of the three plans and qualitative evaluation, it is ultimately recommended to adopt the diamond interchange and "tunnel to embankment" technology (Technology 1), which is moderate in land use and cost, possesses excellent traffic capacity, and is conducive to future development in the Qingkouyuan area, helping to resolve regional traffic transfer issues.

explanation.content: In response to analysis0, considering the conditions of terrain fluctuations and ecological protection, there may be challenges of insufficient construction space and significant environmental impact. Therefore, using technology0 (single horn intercommunication technology) can reduce the land occupation and adapt to the terrain features through the design of merging and splitting flows, while effectively alleviating mainline traffic pressure.

Regarding analysis1, considering the issue of the distance being too short between the Friendship Tunnel entrance and the intersection, which may lead to insufficient sight distance and poor traffic conversion, the use of technology1 (diamond interchange and tunnel "cave modified roadbed" technology) has optimized vehicle driving safety by eliminating the tunnel and extending the transformation range of the Xianqing Line.

For analysis2, considering the distribution of future traffic volumes, especially the changes in different traffic flow directions, it is necessary to design different channel capacities. Therefore, technology1 (diamond interchange and tunnel "cave-to-embankment" technology) is used to optimize the distribution of ramps to meet traffic demand while balancing project costs and environmental impacts, ultimately being selected as the recommended solution.

title: Design and Construction Methods for Coastal Oyster Reef Projects in Ports
requirement: Design and Construction Methods for Coastal Oyster Reef Projects in Ports In the context of the global decline and degradation of oyster reefs, restore the ecological functions of oyster reefs, such as water quality purification, providing habitats, preventing shoreline erosion, and enhancing wave dissipation and flood reduction functions, by designing and implementing artificial oyster reef restoration schemes in offshore port areas.
solution: This article proposes a plan for the restoration of artificial oyster reefs near ports. Specifically, first, considering the sharp decline in natural oyster reefs and the degradation of ecological functions, concrete reef-building technology is used to provide stable structures, combined with discarded oyster shells to enhance seedling attachment rates; second, to address the damage caused by human factors to the oyster reefs, structural stability and brown rope binding technology are employed to protect the habitat and promote oyster growth; additionally, in the face of restoration difficulties brought about by climate change and diseases, improved measures using discarded oyster shells and attached seedlings are implemented to enhance the self-restoration capability of the oyster population; finally, to address issues such as lack of awareness and inadequate management, scientific maintenance and monitoring techniques are introduced to improve later inspections and legal support, ensuring the long-term feasibility and stability of the restoration effects.

explanation.content: In response to analysis0, considering the drastic reduction of natural oyster reef area and the degradation of ecological functions, the use of technology0 and technology1, along with concrete reef structures to provide stability and increase attachment rates with discarded oyster shells, has achieved a preliminary restoration of ecological functions.

In response to analysis1, considering the sharp reduction in oyster reef area and the destruction of habitat caused by human activities, technology0 and technology2 were used, effectively protecting the oyster living environment and enhancing seedling survival rates through stable artificial structures and brown rope binding technology.

For analysis2, considering that natural factors such as climate change and diseases may cause restoration challenges, the use of technology1 and technology2, through the combination of discarded oyster shells adorned with seedlings and brown ropes, has improved the resistance of oyster growth and the biodiversity of the restoration area.

For analysis3, considering the weak awareness of protection and insufficient management of scientific research, use technology3 to ensure the long-term effectiveness of the restoration project and promote the awareness of social consciousness through later inspections, scientific research data support, and cleaning and maintenance measures.

title: Design of the layout plan for port railway loading and unloading tracks.
requirement: Design of the layout plan for port railway loading and unloading tracks. Under the constraints of existing port facilities, complete the layout design of the railway unloading line, aiming to achieve efficient connections between railway and port loading and unloading flows, minimizing the impact on existing port operations, facilities, and yard capacity, while ensuring that the efficiency of port operations meets the throughput requirements of the port.
solution: This article presents four layout schemes and specifically recommends Scheme Four.
