In particular, considering the constraints of port area facilities (analysis0), there may be issues related to yard capacity reduction and facility relocation. The technique of parallel layout in the back area of the port (technology1) is employed to set the railway terminal behind the port area, avoiding interference with functional areas and facilities. At the same time, in response to the challenge of insufficient railway loading and unloading line length (analysis1), the rear marshalling yard technique (technology2) is adopted to address the issue of train stopping through rear marshalling. Furthermore, considering the mismatch between railway and port operational efficiency (analysis2), operational efficiency improvements are achieved by positioning the terminal close to the yard, reducing customs clearance distance, and optimizing processes. Overall, this ensures the efficient integration of railway and port loading and unloading operations while minimizing the impact on port operations and facilities.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that the constraints of the port area facilities may reduce the capacity of functional zones, Plan Four adopts technology1 (backward parallel layout technology for the port area) to independently set the railway unloading line in the land area behind the port, avoiding interference with existing functional zones, refrigerated container yards, and port facilities, while addressing the issue of reduced yard capacity.

For analysis1, considering that the railway loading and unloading line may occupy the storage yard and port area passages, Plan Four adopts technology1 (parallel layout technology in the rear of the port area) and technology2 (classification yard classification technology), by adjusting the location of the railway station to be closer to the back side of the port area to reduce the impact on the storage yard and traffic, while utilizing the rear classification yard to meet the railway train operation requirements.

In response to analysis2, considering the mismatch in loading and unloading efficiency between railway lines and ports, Plan Four utilizes technology1, designing a rear station close to the yard to reduce the horizontal transportation distance and operational steps of trucks, thereby optimizing the port loading and unloading efficiency; additionally, by arranging customs clearance procedures within the yard, operational efficiency is further enhanced, while simultaneously reducing the impact of the port service indicators AWT/AST values on overall operational efficiency.

title: Design Optimization and Application Effect Analysis of Anti-Tipping Reinforcement Scheme for Single Pylon Bridges
requirement: Design Optimization and Application Effect Analysis of Anti-Tipping Reinforcement Scheme for Single Pylon Bridges Under the conditions of insufficient overturning stability of the single-column pier bridge, concentrated force on the supports, and complex loading, design and implement an anti-overturning reinforcement plan to enhance the overturning resistance of the bridge, ensuring that the bearing capacity of the supports and the stress states of the pier columns and pile foundations meet the regulatory requirements.
solution: This article presents a reinforcement scheme for a single-column pier bridge to enhance its overturning resistance by adding steel cover beams and supports. Specifically, first, considering the insufficient overturning stability of the bridge and the challenges posed by concentrated forces on the supports, the technique of adding steel cover beams and supports is utilized. By adding steel cover beams and auxiliary supports on both sides of the pier column, the original single-support configuration is changed to a three-support arrangement, effectively improving the bridge's overturning capacity, raising the overturning stability coefficient in the transverse direction from 1.74 to 12.06. Second, to address the localized force demands of the new structure, local force verification technology for steel cover beams is employed, ensuring that the new steel cover beams and anchor bolts meet design specifications under load conditions. Finally, concerning the potential eccentric compression issues of the reinforced pier column and pile foundation, eccentric compression verification technology is used, indicating that the strength of the pier column, crack width, and bearing capacity of the pile foundation all meet the regulatory requirements. Therefore, the proposed reinforcement scheme demonstrates excellent overturning resistance, rapid construction, and economic feasibility.

explanation.content: Regarding analysis0, considering the concentrated stress on the bridge supports and insufficient overturning stability, technology0 was used to modify the original single support to a three-support arrangement by adding steel cover beams and supports, with the new supports bearing the live load reaction, thereby improving the overall overturning resistance. As a result, the coefficient of overturning stability in the transverse direction of the bridge at the final characteristic state 2 increased from 1.74 to 12.06, meeting the regulatory requirements.

For analysis1, considering that the complex loads may impose high strength and stability requirements on the reinforcement structure, technology1 is adopted to perform localized stress calculations on the newly added steel cover beam, ensuring that the maximum tensile and compressive principal stresses of the steel components and the shear strength of the anchor bolts meet the design standards (JTG 3362—2018).

For analysis2, considering that the newly added supports may exacerbate the eccentric compression issues of the pier and pile foundation, technology2 will be used to verify the calculations of the pier and pile foundation, ensuring that the crack width of the pier does not exceed 0.2mm, and that the internal forces and bearing capacity of the pile foundation meet the requirements of the "Design Specifications for Highway Reinforced Concrete and Prestressed Concrete Bridges and Culverts."

title: Bridge reconstruction plan design for narrow sections.
requirement: Bridge reconstruction plan design for narrow sections. Under the conditions of narrow sections, complex surrounding environments, and weak foundations, complete the reconstruction task of severely damaged bridges while ensuring construction safety, bridge stability, and cost control, and simultaneously meeting the requirements for bridge reconstruction effectiveness (deformation less than 2mm), construction period (≤24 months), and cost (≤500,000 yuan).
solution: This article proposes a construction plan for the reconstruction of bridges in narrow sections. Specifically, first, considering the environmental constraints of narrow areas which may lead to limited choices of construction tools and unavailability of large equipment, small pneumatic drill and manual chipping techniques are employed to accurately dismantle the original bridge using small equipment, combined with manual work to ensure construction safety. Second, to address the challenge of weak bridge foundations, excavation backfill and preloading foundation techniques are used to replace poor soil with high-quality fill material, gradually increasing the preload to enhance the foundation's bearing capacity. To tackle the issue of severely damaged bridge structures needing improved load-bearing capacity and stability, bearing construction, grouting, and rebar bonding techniques are utilized to ensure stability for the bridge's substructure and steel reinforcement, respectively. Finally, to meet the long-term usage needs of the bridge and avoid cracks and leaks, post-cast strips and dual waterproof layers on the bridge deck are used to ensure the durability of the bridge structure. The final plan effectively resolves the construction difficulties in confined spaces, with the average deformation of the reconstructed bridge ≤ 2mm, a construction period of 16.7 months, and a total cost of 326,000 yuan, all of which exceed the preset standards.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the environmental constraints of the narrow section, which may lead to high construction difficulty and the inability to use large equipment, technology0 was used in conjunction with manual operations for the dismantling of the original bridge, effectively avoiding impacts on surrounding buildings and ensuring safe construction.

In response to analysis1, considering that soft soil conditions may lead to uneven foundation settlement or insufficient bearing capacity, technology1 is adopted to enhance foundation stability and reduce settlement through excavation, backfill, and preloading techniques.

For analysis2, due to severe structural damage and the need to meet future traffic demands, technology2 and technology3 are employed for the construction of supports and grouting, as well as for rebar implantation, resulting in a significant improvement in the bridge's load-bearing capacity and stability.

Considering the long-term usage requirements of the bridge and preventing damage to the bridge deck due to environmental factors, the use of technology4 has been employed to set up post-pouring joints and multiple waterproof layers, ensuring that the impermeability and durability meet the standards and avoiding cracking issues during use.

title: Design of interchange solutions for mountainous expressways in narrow spaces.
requirement: Design of interchange solutions for mountainous expressways in narrow spaces. Under the conditions of steep mountainous terrain, limited spacing, significant elevation differences between the main line and national roads, the need to minimize impact on ditches, and poor vertical alignment indicators of the national road, complete the overall design of the interchange for the mountainous expressway, balancing driving safety, engineering feasibility, and environmental protection, and propose a recommended plan for reference in similar projects.
solution: This article proposes an interchange scheme for complex conditions such as steep mountainous terrain, narrow spaces, and significant elevation differences. Specifically, first, considering the steep terrain and narrow layout space, the interchange design uses optimization techniques, employing a variational trumpet-shaped layout for spiral alignment and a variational T-shaped ramp design to ensure the ramp alignment adapts to the terrain conditions. Secondly, addressing the elevation difference between the main line and the national road, refined ramp longitudinal profile adjustment techniques are utilized to lower the main line elevation and optimize bridge clearance design while reducing project scale and avoiding drainage relocation. Finally, utilizing BIM technology for three-dimensional modeling enhances the logical coherence and feasibility of the design scheme, ensuring driving safety, manageable construction difficulty, and minimal environmental impact. The recommended variational T-shaped scheme integrates the aforementioned technologies, avoiding issues such as high fill placement at ramp bridge abutments and excessively large bridge engineering scales, while optimizing the ramp toll station layout and enhancing driving safety at grade crossings on national roads.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the steep terrain and narrow layout conditions in mountainous areas, optimize the design using the interoperability forms from technology1, adapting to confined space conditions through variations such as spiral layout and detour design, and combine this with a feasibility study of the BIM technology assisted solutions from technology2.

In response to analysis1, considering the significant challenges posed by height differences, we use refined ramp longitudinal profile adjustments from technology0, making coordinated adjustments to the main line and ramp elevations, as well as optimizing the bridge structural design, to appropriately reduce the scale of the ramp bridge while avoiding the relocation of important ditches.

For analysis2, considering the conditions of the shared corridor between the national road and the main line and the poor vehicle safety at the intersections, optimize the design method by adjusting the intersection position using the interoperability form of technology1 to ensure better vertical and horizontal indicators for the national road. Additionally, control vehicle safety through refined design in technology0, improving overall safety by reducing ramp gradients and optimizing layouts.

title: A Brief Analysis of the Highway Route Scheme Design in Environmentally Sensitive Areas
requirement: A Brief Analysis of the Highway Route Scheme Design in Environmentally Sensitive Areas Under the conditions of drinking water source protection zones, densely populated areas, and prohibited construction zones, complete the scheme design and route selection tasks for a certain highway in the west, aiming to minimize the impact on environmentally sensitive areas, ensure construction safety and economic feasibility, while also complying with relevant laws and technical specifications.
solution: This article proposes the design of highway route schemes for drinking water source protection areas, densely populated regions, and no-construction zones. Specifically, first, considering the requirements of drinking water source protection areas and the risks of water pollution, a bridge deck (subgrade) runoff collection system and emergency sedimentation pond technology are employed to effectively avoid water body pollution through the establishment of runoff collection facilities and emergency measures. Second, in response to the sensitivity of densely populated areas to noise and air pollution, noise protection facilities and environmental management techniques during construction are utilized to reduce environmental disturbances to residents through sound barriers and optimized construction organization. Finally, in light of the planning restrictions of the no-construction zone along the Baili Canal, reasonable route selection and geological design are adopted to circumvent the no-construction area while ensuring the route's straightness and economic viability. Through these technologies and design measures, the impact of highway construction on environmentally sensitive areas is minimized, ensuring environmental and safety sustainability during the construction and operation phases.

explanation.content: In response to analysis0, considering the restrictions of drinking water source protection areas and the risk of water pollution, technology0 was used to implement a bridge surface runoff collection system and emergency sedimentation pond technology, achieving the collection and interception of surface runoff, thereby preventing contamination of the water source, while also meeting the requirements of drinking water source protection regulations.

In response to analysis1, considering the sensitivity of densely populated areas to noise and air pollution, technology2 was employed to reduce environmental disturbances to nearby residents during construction and operation by setting up noise protection facilities and enhancing environmental management during the construction period, thereby achieving environmental protection goals.

For analysis2, considering the planning restrictions of the restricted construction area in Bailiqu, reasonable routing technology from technology1 was used to avoid the restricted area. At the same time, geological routing technology was combined to achieve compliance with planning policies and economic rationality of the technology by adjusting the route scheme.

title: Design of the bridge scheme for the Zhuhai Avenue expressway enhancement project.
requirement: Design of the bridge scheme for the Zhuhai Avenue expressway enhancement project. In the Zhuhai Avenue expressway enhancement project, complete the design and construction tasks for the overpass and pedestrian bridge. This process needs to meet the fast traffic demand of 80 km/h on the main line, minimize the impact of construction on traffic, while improving the aesthetic performance of the bridges and pedestrian bridge to meet urban development and the growing demands of citizens for a better quality of life.
solution: This article presents the bridge design scheme for the Zhuhai Avenue rapid enhancement project. Specifically, first, considering the constraints of land use and the complexity of current traffic, a small box girder + composite girder scheme and a steel box girder scheme are adopted. Through rapid construction and a gradually varying beam height design, a combination of structural economy and landscape coordination is achieved. Secondly, to meet the aesthetic requirements of the cross-line bridge, elliptical pier columns are used, optimizing the pier column structure while enhancing the visual effect. Finally, to satisfy the diverse needs of the pedestrian overpass, regional culture and modern industrial design are integrated, enhancing the stability of the overpass with steel box girders and special-shaped pier structures, while a sub-surface pipeline and light strip design showcase excellent landscape effects under the premise of safety and performance. This comprehensive scheme achieves a perfect balance of economy, construction progress, and landscape quality, providing design references for similar projects.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the land restrictions on Zhuhai Avenue and the need for rapid construction, the 'small box beam + composite beam solution' of technology0 was chosen to meet economic requirements with mature technology and rapid construction characteristics; a steel box beam from technology1 will be used at the ultra-large span nodes to ensure structural strength and minimize traffic impact.

For analysis1, considering that the construction of the cross-line bridge needs to balance aesthetics and economy, the technology2 elliptical pier scheme is adopted, optimizing the connection between the pier and the cap beam to enhance the aesthetic effect of the bridge pier while retaining the economy and convenience of the construction.

For analysis2, considering that the pedestrian overpass needs to integrate regional culture while meeting typhoon and traffic safety requirements, technology3 is used to showcase regional characteristics through themed shapes, while using steel box girders and special-shaped piers to enhance stability. At the same time, buried pipelines are used to reduce visual interference and optimize lighting design.

title: Design proposal for the Wanrui Bridge in Ruili City.
requirement: Design proposal for the Wanrui Bridge in Ruili City. Under the conditions of a constant water level with a river width of 220m in the Ruili River, the need to meet navigation and intersecting road requirements, while incorporating the landscape functionality and cultural characteristics of the Ruili International Logistics Park, and considering construction feasibility and economic factors, complete the design scheme for a bridge that is both landmark and aesthetically pleasing.
solution: This article presents two bridge design proposals for comparison. Specifically, first, considering the width of the Ruilijiang River and navigation needs, there may be challenges regarding span and traffic coordination. The design utilizes cable-stayed beam bridge technology with a main span of 40m + 2×80m + 40m, meeting the requirements for navigation across the river while highlighting the landscape effect of the bridge. Secondly, addressing the challenges of insufficient landmark status concerning the border landscape and regional cultural expression, it employs variable cross-section continuous beam bridge technology, achieving regional cultural heritage through the design of bridge piers resembling peacock tail feathers and lines. Additionally, to resolve construction complexity and control costs, it adopts prestressed concrete continuous cast-in-place box girder technology, reducing construction difficulty and subsequent maintenance costs through lightweight structures and durability design. In the overall scheme comparison, proposal one, the "Southeast Flying" cable-stayed beam bridge, demonstrates a stronger landmark presence and visual impact, and is recommended as the final design scheme.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the constant water level of 220m and navigation requirements, the cable-stayed beam bridge technology of technology0 is used, and the structural layout of the main span of 40m + 2×80m + 40m meets the span requirements and navigation conditions, minimizing interference with shipping and transportation.

For analysis1, considering that the bridge needs to reflect the characteristics of Ruili, the hometown of peacocks, the variable cross-section continuous beam bridge and cable-stayed bridge technologies using technology1 and technology0 will be employed. The main bridge's design will embody the imagery of a peacock spreading its feathers and flapping its wings, emphasizing landmark landscape effects while integrating with the surrounding cultural landscape environment.

For analysis2, considering that the construction needs to be economically feasible and easy to maintain in the future, the prestressed concrete continuous cast-in-situ box beam technology of technology2 and the variable cross-section continuous beam technology of technology1 are adopted to simplify the construction plan, reduce equipment requirements, and minimize environmental interference, while optimizing the convenience of future structural maintenance.

title: Design of the Ground Transportation Organization Plan for the Second Terminal Area of Baiyun International Airport
requirement: Design of the Ground Transportation Organization Plan for the Second Terminal Area of Baiyun International Airport Under the conditions of annual throughput growth, diversification of vehicle types, and tight spatial layout, complete the planning of the ground transportation system and the design of the waiting area for the second terminal area of Guangzhou Baiyun International Airport, ensuring that traffic organization meets throughput capacity requirements, achieving the goals of convenient passenger transfer, quick vehicle entry and exit, and efficient space utilization.
solution: This article presents an overall solution for the land-side transportation system and the front-of-building waiting area of the second terminal area at Guangzhou Baiyun International Airport. Specifically, first, considering the significant increase in annual passenger throughput, a "one-way counterclockwise traffic system" is used to ensure efficient diversion and passage of vehicles; second, in response to the needs of various vehicle types and potential intertwining issues, an "integrated access and departure channel design" along with "auxiliary tunnel systems" is adopted to optimize the flow organization of different vehicles, avoiding interference and congestion; finally, considering the limited space of the front-of-building waiting area and the need to reduce passenger walking distances, a "central parking island layout" is utilized to achieve efficient operation of different vehicle waiting areas through intensive space planning, while enhancing the travel experience for passengers.

explanation.content: In response to analysis0, considering that the targeted annual throughput growth may lead to insufficient road network capacity, technology0 will be used to design a one-way circulating traffic loop to efficiently redirect traffic flow, meeting the transportation demand during peak hours.

In response to analysis1, considering that the needs of various types of vehicles can easily lead to interference and management challenges, technology2 and technology3 are used to optimize the flow of different vehicle types entering and exiting the terminal area through an integrated design of access and auxiliary channel systems, reducing conflicts.

For analysis2, considering the limited space of the waiting area in front of the building, use technology1 to effectively partition the waiting area through a central parking island layout, while also designing pedestrian paths to reduce the walking distance for passengers.

title: Design of the hoisting plan for large components of the shield tunneling machine.
requirement: Design of the hoisting plan for large components of the shield tunneling machine. Under the conditions of urban bustling plots, limited space, and tight construction schedules, complete the safe and efficient lifting tasks of large components of the shield machine (such as the cutter head and main drive), including the flipping and lowering of the cutter head and the installation of the main drive system, ensuring that the assembly accuracy meets design requirements and that the lifting operations are safe and controllable.
solution: This article proposes a hoisting plan for large components of the tunnel boring machine. Specifically, considering the narrow site and tight schedule, there may be issues with insufficient hoisting space and high installation precision requirements. Therefore, a dual- crane hoisting technology is employed, utilizing an 800t crawler crane and a 350t crawler crane working together to address the hoisting force balance problem. Secondly, in response to the large mass and volume of the cutter head system that requires rotation, the optimal rope release speed control technology is used to ensure the safety and stability of the cutter head rotation process by controlling the crane's rope release speed. Finally, to address the issue of insufficient bearing capacity of the foundation that could lead to the tipping of the crawler crane, a technology using a steel foundation box and C30 concrete to harden the foundation is employed, effectively enhancing the bearing capacity and stability of the construction foundation. At the same time, by verifying the load ratings of the 800t crawler crane and the 350t crawler crane, safety and construction precision during the hoisting process are ensured, successfully achieving the efficient assembly of the tunnel boring machine system.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the limited space and tight schedule, there may be issues with difficult lifting and high precision requirements. Therefore, this article uses technology0 dual-machine lifting technology to reduce safety risks through multi-machine collaboration and improve lifting efficiency, while also verifying the lift load with technology3 to ensure construction accuracy.

For analysis1, considering the issue that a single crane cannot flip due to the large weight and volume of the cutter head, the dual crane lifting technology of technology0 is used, combined with the optimal rope pay-out speed control technology of technology2. By precisely adjusting the pay-out speed of the 350t crawler crane, the synchronization of the dual crane operation is ensured, solving the risks of unbalanced stress during the flip and crane lifting failures.

For analysis2, considering that insufficient foundation bearing capacity may lead to crane overturning, this paper uses technology1 for foundation reinforcement and subgrade box application technology to enhance the foundation bearing capacity of the working area to meet construction requirements (e.g., 74.2kPa < 417.32kPa bearing capacity), ensuring the operational safety of lifting equipment.

title: Design of the shield tunnel crossing under the river channel and the lateral crossing of bridge piles.
requirement: Design of the shield tunnel crossing under the river channel and the lateral crossing of bridge piles. In the section between Qingheying Station and Tiantongyuan East Station, complete the construction task of the shield tunnel under the conditions of crossing river channels and bridge piles, while ensuring the safety of existing bridge piles and river channels. It is required to control the deformation and settlement of the bridge and surrounding facilities within the specified limits, with maximum settlement not exceeding 15mm.
solution: This article proposes a comprehensive plan for a shield tunnel passing under a river and through bridge piles. Specifically, first, considering the close proximity of the shield tunnel to the riverbed and the presence of a silty clay aquiclude, synchronous grouting technology and soil improvement techniques are employed. By injecting a dual-liquid slurry of bentonite and water glass to enhance the soil, control over the seepage risk of the tunnel and river is achieved. Second, to address the risk of settlement and deformation arising from the small distance between the tunnel and facilities such as bridge piles and sewage pipelines, a construction monitoring and dynamic control system combined with a step-by-step crossing technique is used. This ensures the safety of bridge piles and pipelines by real-time monitoring of pile deformation and adjusting the tunneling time difference. Finally, to mitigate construction risks caused by stress release in the soil layer, Midas GTS NX three-dimensional finite element simulation technology is utilized. By simulating and analyzing the deformation of the soil induced by construction, an optimized construction parameter plan is developed, and verified with a comprehensive monitoring system for real-time adjustment, ultimately achieving effective control over the overall construction risk.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the conditions near the river and the risks of not implementing radial grouting measures, the synchronized grouting technology of technology0 and the soil improvement technology of technology1 were used. By optimizing the grouting materials and reducing disturbances, protection of the silty clay layer at the riverbed was achieved, avoiding the risk of tunneling and river flow path connectivity.

For analysis1, considering the close proximity of the tunnel to the bridge piles and sewage pipelines, a construction monitoring and dynamic control system using technology2 and a step-by-step crossing technique using technology3 were employed. By dynamically adjusting the tunneling parameters and staggering the excavation timing, the deformation of the bridge piles and pipelines was controlled, ensuring the safety of the bridge and pipelines.

For analysis2, considering the risk of soil layer stress release during construction, the technology4 three-dimensional finite element simulation technology and technology2 construction monitoring system were used. Through numerical simulation and tracking verification, a comprehensive analysis of the soil deformation and settlement changes caused by the construction was conducted, and adjustments were made during the excavation, effectively ensuring the safety of the construction.

title: Design of the monitoring solution for Box culvert of South to North Water Diversion Project.
requirement: Design of the monitoring solution for Box culvert of South to North Water Diversion Project. Under the conditions of complex construction environment of the South-to-North Water Diversion project's box culvert, high monitoring requirements, and dynamic construction complexities, complete the real-time monitoring tasks covering surface settlement around the box culvert, box culvert settlement, and groundwater levels, ensuring that the impact of the construction process on the box culvert structure is minimized, and that construction safety and project progress are controllable.
solution: This article proposes a high-precision construction monitoring solution based on automated monitoring and cloud platform technology. Specifically, first, considering that the settlement and groundwater level changes caused by the South-to-North Water Diversion box culvert crossing project may lead to structural instability issues, automated monitoring technology (technology0) is used to achieve real-time high-precision monitoring of settlement and water level changes within the construction impact range; second, in response to the complexity of construction and the high-frequency monitoring requirements, a cloud platform-based monitoring management system (technology1) is employed, ensuring that potential abnormal situations during construction are detected immediately through real-time data management and multi-channel automatic alarms; finally, considering the large number of monitoring points and dynamic complexity, a modular monitoring system (technology2) is utilized to achieve rapid deployment, high-precision data collection, and automatic stability inspection, ensuring the stable operation of the monitoring system. Through this solution, the impact of the construction process on the South-to-North Water Diversion project's box culvert is minimized, while also providing a referable monitoring solution design and implementation for other similar crossing projects.

explanation.content: In response to analysis0, considering that the settlement of the box culvert and fluctuations in groundwater levels may lead to structural instability or leakage, technology0 is used to perform real-time high-precision monitoring of the dynamic changes in the box culvert and groundwater levels within the construction area through automated monitoring technology, ensuring construction safety.

For analysis1, considering the high precision requirements for monitoring and the need for timely warning, we use technology1 to achieve real-time data upload and multi-channel alarm pushing based on cloud platform monitoring data management technology, ensuring that construction anomalies are detected and dealt with at the first opportunity.

For analysis2, considering the need to install a large number of monitoring points and the complexity of the construction environment, using technology2, quickly deploy and verify the stability of monitoring point reference points through a modular monitoring system, ensuring comprehensive monitoring coverage and high data accuracy.

title: Transportation scheme design at the confluence of Dabujiang River and Tianma River in Huadu District.
requirement: Transportation scheme design at the confluence of Dabujiang River and Tianma River in Huadu District. At the confluence of the Dabujing River and the Tianma River, the construction of transportation facilities must meet the flood discharge requirements for a 50-year recurrence interval while ensuring the connectivity of levees and maintaining smooth traffic for upstream and downstream, all while ensuring the stability of the foundation.
solution: This article presents the design of a box culvert bridge solution for the traffic and flood discharge needs at the confluence of the Dabujing River and the Tianma River. Specifically, first, considering the simultaneous demands of the Tianma River and traffic, as well as cost issues, a box culvert bridge technology is employed, designing a 3-hole box culvert (total net width of 14 m and length of 36.12 m) to meet both traffic passage and flood discharge requirements; second, to address the issue of insufficient foundation bearing capacity, composite foundation treatment technology is adopted. By installing concrete square piles with a side length of 0.25 m and spacing of 0.8 m × 0.8 m, the composite foundation bearing capacity is increased to 130.84 kPa, far exceeding design requirements; third, for flood discharge requirements, hydraulic calculation optimization technology for the box culvert is used, resulting in a calculated flow capacity of 176.5 m³/s, satisfying the design flow requirement for a 50-year return period; finally, to ensure the stability of the retaining wall at the box culvert connection section, retaining wall stability and foundation reinforcement technology is applied. Through calculations for resistance to sliding and overturning, combined with the composite pile foundation design, the foundation bearing capacity is optimized to 194.35 kPa, fully meeting design requirements and ensuring project safety.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that the confluence of the Tianma River needs to meet both traffic and flood discharge requirements while also reducing project costs, the box culvert bridge technology (technology0) was selected. It has a total width of 14 m and a length of 36.12 m, meeting the flow and traffic demands at the confluence of the two rivers, while being easy to construct and cost-effective.

For analysis 1, considering that insufficient bearing capacity of the foundation may lead to foundation settlement and seepage damage, composite foundation treatment technology (technology 1) is used. By adopting the method of driving concrete square piles, the bearing capacity of the composite foundation is increased to 130.84 kPa, exceeding the design requirement of 126.85 kPa, ensuring the safety of the foundation.

For analysis2, considering that the flood discharge requirement needs to meet a design flow rate corresponding to a 50-year event, the optimized hydraulic calculation technology for box culverts (technology2) is adopted. By optimizing the structural dimensions of the box culvert, a flow capacity of 176.5 m³/s is calculated, which meets the design requirement of 172.6 m³/s, ensuring that the box culvert satisfies the flood discharge needs.

For analysis 1, the retaining wall foundation may face stability issues due to insufficient bearing capacity. The application of retaining wall stability and foundation reinforcement technology (technology 3) will stabilize the safety factors for anti-sliding and anti-tilting to meet standards. Additionally, using composite foundation methods to inject concrete piles will optimize the foundation bearing capacity to 194.35 kPa, ensuring structural stability.

title: Design of the overall construction plan for the Mogan Mountain Expressway.
requirement: Design of the overall construction plan for the Mogan Mountain Expressway. Under the conditions of ensuring that the long-term traffic flow forecast demand (for 2042) is met, while also taking into account the protection of surrounding subways, roads, historic cultural buildings, and river environments, complete the construction of the Mogan Mountain Expressway. The design scheme must select a suitable option between the elevated expressway and the tunnel expressway to achieve a balance between rapid transportation services and regional development needs.
solution: This article proposes an elevated construction plan. Specifically, taking into account that long-term traffic flow demands may lead to insufficient capacity, a bidirectional 6-lane elevated expressway is used as the main construction form, with a reasonable span design (Technology 0) to meet service levels from B to C. Secondly, in addressing the layout issues of the river and bridge systems, complex tunnel construction is avoided (Technology 0), and decorative retaining walls are added at the widening of the Xitang River to solve landscape and structural issues (Technology 2). Finally, the design for optimizing intersections provides a combination of omnidirectional traffic flow with right-in and right-out access (Technology 3), meeting the connection and convenient passage requirements of the surrounding plots. Considering the overall economic efficiency, ease of construction, and adaptability for future expansion, it is determined to carry out the total construction plan of the MoGanShan expressway in an elevated form.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that the long-term traffic flow demand cannot be met with 4 lanes, and that the 6-lane design can meet service levels from B to C under different flow conditions, technical option 0 is selected, which aims to improve traffic efficiency by constructing a bidirectional 6-lane elevated expressway.

Regarding analysis1, considering that the tunnel scheme must face the technical limitations of shield tunneling construction and conflicts with the subway system, choose technology 0 to avoid the risks of shield tunneling; and combine this with technology 3 to optimize traffic organization, ensuring functional coordination and construction convenience.

For analysis2, to avoid conflicts between the tunnel and existing river channel bridges, priority will be given to using technology 0 combined with a reasonable span design to avoid existing bridge foundations. In addition, for the widening of the Xitang River, technology 2 will be used, implementing a landscaped cast-in-place retaining wall to meet the needs of river expansion while also ensuring visual coordination.

title: Design scheme for the Penglai Landscape Bridge Group.
requirement: Design scheme for the Penglai Landscape Bridge Group. Under the conditions of bridge aging, insufficient aesthetics, high requirements for flood prevention and traffic, and the design goal of "one zone, one scenery," complete the comprehensive renovation project of the Penglai Huah River cultural tourism, which includes the reconstruction of three vehicular bridges, the new/reconstruction of five pedestrian bridges, and the renovation of the facades of four bridges to achieve flood prevention functionality and enhancement of aesthetic culture.
solution: This article presents a design scheme for the landscape bridge group in Penglai, Huanhe. Specifically, firstly, considering the aging of bridges and safety hazards, a single-span beam bridge and micro-curvature structural technology are adopted to ensure the safety and durability of the bridge through optimizing the bridge structure and pavement design; secondly, in response to load, flood control, and durability requirements, a single-span hollow arch bridge technology is utilized, which reduces water resistance while satisfying the functionality of slow-moving systems; thirdly, to address the issue of insufficient bridge aesthetics, cultural theme bridge body design technology is employed, with cultural decoration designs for the bridge facade according to the theme 'Encountering the Tang and Song Dynasties, Dreaming Back to Dengzhou,' including lotus flower reliefs, book-shaped models, etc., to enhance the overall landscape appearance of the bridge; finally, in terms of material and construction, based on the principles of durability and economy, the bridge structure is designed for a lifespan of 50 or 30 years, ensuring economic suitability and ease of subsequent operation and maintenance.

explanation.content: In response to analysis0, considering the issues of bridge aging and safety hazards, use technology3 to optimize the upper and lower structural design of the bridge by adopting highly durable prefabricated slab arch structures and reinforced concrete, ensuring the long-term safety and stability of the bridge, while utilizing foamed concrete to reduce the load.

For analysis1, considering load, durability, and flood prevention requirements, technology0 and technology1 are employed. By selecting suitable beam and arch bridge forms, the specific bridge design balances the reduction of water blockage and functionality, while coordinating different bridge functional requirements in the width design and longitudinal slope control.

For analysis2, considering the 'one area, one view' and cultural landscape goals, combined with the thematic design of technology2, empower culture to create landscape landmarks, and use technology0 and technology1 to integrate landscape needs into structural design, balancing aesthetics and functionality.

title: Design of stormwater drainage scheme for large hub interchanges in planned boundary areas.
requirement: Design of stormwater drainage scheme for large hub interchanges in planned boundary areas. Under the conditions of a lack of a complete drainage system along the boundary of the planning area in Nanning and significant variations in elevation, complete the design task for the rainwater drainage system in a certain large hub interchange area, which must meet the design requirement of no overflow during a 50-year return period of rainfall and an annual runoff control rate of 70% in line with the urban sponge concept.
solution: This article proposes a rainwater drainage scheme for large hub interchanges in planned boundary areas. Specifically, first, considering the lack of drainage infrastructure in the region and the diversity of topographical conditions, a decentralized drainage technology is adopted. Rainwater is discharged separately through the Xiaogou and Zhiban channels, optimizing the scale and overall layout of the pipeline system. Secondly, to address the potential flooding issues caused by low elevation in certain areas, a mathematical modeling method is used to simulate the drainage system. LID facilities such as sunken green belts and ecological tree pits are employed to enhance storage capacity, ensuring smooth rainwater drainage. Finally, hydraulic calculations for the overall pipeline network are performed using an inference formula method to accurately design pipeline flow rates and burial depths, meeting the requirements for flood control under a 50-year rainfall design. Additionally, the sponge city concept, which includes measures such as green spaces and permeable pavements, achieves a total annual runoff control rate of 70%, optimizing the performance and ecological benefits of the entire rainwater drainage system.

explanation.content: In response to analysis0, considering the overall undeveloped area and the lack of drainage infrastructure, technology2 is utilized to disperse rainwater drainage into the Paixiao Ditch and the Cutting Board Ditch, ensuring smooth rainwater discharge while avoiding the pressure of centralized discharge and the impact on the water system.

For analysis1, considering the special situation of low elevation in the interchange area, technology1 is used for simulating waterlogging at the low point of the drainage pipe to optimize the drainage design, and green space retention facilities are set up at the lowest point of the interchange using technology3's LID measures to mitigate the risk of drainage issues.

For analysis2, considering that Paixiao Ditch may experience overload under a once-in-50-years flood condition, calculate the water flow in the conduit using the mathematical modeling method of technology1 and the inference formula method of technology0, reasonably control the segmented rainwater discharge flow rate, and adjust the burial depth and pipeline scale to ensure that all nodes along the line are in a non-overflow state.

title: Design of the concrete pouring scheme for super-large span CFST arch bridges.
requirement: Design of the concrete pouring scheme for super-large span CFST arch bridges. In the construction of a steel-concrete arch bridge with a main span of 575 meters, the task of pouring C70 high-performance concrete inside the pipes must be completed, overcoming the difficulties of pumping and controlling the deformation and stress of the arch ribs to ensure the durability and operational safety of the completed bridge.
solution: This article proposes a concrete pouring scheme for ultra-large span steel-concrete arch bridges. Specifically, first, considering the large volume of concrete inside the pipes and the difficulties in pumping, a vacuum-assisted staged pumping process is used, successfully achieving uniform concrete pouring through multi-stage segment pumping and negative pressure maintenance. Second, to address the high concrete strength requirements, an optimized mix design of C70 self-compacting concrete is adopted, ensuring the strength and construction performance of the concrete by adjusting the water-cement ratio and the amount of additives. Finally, to tackle the deformation and stress issues arising during concrete pouring, a locking cable load transfer technology is employed, effectively suppressing the vertical and lateral displacements of the arch ribs during the tensioning process, while significantly reducing the tensile stress in the concrete, ultimately ensuring structural stability during the construction phase.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the issues of large concrete volume and high pumping difficulty, the technology0 vacuum-assisted staged pumping process was used, effectively addressing the challenges of concrete voids and uneven pumping through segmented continuous relay pumping and maintaining negative pressure.

In response to the issue of high-strength concrete requirements mentioned in analysis0, combined with the optimization design of the technology2 C70 self-compacting concrete mix ratio, the pumping performance and construction adaptability of the concrete were ensured through experimental optimization and the addition of water-reducing agents.

In response to analysis1, considering the potential issues of excessive tensile stress in the concrete and deformations of the arch ribs during construction, the technology1 tensioning and loading adjustment technique is adopted. By installing a loading adjustment cable at the arch rib's L/4 position and controlling the tensile force during the construction phase, the arch rib's line shape and concrete stress are effectively managed, thereby reducing the risk of arch rib displacement and stress concentration.

title: Design of renovation solution for cross-line bridges in highway expansion.
requirement: Design of renovation solution for cross-line bridges in highway expansion. Under the conditions of increasing demand for high-speed transportation and the addition of new highway exits, complete the modification task of a certain highway overpass in Foshan, ensuring that the highway widening requirements are met while guaranteeing the safety, structural stability, and cost-effectiveness of the bridge after the modification, and making every effort to avoid the ineffective demolition of the old bridge.
solution: This article presents an economically viable solution for the renovation of cross-line bridges under highway widening conditions. Specifically, first, considering possible structural waste and environmental impact, the assessment of bridge technical conditions and bearing capacity calculations were used to analyze the existing bridge structure, confirming that the piers and some spans meet the renovation requirements. Secondly, to address the deficiencies in net width and clearance after renovation, hollow slab beam prefabrication technology was employed to adjust the original span (from 17.75m to 21.5m), and a new Pier 3a was constructed using on-site concrete construction technology to ensure structural stability. Finally, to dismantle sections of the bridge spans that are no longer in use, a mechanical hoisting and static cutting method was adopted to avoid impact on adjacent spans and surrounding road traffic. The entire solution reduced the scope of demolition of the old bridge, saved on project costs, and shortened the duration of the impact on surrounding roads during the renovation.

explanation.content: Regarding analysis0, considering that directly dismantling the old bridge may lead to significant waste and environmental pollution issues, a comprehensive inspection and load capacity calculation of the bridge's technical condition were carried out using technology0 to determine whether part of the old bridge structure could be utilized, in order to reduce the amount of dismantling work and construction costs.

For analysis1, considering that the existing bridge spans are insufficient to meet the net width requirements after the high-speed widening, technology1 will be used to adjust some of the bridge spans by replacing them with 21.5m precast hollow slabs to achieve a reasonable modification of the superstructure; at the same time, new piers will be constructed in the substructure using technology2 to ensure the overall consistency and stability of the bridge.

title: Design of Control Scheme for Uneven Settlement of Soft Soil Subgrade
requirement: Design of Control Scheme for Uneven Settlement of Soft Soil Subgrade Under the conditions of poor terrain and geological conditions, substandard construction conditions, the presence of cracks, and slope instability, complete the design and implementation tasks for controlling uneven settlement of soft soil foundations, ensuring that the stability of the foundation meets standards while also satisfying requirements for cost-effectiveness and construction efficiency.
solution: This article presents a control scheme for conduit grouting to address uneven settlement of soft soil subgrades. Specifically, first, considering that poor topographic and geological conditions may lead to overall uneven settlement of the subgrade, a columnar body is uniformly arranged using the conduit grouting method to enhance the stiffness and bearing capacity of the subgrade; secondly, to address the issue of differential settlement caused by substandard construction conditions, construction parameters such as grouting pressure and hole spacing are optimized to ensure the uniformity of the filled subgrade; furthermore, to deal with the threat posed by cracks to subgrade stability, grout is used to repair the soft soil structure around the cracks, reducing the impact on the rate and extent of settlement; finally, to mitigate the overall collapse risk caused by slope instability, grouting is used to enhance the shear strength of the slope, ensuring the overall stability of the subgrade. This scheme meets both the economic and effectiveness requirements of the project.

explanation.content: In response to analysis0, considering the challenges of low bearing capacity of soft soil fill and significant center extrusion settlement, the technology2 conduit grouting method was used. By employing a plum blossom layout with an average radius of 0.5 meters, a hole diameter of 10 centimeters, and a hole spacing of 1.5 meters, along with a cement slurry with a water-cement ratio of 0.7:1, the subgrade was reinforced and overall stiffness was improved, effectively solving the issue of uneven settlement.

For analysis 1, considering that the construction conditions cannot meet the requirements for compaction and drainage, which may lead to differential settlement, use technology 2, the pipe grouting method, to inject high-performance cement slurry with a water-cement ratio of 0.7:1, and achieve precise grouting control with a design pressure of 3 MPa, so as to realize base reinforcement and uniform settlement effects.

For analysis2, considering the risk of crack propagation on the stability of the subgrade, the technology2 grouting method is used to reinforce the area around the cracks with columnar grouting, repairing internal defects and reducing the possibility of structural instability.

For analysis 3, considering the challenge of possible collapse due to slope instability, we will use the technology of conduit grouting method. By utilizing a depth of 4.5 meters and a triangular plum blossom arrangement for grouting, we will improve the stress distribution of the slope and enhance its shear strength, ultimately achieving an increase in slope stability.

title: Research on the Design of Uneven Settlement Control Schemes for Soft Soil Foundations
requirement: Research on the Design of Uneven Settlement Control Schemes for Soft Soil Foundations Under the conditions of soft soil foundation, high fill height, high groundwater levels, and frequent rainfall at the junction of the old and new roadbeds, the completion of the highway widening project requires controlling the uneven settlement of the new and old roadbeds to ensure the stability of the roadbed and the safety of vehicle operation.
solution: This paper presents a comprehensive control scheme for uneven settlement in soft soil foundations. Specifically, first, considering the differences in consolidation states between old and new foundations that may lead to settlement problems, filler and compaction control technologies are adopted. Through layered filling and controlling the degree of compaction, the stability of the new foundation is ensured. Secondly, to address the issues of high fill heights at bridge approaches and significant additional stress on the foundation, lightweight filler technology is utilized, effectively reducing the self-weight of the foundation by using bubble-mixed lightweight soil. Thirdly, to resolve the uneven settlement at the joint between the old and new foundations, inward-sloping steps are excavated with a width ≥ 1.0 m and a height of 0.8 to 1.0 m, with geogrids laid on the steps to enhance the overall stability of the foundation junction area. Finally, for issues related to soft soil foundations, soft soil foundation treatment techniques, including cement mixing piles and other measures, significantly improve the bearing capacity of the foundation. Through the comprehensive application of these technologies, uneven settlement between the old and new foundations has been successfully controlled, ensuring the stability of the foundation and safe driving conditions.

explanation.content: Regarding analysis0, considering that the different consolidation states of the old and new subgrades may lead to uneven settlement, the use of technology0 fill material and compaction control technology, through layered compaction, selection of suitable fill material for the upper and lower roadbed, and controlling the compaction degree, has reduced the settlement difference between the old and new subgrades.

For analysis1, considering that the high embankment fill at the bridge head will create significant additional stress and settlement issues, technology1 lightweight filler technology is employed, using bubble-mixed lightweight soil to reduce the self-weight of the embankment and effectively control settlement.

For analysis 2, considering that the junction between the new and old roadbed is prone to stress concentration, the step excavation technique using technology 2 was employed to design an inward-leaning step with a width of 1.0m and a height of 0.8 to 1.0m, while also using technology 3 geogrid laying technology to enhance the stability and deformation resistance of the roadbed joint area.

In response to the issue of insufficient bearing capacity of the bridge approach area and the thicker soft soil foundation mentioned in analysis2, the technology4 soft soil foundation treatment technology was employed. Through the implementation of deep reinforcement measures such as cement mixing piles, the bearing capacity of the foundation was increased, effectively reducing post-construction and differential settlement.

title: Design of the testing plan for the networked service platform software system of ocean-going passenger ships.
requirement: Design of the testing plan for the networked service platform software system of ocean-going passenger ships. In the context of late development and lack of mature experience in domestic ocean passenger ships, establish a networked service platform with functional modules such as wireless networking, community service, emergency control, and fire alarm. Through unit testing, integration testing, and system testing, ensure the smooth operation of the platform under conditions of high concurrency, high reliability, and security.
solution: This article proposes a phased testing design plan for the software system of the domestic ocean-going passenger ship networking service platform. Specifically, first, in light of the late start of domestic networking service platforms, facing challenges in module development and standardization, unit testing techniques will be used for independent testing of each subsystem's functional modules, with functional verification achieved through white-box testing and black-box testing; secondly, considering the high concurrency traffic and reliability requirements, recovery testing and security testing in system testing will be employed to simulate abnormal conditions and attack scenarios, ensuring the platform's stability and security; finally, regarding the complex interactions and compatibility issues of multiple modules, integration testing techniques and compatibility testing will be used to assemble and test all subsystems and verify their interactive collaboration, ensuring that the platform covers all environmental scenarios through adaptability assessment.

explanation.content: In response to analysis0, considering the weak foundation of domestic network service platforms, challenges may arise such as incomplete module development and difficulties in unifying technical standards. Therefore, by using technology0 unit testing techniques, verify whether the functional implementation of each subsystem module meets the expected objectives through detailed design documentation and source code lists, ensuring the integrity of functionality during the development phase.

For analysis1, considering that the platform requires long-term, stable operation and has high fault tolerance requirements, it may face risks of system crashes and data security under high concurrent traffic. Therefore, recovery testing and security testing from technology2 will be used, simulating abnormal scenarios such as power outages and forced exits, as well as validating the system's fault tolerance and defense performance through attack simulations to ensure system stability and security.

In response to analysis2, considering the potential issues of poor performance under the conditions of diverse platform functionalities, multi-module interactions, and complex compatibility, we will use technology1 integration testing techniques and compatibility testing from technology2. By employing different testing methods (such as large-scale integration testing, top-down approach, etc.), we will establish multi-module coordination scenarios to examine their interaction performance. Additionally, we will validate the platform's compatibility through various devices, operating systems, and network environments to ensure the completeness of service functions.

title: Design of the segmented assembly plan for steel cofferdams of cross-river highway bridges under navigable conditions.
requirement: Design of the segmented assembly plan for steel cofferdams of cross-river highway bridges under navigable conditions. Under the conditions of navigational requirements for the river, complex geological conditions, and deep excavation of the foundation pit, complete the segmented assembly task of the steel cofferdam during the construction of the cross-river highway bridge foundation to ensure precise positioning of the cofferdam, stability of the supporting structure, and long-term safety of the bridge structure.
solution: This article proposes a segmented assembly scheme for the steel cofferdam of a river-crossing highway bridge under navigable conditions. Specifically, first, considering that navigable requirements of the river may cause cofferdam tilting issues, a steel sheet pile cofferdam segmented assembly technology and precise positioning technology for the steel cofferdam are employed to address the installation stability issues through segmental closure and vertical positioning. Second, in response to potential deformation of the cofferdam and foundation pit collapse caused by complex geological conditions, a steel caisson cofferdam segmented assembly technology is used, ensuring overall strength through internal support structures and staggered installation. Lastly, to meet the high precision requirements of cofferdam assembly, stability calculations and installation techniques for steel supports are applied, achieving precise positioning and closure of the cofferdam through stability value parameter verification and assembly deviation adjustments, ensuring the stability and durability of the bridge structure.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that navigation conditions will increase instability during the sinking process, the design employs technology0 steel sheet pile cofferdam segmental assembly technology and technology2 steel cofferdam precise positioning technology. By implementing segmented closure processes and vertical sinking monitoring, the stability and accuracy of cofferdam installation are achieved.

For analysis1, considering that complex geological conditions can easily lead to collapse and uneven loading issues, technology1 steel casing enclosure segment assembly technology is employed. This involves phased assembly and staggered installation using internal I-beams and pipe pile support structures to ensure the overall stability of the enclosure.

For analysis2, considering that the assembly may exceed the allowable deviation after completion, the stability calculation technology of technology3 is used. Strict parameter control is applied to the installation process through the stability formula, and combined with bolt tightening assembly, dynamic adjustments are made to address the deviation.

title: Design of Urban Interchange Renovation Scheme under the Background of Elevated Roads - Taking the Haicang South Avenue Interchange Renovation Project as an Example.
requirement: Design of Urban Interchange Renovation Scheme under the Background of Elevated Roads - Taking the Haicang South Avenue Interchange Renovation Project as an Example. In the urban interchange renovation, under the constraint of limited land use, complete the elevated transformation task of the Haicang South Avenue interchange system, ensuring the separation of passenger and freight traffic, the functional connection between the elevated and ground levels, optimizing traffic flow, and improving traffic efficiency.
solution: This article proposes a comprehensive solution for the improvement of the Haicang South Avenue interchange. Specifically, first, given the issues of high traffic volume and limited land use, vehicle flow prediction and interchange function positioning analysis (technology0) are employed, combined with the design of traffic separation for passengers and freight (technology1) and ramp optimization technology (technology2), to optimize the direction of mainstream traffic and the functional allocation between elevated and ground levels. Second, in response to the special needs of high freight and low passenger traffic at the Maqing Road interchange, new connecting ramps from north to south and south to north are added, and existing ramps are slightly adjusted and new U-turn ramps are introduced to facilitate the rapid passage of mainstream traffic and connectivity for ground traffic. Additionally, slow-moving pedestrian bridges and tunnels are set up to improve the slow-moving system (technology3). Lastly, in addressing the connection between the Jiao Song Road interchange and the expressway, ramp modifications for elevated-to-elevated connections are implemented, directly integrating the ramps for the northern-eastern and western-southern mainstream directions into the elevated layer, thereby reducing issues arising from land use restrictions and construction complexities while maintaining traffic light control on the ground level to meet the demands from other directions. The plan effectively enhances traffic efficiency and promotes the upgrading of the road system.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the high traffic flow and limited land use, use technology0 for traffic flow and functional location analysis to optimize the scheme layout, and apply technology1 and technology2 for passenger and freight separation design and ramp optimization, reducing challenges posed by traffic flow conflicts and land use restrictions.

For analysis1, considering that the Maqing Road interchange needs to meet the requirement of high freight and low passenger traffic, use technology1 to concentrate freight traffic on the elevated layer and optimize passenger traffic to the ground layer; at the same time, adopt technology2 to add and adjust ramps to ensure effective connectivity between the north-south ground layer and the elevated layer, reducing the problem of disconnection in the original ground traffic.

For analysis2, considering that the Jiao Song Road interchange needs to achieve quick transitions between expressways and rapid roads, use technology2 to renovate the main turning ramp for 'quick connection,' reducing traffic disruption during the construction period; implement direct transitions for the north-east and west-south main traffic directions with an elevated structure, while using technology3 to improve the ground-level slow-moving pedestrian crossing system, enhancing regional traffic efficiency and safety.

title: Design and application of the heavy lift ship transshipment solution for major cargo.
requirement: Design and application of the heavy lift ship transshipment solution for major cargo. In the environment of island projects with shallow water depths, complete the heavy lift operation of transferring cargo via a transshipment vessel. After transporting the cargo from deep-sea shipping to the base port, it will be lifted onto the transshipment barge, towed to the temporary dock of the project, and finally safely transported to the installation location. At the same time, ensure the operations are safe, the lifting is precise, and the completion is efficient. Special consideration must be given to the weight, dimensions, center of gravity of the cargo, and the potential impacts of weather conditions.
solution: This article proposes a design plan for the transshipment operations of heavy cargo. Specifically, first, considering the issues of ship listing and lifting accuracy, ship listing control technology and lifting radius verification technology are used to ensure the stability and operational efficiency of the ship during transshipment by adjusting ballast water and verifying the lifting range. Secondly, regarding the issues of cargo center of gravity and saddle support, saddle reinforcement technology and load distribution technology are employed to disperse cargo pressure through distribution plates, verify vehicle entry and support needs, successfully meeting the strength and stability requirements of the barge deck. Finally, in response to the complex operating environment and weather conditions, meteorological monitoring technology and personnel qualification review systems are used. Based on ensuring that all operating personnel are qualified, transshipment operation standards and meteorological ranges are specified, successfully completing the transshipment process for the safe transportation of heavy cargo.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the risks of vessel listing and safety issues involved in the transshipment operations, the use of technology0 and technology1 is proposed. Specifically, the ballast water adjustment system stabilizes the vessel's listing angle to no more than 3°, and the verification of the crane's lifting radius and cargo stowage position ensures that the entire lifting process remains stable.

For analysis1, considering the challenges posed by the center of gravity of the cargo affecting lifting stability and insufficient saddle strength, technologies 2 and 3 have been employed to disperse pressure through load distribution techniques, verify the requirements for unloading vehicles and the arrangement of support piers, and simultaneously check and reinforce the cargo packaging and saddle to ensure support safety and stability.

For analysis 2, considering the impact of meteorological environmental conditions on transshipment operations, technology 4 and technology 5 were selected. By arranging for experienced professionals to operate and verifying the qualifications of inspectors, along with real-time meteorological monitoring technology, an operable meteorological range was established to ensure the safe conduct of operations.

title: Design of Automated Coating Solution for Steel Towers
requirement: Design of Automated Coating Solution for Steel Towers Under the complex conditions of limited internal space in the steel tower components and densely arranged low and narrow supports, complete the automated coating tasks for the inner and outer surfaces of the steel tower, ensuring that the coating thickness meets standards, the surface is uniform and free of runs, while also improving operational efficiency, shortening the production cycle, and achieving quality compliance.
solution: This article presents a solution for the automated painting task of the inner and outer surfaces of steel towers. Specifically, first, considering the differences in painting areas of the inner and outer surfaces and the short operational cycle for the inner cavity, an external facade wheeled spray painting robot (technology0) and an internal facade wheeled spray painting robot (technology1) are respectively used to efficiently complete the spraying of the outer and inner surfaces; secondly, to address the issues of the narrow inner cavity space and the overly dense arrangement of supporting columns, an internal facade scissor-type spray painting robot (technology2) is combined with BIM collaborative application (technology3), and through pre-programming and simulation optimization paths, precise painting operations are achieved; finally, through the coordinated operation of various equipment and reasonable planning, operational efficiency is successfully increased, ensuring that the coating quality meets standards, thereby achieving the goal of efficient inner and outer painting of steel tower segments.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the large surface area of the steel tower's interior coating and the short operation cycles, technology1 and technology2 are employed in collaboration. This utilizes wheel-based and scissor lift paint spraying robots to efficiently coat the interior surfaces and cavity, thereby improving efficiency and ensuring the coating quality meets the standards.

For analysis1, considering the dense corner supports at the bottom of the steel tower and the limited internal space, technology2 and technology3 are used. The compact size and flexible structural design of the internal surface scissor-type painting robot enable coating of low areas. At the same time, BIM collaborative simulation is used to optimize the work path and interference in advance, ensuring smooth completion of the coating work.

title: Technical Research on the Design of Steel-Concrete Composite Box Girder Bridge Solutions
requirement: Technical Research on the Design of Steel-Concrete Composite Box Girder Bridge Solutions In the construction of steel-concrete composite box girder bridges, the goal is to meet the design requirements for bending, shear, and torsion resistance, ensuring structural stability and construction safety. In terms of size determination, it is necessary to comprehensively consider the span-to-depth ratio of the main girder, the height-to-thickness ratio of the webs, and the arrangement of the stiffeners, while also optimizing the design of the cross braces and diaphragms, ultimately achieving a bridge structure design that has a long service life and is convenient for construction.
solution: This paper presents a design solution for steel-concrete composite box girder bridges. Specifically, first, considering that a curvature less than 0.3 rad may induce an increase in bending moment, the main girder's high-span ratio design control technology is used to ensure bending performance through optimization of the high-span ratio design. Secondly, addressing the problem of web instability, web and stiffener design techniques are employed to enhance stability through the arrangement of longitudinal and transverse stiffeners. At the same time, in terms of the main girder width and box girder spacing, the main girder width and spacing optimization technology is used to ensure the rationality of construction, transportation, and maintenance. In addition, to avoid lateral torsional instability during construction, upper transverse bracing design technology is adopted to regulate the bracing arrangement and strengthen construction stability. Finally, in response to the requirements for diaphragm stiffness and spacing, diaphragm specification design technology is applied to enhance overall rigidity and reduce distortion and deformation through the reasonable arrangement of the stiffness and spacing of the diaphragms.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that the effect of curvature on the increase of bending moments may impact design safety, technology0 is used to optimize the high span-to-depth ratio design of the main beam to ensure that the structure meets the bending load capacity requirements.

For analysis2, considering that the web design needs to meet high aspect ratio and stiffener stiffness distribution, use technology1 to improve the stability performance of the web by reasonably arranging longitudinal and transverse stiffeners to prevent instability.

For analysis3, considering the impact of main beam width and spacing on lateral stability, use technology2 to optimize the design of height-to-width ratio and beam width spacing to ensure the rationality of stress and construction while reducing installation difficulty.

For analysis5, considering the construction stability requirements, use technology3 by setting 45° inclined box cross-braces and controlling the area and aspect ratio of the cross-braces to ensure sufficient rigidity to avoid lateral torsional instability during the construction phase.

For analysis 6, considering the structural deformation issues that may arise from insufficient stiffness of the diaphragm, use technology 4 to optimize the stiffness and spacing design of the diaphragm in conjunction with the actual span, avoiding excessive local stress and cross-sectional deformation.

title: Research on the Selection and Design of Hub Interchange Locations and Schemes under the Influence of Railway Factors
requirement: Research on the Selection and Design of Hub Interchange Locations and Schemes under the Influence of Railway Factors Under the conditions of proximity between the railway and highway, high traffic flow, complex geological conditions, and strict ecological control, complete the location selection and design task for the Guanyun East Hub interchange, ensuring that the hub design meets transportation functionality and ecological requirements while also controlling the scale of the project and implementation difficulty.
solution: This paper proposes a hub design scheme based on the symmetrical double-ring cloverleaf layout (with the ring located to the north). Specifically, first, considering the proximity of the railway to the highway, the project may encounter complex construction and operational safety issues associated with railway crossings. Therefore, multiple underpasses of the railway are used, and the layout of intersections is optimized to ensure construction safety. Second, to address the issue of high main traffic flow, a double-ring cloverleaf layout is employed to enhance the traffic efficiency of the main flow through the semi-direct connection ramp layout. Third, considering the geological issue of significant soft soil thickness, the foundation design is optimized, and reinforcement measures are combined to control settlement.
