Finally, in response to ecological protection and land use restrictions, a design approach that avoids primary control zones and minimizes the demolition of residential houses is adopted to meet environmental and social demands. Scheme one has been approved with minimal engineering cost while meeting railway safety requirements and achieving high efficiency in both primary and secondary traffic directions, providing good reference value.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that the railway is close to the highway and the complexity of crossing construction, technology0 is adopted to pass under the connected salt railway multiple times while maintaining a safe distance, and simultaneously optimizing the design of the railway and ramp intersection to reduce construction risks and ensure the safety of railway operations.

Regarding analysis1, considering the need for efficient conversion of the main traffic flow at the hub, technology0 is used to layout the primary and secondary traffic flows, with semi-direct ramps to enhance the traffic capacity in the main direction while keeping construction costs manageable.

For analysis2, considering the geological issue of thick soft soil, minimize the foundation load through optimized bridge structural design, and integrate foundation reinforcement construction technology to comprehensively control foundation settlement.

For analysis3, taking into account ecological protection and the issue of dense residential areas, technology2 is used to avoid first-level control zones and key residential areas, achieving precise optimization of the design location to ensure that the site selection meets environmental protection and land use requirements.

title: Design of Explosive solution for Railway Tunnels
requirement: Design of Explosive solution for Railway Tunnels Under the conditions of large tunnel excavation cross-sectional area, complex surrounding rock grades, vibration risks near residential areas, and easy dispersion of blasting debris, complete the blasting excavation construction task for the 1861m-long Nantang Mountain Tunnel. It is required to efficiently and safely apply various methods such as the full-section method, step method, and mechanical-assisted weak blasting excavation, while preventing the hazards of flying rocks and the impact of seismic effects on the surrounding environment, ensuring the safety of construction personnel and the smooth progress of the project.
solution: This article presents a blasting construction solution for tunnel excavation with large cross-sections, complex surrounding rock, and safety hazards from seismic activities and flying rocks. Specifically, first, considering that the complexity of the surrounding rock may lead to collapse and under-excavation or over-excavation issues, the use of step-by-step excavation techniques combined with weak blasting technology is proposed. This ensures surrounding rock stability and efficient operation through reasonable blast hole arrangements and different segmentation methods. Secondly, to address potential threats from seismic effects on surrounding buildings, seismic effect control technology is employed, adjusting blasting parameters based on seismic measurements and ensuring safe distances to effectively control vibration impacts. Furthermore, to tackle the challenges posed by rockfall diffusion and potential construction hazards, safety measures against flying rocks are implemented, ensuring that the hazards are controlled through entrance shielding and protective zone warning lines. Lastly, by combining smooth face blasting technology and blind hole treatment technology, precise layout and timely handling of hazardous points improve excavation quality and construction efficiency. At the same time, blasting ventilation uses 75kW axial flow ventilation equipment and forced exhaust methods to ensure air quality meets standards, further safeguarding the health of the construction personnel and construction safety.

explanation.content: In response to analysis0, considering the complexity of the surrounding rock grade and the requirements for construction stability, technology0 and technology1 were used. Through the step method and mechanical coordination of weak blasting technology, the blasting hole arrangement and explosive load were designed based on the differences in the surrounding rock, achieving stable excavation of the surrounding rock and improved blasting efficiency.

For analysis1, considering that the seismic effects on adjacent residential areas may pose a risk of building damage, technology4 is used to calculate the safe distance and adjust the blasting parameters in sections, ultimately controlling the vibration effects within acceptable limits.

For analysis2, considering that flying debris diffusion may pose a safety threat, technology3 was employed to reduce the range of flying debris diffusion by using wire mesh shielding, enhancing vigilance, and implementing explosive segmentation to minimize hazards to areas outside the opening.

For analysis3, considering the importance of precise placement of blasting holes and the handling of misfires, utilize technology2 and technology6 to achieve precise excavation through smooth blasting technology, while employing specialized methods for misfire handling to ensure construction safety and efficiency.

title: Design of the interchange scheme for the Changyi Expressway Sujiaba Hub.
requirement: Design of the interchange scheme for the Changyi Expressway Sujiaba Hub. Under the conditions of complex traffic direction changes, multiple intersections, varying traffic flow from multiple directions, and utilizing existing facilities, complete the design task for the Changyi Double-line Expressway Sujiaba Hub interchange, ensuring that both short-term and long-term traffic capacity demands are met, while prioritizing traffic safety and economic costs.
solution: This article proposes an independent dual interchange scheme for the Sujiaba hub. Specifically, first, considering the safety hazards that may arise from frequent traffic turning directions and short-distance weaving, an independent hub design technology is adopted to create a sufficient distance between the Sujiaba interchange and the Bijia Mountain dual hub, eliminating the weaving issue; second, in response to the need to maximize the utilization of existing facilities, the existing ramps and mainline facilities of the Sujiaba interchange are retained to reduce project scale and costs; finally, to meet both the immediate high traffic volume and long-term traffic access needs, a scheme is proposed to set aside future ramp dispersal lanes, optimizing the capacity design and ensuring the dynamic adaptability of the design scheme and the scientific organization of traffic flow.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the multiple traffic directions and the fact that the intersection points are not in the same location, which may lead to traffic flow complexity and safety issues, technology0 is utilized. An independent double interchange design increases the distance between intersection points, creating an interchange solution between Sujiaba and Bijianshan, eliminating short-distance weaving points and achieving safe traffic flow transitions.

For analysis1, considering that the Sujiaba interchange has been partially completed and the need to make the maximum use of existing facilities, technology0 was chosen. This plan retains the existing ramps and mainline facilities to the greatest extent, avoiding large-scale reconstruction or demolition, thereby effectively controlling the project scale and cost.

For analysis2, considering the recent need to meet the high flow demand from Wangcheng District of Changsha to Yiyang, and the long-term need to adapt to the complex conditions of the Yichang-Fuchang double track connection, technology1 is utilized to enhance the traffic capacity through a double-lane distributed traffic design. Additionally, combined with the independent hub interchange design of technology0, reasonable planning for future traffic directions is ensured by increasing the interchange spacing and reserving ramp lanes, so that both recent and future demands can be met.

title: Research on the Design of Conversion Scheme for Long-Distance Beam Erection Equipment in Tunnels
requirement: Research on the Design of Conversion Scheme for Long-Distance Beam Erection Equipment in Tunnels Under the conditions of a narrow construction site, long transportation distances, and complex terrain, complete the task of long-distance beam erection for the Zhonglan Passenger Dedicated Line project, including the transportation and erection of a total of 188 box girders, which involves 161 girders after the Biyun Mountain Tunnel and 27 girders after the Jianjin Mountain Tunnel, ensuring that the beam erection efficiency meets the progress target of 1.5 holes per day.
solution: This article presents a tooling conversion plan for the task of bridging in long-distance tunnel operations. Specifically, first, considering that the inlet and outlet sites of the tunnel are narrow and the road conditions are poor, making it impossible to use large equipment, a combined transport and bridging machine technology is adopted to improve the adaptability of bridging operations through a compact and flexible design. Second, to address the issue of low transportation efficiency caused by long transport distances, a relay transport method using a beam transport vehicle and a combined transport and bridging machine is employed, along with process optimization to improve transport efficiency, meeting the construction pace of 1.5 segments per day. Third, considering the installation limitations of lifting equipment due to complex terrain conditions, the SXJ900 bridge machine is modified into a lifting machine to reduce installation and disassembly difficulties and lower construction costs. Finally, a location design is carried out for the beam yard at the tunnel entrance, overcoming site and terrain constraints by precisely laying out storage platforms and optimizing equipment operation processes, thereby providing strong support for the tunnel bridging task.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the narrow construction site and the difficulty of using large self-owned equipment, the tunnel beam-laying technology using technology0 integrated machine was adopted instead of traditional large equipment, and technical improvements were made to adapt to the limited space, successfully resolving the site restriction issue.

For analysis1, considering the challenge of low transportation efficiency due to long distances, a relay transportation technology using technology1 beam transport vehicles combined with a transport frame integrated machine was employed. This reduced transportation time through the relay operation of two beam transport vehicles while ensuring construction progress.

For analysis2, considering the difficulty of installing and dismantling large beam-lifting equipment, the technology2 bridge erection machine modification and lifting technology will be used to transform the SXJ900 bridge erection machine into a beam-lifting machine, simplifying the installation process and reducing space requirements.

For analysis2, considering the limitations of complex terrain, the technology3 design and optimization technology for the cantilever staging area is utilized to design and establish the cantilever staging area before the tunnel entrance. By reasonably arranging temporary beam storage platforms and movable tools, the construction process is optimized.

title: Design of the hub scheme for the Dan Yang to Jin Tan section of the Fujili Expressway in the Jin Tan Economic Development Zone.
requirement: Design of the hub scheme for the Dan Yang to Jin Tan section of the Fujili Expressway in the Jin Tan Economic Development Zone. Under the complex hydrological conditions of the plain area, as well as the existing railway and expressway control conditions, complete the design of the second phase plan for the Jintan Economic Development Zone hub, and achieve efficient connection with the interfaces reserved in the first phase, to meet the projected turning traffic volume demand (35,643 pcu/d) for 2046, while ensuring traffic safety and economic feasibility.
solution: This article proposes an optimized design for the second phase of the Jintan Economic Development Zone hub. Specifically, first, considering the complex hydrological conditions of the plains and the limitations on the layout of railway bridges, which may lead to limited space for the hub layout, the original design scheme of the hub is further optimized using merging techniques for entrance ramps to reduce interference with mainline traffic and effectively utilize the reserved ramps from the first phase, achieving efficient connectivity of the hub layout. Secondly, to address the potential mismatch problems that may arise due to design requirements needing to meet both old and new standards, an optimized ramp layout and a new-old standards integration plan are adopted. Through semi-directional ramp merging design and curve radius optimization, the overall traffic service functions are enhanced, while avoiding the need for widening on existing bridges of the Changhe Expressway. Finally, given the precious land resources in the southern Jiangsu region and economic requirements, optimization techniques for the original scheme's engineering scale are employed, successfully controlling the additional land occupation to a small range while saving about 50 million yuan in investment costs. This scheme balances convenience, safety, and economic goals while meeting traffic volume demands.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the flat terrain and various restrictions from water systems and railways, which may affect the layout space of the hub, the use of technology0 combined with the original hub design plan prioritizes the utilization of reserved ramps and optimizes the layout, reducing the land occupancy of the hub and the interference with railway bridges, effectively addressing the challenges posed by such conditions.

In response to analysis1, considering the need for the design to connect with the reserved interfaces of the first phase and the differences in standards, we used technology1 and technology2 to optimize the design of the ramp variable speed lane and the semi-directional ramp merging, reducing the interference of continuous mainline ingress and egress, and adjusting the original design curve width and radius to meet current standards, achieving improvements in standard compatibility and service level.

For analysis2, considering economic constraints and the precious land resources in the area, use technology0 to continue adopting the original design plan while strengthening optimization. By combining the constraints of land area and project scale, reduce the additional land occupation area, saving approximately 50 million yuan in investment and achieving the economic feasibility goals of the plan.

title: Design analysis of a certain interchange scheme under restricted conditions.
requirement: Design analysis of a certain interchange scheme under restricted conditions. Under the constraints of existing line position restrictions on the Chengyu Expressway, the relatively low traffic volume projected for the year 2044, and the complex terrain and physical conditions in the interchange area, complete the design task for the Lizigou hub interchange that allows for quick transitions in the directions of Chengdu-Tongliang, Tongliang-Neijiang, and others, ensuring that it meets traffic demand, land-saving utilization, safety, and engineering operability requirements.
solution: This article presents three design solution for interchanges. After comprehensive comparison, the diplomatic cross T-shaped interchange solution is recommended (technology2). Specifically, first, considering that the location of the intersecting lines and complex terrain may limit layout flexibility, the diplomatic cross T-shaped interchange solution is adopted, optimizing the arrangement of bridges and ramps to reduce interference with oil pipelines and existing roads, while ensuring functional requirements; secondly, to address the issue of low traffic volumes in the long-term perspective, the ramp design speed is set at 50 km/h or 60 km/h, enhancing conversion capacity while avoiding cost waste due to high standard designs; finally, under the constraints of terrain, land features, and land use, the effective area of the triangular zone is compressed to save land resources, optimize ramp alignment, and reduce project scale and environmental impact, ultimately achieving the goal of saving land and controllable costs.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the constraints posed by the intersecting line positioning and terrain limitations, which may restrict layout connectivity, we optimize the bridge and ramp layout using a technology2 diplomatic cross T-shaped interchange solution to reduce interference with oil pipelines and existing roads, control the scale of the project, and ultimately meet functional requirements.

For analysis1, considering the relatively low traffic volume in the long-term perspective and the risk of wasting resources, the pear-shaped interchange plan using technology1 is adopted. By reasonably reducing the design speed and flexibly arranging the layout, the scale and cost of the bridge are reduced to meet actual needs, avoiding unnecessary expenses resulting from high standard designs.

For analysis 2, considering the topographical features and land use restrictions, choose the technology 2 diplomatic cross T-shaped interchange plan to reduce the land area while optimizing the ramp alignment to minimize land occupation, ensuring the safety of the project.

title: Design of the hidden cover beam prefabricated small box girder bridge solution
requirement: Design of the hidden cover beam prefabricated small box girder bridge solution Under the conditions of limited length of the interchange weaving section, high clearance requirements under the bridge, and the need to control overall costs, complete the design of the concealed cover beam prefabricated small box girder bridge, requiring a bridge width of 25.5 m, minimizing the overall height of the bridge, a design lifespan of 100 years, and achieving a primary safety level, while meeting seismic and load standard requirements.
solution: This article presents the design scheme for a hidden cover beam prefabricated small box girder bridge. Specifically, first, considering the impact of bridge height on the clearance and cost, the hidden cover beam technology and prefabricated small box girder technology are employed to reduce the overall height and cost of the bridge by eliminating the independent cover beam and optimizing the layout of the small box girders. Second, to address the issues of significant negative bending moments and insufficient stiffness, on-site cast transverse beam technology is adopted to enhance the overall structural integrity and improve the strength of the transverse beams. Finally, using bridge structural calculation and analysis technology, detailed analysis of the stress conditions and overturning stability of the overall structure is performed through finite element modeling to ensure that the design meets the regulatory requirements for first-level safety and seismic intensity of 7 degrees.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that an overall bridge height that is too high will affect the clearance below the bridge and increase costs, technology0 and technology1 are adopted to reduce the structural height through a concealed beam design, optimizing the use of space beneath the bridge, while also reducing bridge construction costs through prefabricated small box beams.

For analysis1, considering that the large span and negative bending moments may lead to substandard structural performance, technology2 and technology3 are employed, utilizing the cast-in-situ beam process to enhance the stiffness of the beams. The stability and strength of both the beam and the main girder are verified through bridge structural calculation and analysis techniques to ensure that the design meets safety requirements.

title: Design and effectiveness verification of the intelligent transformation scheme for tunnel lining formwork trolleys.
requirement: Design and effectiveness verification of the intelligent transformation scheme for tunnel lining formwork trolleys. Under the limited capabilities of the traditional control system for tunnel lining template vehicles, complete the intelligent transformation, aiming to optimize the convenience of operation, safety, and construction accuracy, enhance operational efficiency, and achieve automated operation.
solution: This article proposes an intelligent transformation plan for tunnel lining formwork carriages. Specifically, first, considering the issue of low efficiency caused by the reliance on manual operation in the existing system, an integrated intelligent control system is used to achieve automatic operations with an accuracy of within 3mm through one-click mold opening, walking, and mold closing technologies. Secondly, to address the issue of asynchronous movements, motion synchronization monitoring and control technology is employed to ensure oil cylinder linkage through pressure and displacement sensors, avoiding damage to the carriage structure. Thirdly, to tackle the problem of lack of real-time monitoring, a safety warning and real-time monitoring system is implemented, featuring sensors to monitor mold expansion trends, stress changes, and the state of the carriage, preventing safety incidents. Finally, to resolve complex operation issues, a multi-mode operation system is used, incorporating remote control, manual, and automatic modes to provide operators with a flexible and efficient user experience.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the issues of existing trolley control relying on manual operation and low automation levels, introduce technology0 to reduce human intervention through an intelligent integrated control system, achieving quick conversion of operating modes and improving accuracy.

For analysis1, considering the issue of unsynchronized movement of the oil cylinder, use technology1 to achieve synchronized control through displacement and pressure monitoring devices, while avoiding the risks of structural shaking and tearing.

For analysis2, considering the issue of lack of real-time status monitoring, technology2 is adopted to enhance real-time feedback mechanisms such as expansion mold monitoring and stress sensing through a multi-sensor monitoring system to ensure construction safety.

For analysis3, considering the high complexity of human operation, technology3 is used to provide remote control, manual, and automatic multi-mode operation, simplifying the operating steps with a touchscreen and remote control to avoid the risk of misoperation.

title: Design of non-vehicle-mounted charger testing platform solution
requirement: Design of non-vehicle-mounted charger testing platform solution Under the diverse input and output characteristics and complex operating states of non-vehicle charging machines, complete tests on their safety comprehensive performance, electrical parameter performance, communication protocol consistency, and interoperability. The testing platform is required to have high precision, high efficiency, and the capability to comply with national standards such as GB/T 18487.1-2017, GB/T 27930-2015, and GB/T 34657.1-2017.
solution: This article presents a detailed scheme for the testing platform of non-vehicle-mounted chargers. Specifically, first, considering the diversity of input and output characteristics of non-vehicle-mounted chargers, complex power and load simulation requirements may arise. Therefore, a three-phase programmable AC power supply and pure resistive and electronic programmable DC loads are used to accommodate various power supply scenarios and load characteristics. Second, due to the importance of consistency in vehicle interfaces and charging communication protocols, a vehicle interface circuit simulator and a signal acquisition and testing system are utilized. Through accurate simulation of vehicle interface signals and real-time signal acquisition and analysis, interoperability and communication stability are ensured. Finally, taking into account the need to cover safety regulations, electrical parameters, and communication protocol consistency testing, high-precision power analyzers and automated testing software are employed. Through precise data acquisition and processing, as well as automated report generation, testing efficiency and result reliability are improved, thus supporting comprehensive performance testing of non-vehicle-mounted chargers.

explanation.content: In response to analysis0, considering the diverse input and output characteristics of non-vehicle chargers, which may lead to complex power and load simulation requirements, using technology0 and technology1, these technologies can meet the power supply and load demands for non-vehicle chargers below 550kW through programmable AC power supplies and adjustable loads, achieving broad adaptability.

For analysis1, considering that the consistency of the vehicle interface and charging communication protocol has a significant impact on charging performance, technology2 and technology5 are used. These technologies achieve comprehensive testing of interface communication consistency, interoperability, and charging stability through precise simulation of interface signals and signal acquisition analysis.

For analysis2, considering that the tests need to cover multiple indicators such as safety regulations, electrical parameters, and protocol consistency, technology3 and technology4 are used. These technologies ensure reliable results and testing efficiency by providing highly accurate electrical performance measurements through power analyzers and utilizing automated testing software to improve testing efficiency.

title: Design and construction control of the scheme for replacing columns and extending the prestressed concrete continuous beam support beams.
requirement: Design and construction control of the scheme for replacing columns and extending the prestressed concrete continuous beam support beams. The original bridge consists of a (35+60+35)m prestressed concrete continuous box girder, and it is necessary to dismantle the original platform, extend the side holes, and complete the implementation of the beam replacement and column extension plan while ensuring operational safety and maintaining the bridge's structural force system unchanged.
solution: This article proposes the design and construction control plan for the replacement of the supporting beams with new columns in a (35+60+35)m prestressed concrete continuous beam bridge. Specifically, first, considering that the excavation of the bridge abutment soil may expose the pile foundation, a temporary pier support system is designed and optimized for location, which avoids changes to the original function and load-bearing system through structural support; second, to address potential abnormal stress in the side openings caused by the direct removal of the original abutment, finite element analysis is used to verify the deformation deflection (total cumulative 10.0mm) and standard combined stress (maximum stress 16.18MPa) during construction to ensure the reliability of the temporary pier support; third, given the limited construction space, diamond wire saws are used for segmental cutting and removal of the abutment and temporary piers, and the optimization of pier pile spacing meets spatial layout regulations; finally, through construction monitoring and control technology, the rate of beam deformation and vertical displacement changes (total displacement ≤ 3.0mm) are monitored throughout the process, ensuring overall structural safety and the implementation of the plan.

explanation.content: In response to analysis0, considering that excavating the original bridge abutment soil may expose the pile foundation, a temporary pier support system design using technology0 was employed, supporting the upper beam through the temporary pier while optimizing the temporary pier position with technology1 to reduce the load impact, thus addressing the issue of insufficient load on the pile foundation resulting in changes to the bridge's load-bearing system.

For analysis1, considering that the removal of the edge hole of the original bridge abutment may cause issues with cantilever stress conditions and exceed the tensile stress limit, a temporary pier support system designed with technology0 will be used. The temporary pier will be placed near the bridge abutment to effectively shorten the cantilever length, while a finite element check using technology3 will ensure reliable stress conditions during the temporary state.

For analysis2, considering the limitations of the construction space and the issue of pile foundation net distance, optimize the position of temporary pier foundation through technology1 to meet the regulatory requirements, and use a diamond wire saw (technology2) for segmented cutting and demolition of the original abutment and temporary pier, ensuring that the construction space and pile foundation spacing meet layout needs.

For analysis2 and construction process control, utilize technology4's construction monitoring and control technology to monitor key position displacements and ensure the bridge's condition, in order to avoid issues caused by deformation or abnormal stress of the beams during construction.

title: Design of treatment plans for diseases at the junction of old and new roadbeds on plateau highways.
requirement: Design of treatment plans for diseases at the junction of old and new roadbeds on plateau highways. In the conditions of permafrost regions at high altitudes and the connection between old and new roadbeds, complete the task of widening and modifying the roadbed, ensuring stability at the junctions, preventing differential settlement and damage caused by freeze-thaw cycles, and achieving the goals of roadbed stability and improved pavement performance.
solution: This article proposes a design solution for the connection between old and new roadbeds in plateau areas. Specifically, first, considering the differential settlement issues between the old and new roadbeds, lightweight embankment technology is used to reduce the overburden load on the foundation by utilizing EPS materials, effectively controlling settlement; secondly, in response to the risk of underlying damage caused by the seasonal freeze-thaw cycles in permafrost, a combination of gravel layer and pebble blind ditch technology is adopted to guide underground runoff and interrupt the freeze-thaw effect, while additionally laying a grassland insulation layer to coordinate temperature changes in the soil; finally, to improve the connection between the old and new roadbeds, a stepped excavation with a certain width-height ratio is made and geogrid materials are added to enhance the stability and anti-settlement capability of the connection at the roadbed.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the issue of uneven settlement caused by differences in materials and consolidation methods between the old and new roadbeds, the use of technology0 lightweight embankment treatment is adopted, which addresses differential settlement by reducing the self-weight of the new roadbed, combined with technology1 slope reduction treatment to enhance the stability of the connection between the old and new roadbeds.

In response to analysis1, considering that the seasonal freeze-thaw cycle of permafrost may lead to instability of the foundation and issues such as mud pumping, the design of crushed gravel barriers and gravel blind ditches using technology2 is adopted to guide underground runoff and avoid the effects of frost heave, while additionally laying down mats for insulation to mitigate the destructive effects of the freeze-thaw cycle.

For analysis2, considering the exacerbation of differential settlement due to abundant wetland groundwater or slope sliding, the use of technology2 for groundwater blind ditch adjustment and frost treatment of the subgrade is adopted, combined with technology1 for reinforcement and step maintenance to stabilize the slopes and control the possibility of sliding.

title: Design of the tunnel-type ventilation scheme for high-altitude long tunnels.
requirement: Design of the tunnel-type ventilation scheme for high-altitude long tunnels. Under the conditions of plateau environment, long-distance construction, and complex geological conditions, complete the ventilation scheme design for the long tunnel in the plateau, ensuring that the air supply for each worker meets the standards while controlling pollutant concentrations to achieve a balance between construction safety and efficiency.
solution: This article proposes a tunnel ventilation scheme for high-altitude long tunnels. Specifically, first, considering that low atmospheric pressure at high altitudes may lead to insufficient air supply, high-altitude environmental air volume correction technology is used to calculate the required airflow after pressure correction (e.g., 2362 m³/min) and combined with a phased ventilation layout design to address the challenges of ventilation in low-pressure conditions. Secondly, to tackle wind loss issues during long-distance construction, tunnel ventilation technology and large-diameter flexible duct technology are employed. By optimizing duct design (e.g., using ducts with a diameter of 2.0 m) and a phased fan arrangement, long-distance airflow delivery is achieved. Finally, in response to air pollution control requirements at the construction face, airflow speed and air quality monitoring technologies along with duct repair techniques are utilized. By placing detection points at critical locations and timely repairing duct damages, it ensures compliance with oxygen concentration and airflow speed standards, while also reducing air leakage and wind loss. The entire scheme optimizes ventilation efficiency and construction safety assurance, resolving ventilation challenges in high-altitude tunnel construction, and providing a reference for similar projects.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the impact of low atmospheric pressure in high-altitude environments, technology1 is used for high-altitude airflow correction. By calculating the airflow demand after pressure correction (e.g., Q_high = 2362 m³/min), it is ensured that the airflow supply meets standards in high-altitude conditions to alleviate the construction difficulties caused by hypoxia.

For analysis1, considering the long-distance construction ventilation issue, the tunnel ventilation technology of technology0 combined with the large-diameter soft duct technology of technology2 is employed. By implementing phased ventilation arrangements and optimizing duct design (such as using a 2.0m diameter soft duct to increase transportation efficiency), the problems of insufficient fan air pressure and high air loss have been addressed, ensuring sufficient air supply at the construction site.

For analysis2, considering the multiple pollutant control requirements, the construction utilizes technology4 for wind speed and air quality monitoring. Detection points are arranged at critical locations, with regular sampling and parameter adjustments conducted through an anemometer and sensors. This ensures that the oxygen supply reaches 20% and the carbon monoxide concentration is below 30mg/m³. Additionally, technology5 is employed to address the impact of duct leaks, ensuring that the working environment meets the standards.

title: Design and Monitoring Analysis of Ventilation Scheme for High-Gas Long High-Speed Rail Tunnels
requirement: Design and Monitoring Analysis of Ventilation Scheme for High-Gas Long High-Speed Rail Tunnels Under the conditions of a high gas environment of 13,340 meters, complex multi-zone multi-phase construction, and a high risk of groundwater and gas mixing, complete the breakthrough construction task of the Baiyun Mountain high-speed rail tunnel, requiring the design of a reasonable ventilation plan and ensuring real-time dynamic monitoring of gas concentration and construction safety.
solution: This article proposes a ventilation and monitoring solution for the high gas tunnel at Baiyun Mountain. Specifically, firstly, considering that a high gas environment may lead to excessive gas concentration and explosion risks, pressurized ventilation technology is employed to quickly eliminate gas and ensure a low concentration environment; secondly, to address uneven ventilation coverage during multi-zone, multi-stage construction, a combination of pressurized ventilation and jet fan technology is implemented to achieve efficient ventilation throughout the tunnel; thirdly, to mitigate the risk of increased gas concentration caused by the mixing of groundwater and gas, water-gas separation technology is used to separate water vapor from the gas through blind pipes and gas discharge pipes, thereby reducing gas concentration in the tunnel; finally, to meet the need for real-time monitoring of gas concentration, an automatic safety monitoring system is utilized, which ensures timely alarms and power cut protection when gas concentration exceeds standards through sensor layout and dynamic alarms, ensuring construction safety.

explanation.content: In response to analysis0, considering that high gas tunnels may lead to excessive gas concentrations and explosion risks, implement the pressed ventilation technology from technology0 to quickly remove gas using axial flow fans, ensuring that the gas concentration at the workface remains below 0.3%.

Regarding analysis1, considering that multi-zone multi-stage construction leads to uneven ventilation coverage, use technology0 and technology1, combining both through pressurized ventilation to cover multiple work zones, and then adding jet fans after penetration to optimize airflow.

In response to analysis2, considering the risk of increased gas concentration caused by the water-gas mixture, use the water-gas separation technology of technology2 to separate the underground water and gas for discharge, avoiding the backflow of gas into the tunnel through the drainage system.

For analysis3, considering that real-time dynamic monitoring of gas may have monitoring delays and insufficient coverage, an automatic safety monitoring system using technology3 will be employed. This system will deploy multiple sensors to collect the gas concentration in various sections of the tunnel in real-time, triggering automatic alarms and power cut-off protection to ensure construction safety.

title: Design of Beam Placement Scheme for Highway Bridges with Small Radius Curves.
requirement: Design of Beam Placement Scheme for Highway Bridges with Small Radius Curves. Under the conditions of a small radius curved beam bridge with a radius of 250 m and a mid-span height of 23 cm, a reasonable design for the prefabricated bridge laying scheme needs to comprehensively consider the beam end offset, mid-span height, and construction convenience to ensure structural safety and construction feasibility.
solution: This article proposes a beam arrangement scheme for prefabricated components on small radius curved girder bridges. Specifically, first, addressing the conditions of a larger mid-span height, considering that an excessively long cantilever may affect structural safety and aesthetics, a method of adding a precast length to the edge beam is adopted, widening the inner side by 30 cm to meet safety and construction requirements for the cantilever; secondly, to tackle the challenges posed by significant differences in the ends of parallel beams and inconsistent angles of cap beams, a radial arrangement method is employed—where the main beam's oblique distances are equal—by unifying the angles of the beam slabs and cap beams to ensure the integrity of the structure and the standardization of construction; finally, to address the issue of significant variation in beam length in the radial arrangement, a method of adjusting the cast-in-place segment at the pier top is utilized, achieving consistency in beam lengths by adjusting the length of the cast-in-place segment at the top of the pier, thus enhancing construction convenience and structural performance.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that a large midspan height may lead to a long cantilever and reduced safety, the method of using technology0 to pre-fabricate an additional length for the side beam was adopted. By widening the inner side by 30 cm, the midspan height issue was resolved, allowing the cantilever to meet safety and aesthetic requirements.

For analysis1, considering the significant differences in beam end offsets and cap beam angles in parallel arrangements, a radial arrangement using technology1 was adopted, where the main beam's oblique distances are equal. By unifying the angles of the beam and cap beam, the inconsistencies in angles and lengths faced by the parallel arrangement method were resolved, and it was adapted to standardized construction conditions.

For analysis2, considering that the radial arrangement may cause a larger variation in beam length, the technique of adjusting the cast-in-place segment at the pier top using technology2 was adopted. By adjusting the length of the cast-in-place segment at the pier top, the issue of beam length consistency was resolved and the convenience of construction was improved.

title: Design of a comprehensive drainage and anti-drainage scheme for expressway widening.
requirement: Design of a comprehensive drainage and anti-drainage scheme for expressway widening. Under the conditions of needing to widen the embankment and complex drainage sources, design a comprehensive drainage scheme that can effectively control the moisture content of the embankment, in order to enhance the stability and durability of the embankment and ensure the safe normal use of the highway.
solution: This article presents a comprehensive design plan for the drainage and anti-drainage system for highway widening. Specifically, first, considering issues like water infiltration in the central median that may lead to increased moisture content in the subgrade, drainage design technology for the central median is utilized to effectively drain accumulated water through an underground drainage system and collection wells; second, to address moisture accumulation in areas away from drainage facilities after rainfall in cracked regions, internal drainage design technology is employed to construct a drainage system using a sand cushion layer and a filter layer to reduce moisture content; for the issues of rainwater drainage on the pavement and protection of the subgrade slopes, surface drainage design for the road is used to optimize ditch design for timely drainage and to prevent rainwater from eroding the subgrade slopes. This design comprehensively optimizes the subgrade drainage and anti-drainage system, reducing the subgrade moisture content from 20.9% before optimization to 17.2% after optimization, achieving a reduction in moisture content of approximately 20.15%, significantly enhancing the stability and durability of the subgrade, and providing important technical support for highway widening projects in China.

explanation.content: Addressing analysis0, considering that groundwater seepage from the central reservation and other moisture sources may increase the moisture content of the subgrade and cause stability issues, technology0 was used to solve the problem of concentrated accumulation of seepage by improving drainage capacity through underground drainage systems, sump wells, and pavement slope enhancements.

In response to analysis1, considering the high moisture content in the area far from the drainage facilities after rainfall, which leads to moisture accumulation and erosion risk in the embankment, technology2 is used to construct an internal drainage system by setting up a sand particle cushion layer and a filter layer, effectively discharging infiltrated moisture and reducing the moisture content in the area where the cracks are located.

In response to analysis1, to address the issue of increased moisture content caused by lateral infiltration of rainwater on the pavement, technology1 is used, applying highly durable polyethylene ditches and optimizing the trapezoidal drainage ditch design to timely drain rainwater and protect the roadbed slopes, thereby reducing the erosion effect of water flow on the slopes.

title: Analysis of the Design Scheme for the Expansion and Reconstruction Project of the Highway
requirement: Analysis of the Design Scheme for the Expansion and Reconstruction Project of the Highway Under the conditions of the original design being a two-way four-lane road, significant traffic volume increase, and the service level of the original section dropping to level three, the road is to be expanded and rebuilt into a two-way eight-lane road, with the total roadbed width increased to 42 m. This will address the issues of jointing and settlement between the old and new roadbeds, as well as the pavement jointing issues, and establish a drainage system to meet the increased traffic capacity requirements.
solution: This article proposes a comprehensive highway upgrading and expansion plan. Specifically, first, considering that widening the roadbed may cause offset and settlement issues, a dual-side widening roadbed technology is used, which reduces uneven settlement (only 9.41 cm) through a symmetrical widening approach and minimizes the amount of demolition; secondly, to address potential insufficient connection issues during the splicing of the old and new roadbeds, a layered stepped splicing technique is employed, laying steel-plastic geogrids and designing 1.5 m wide steps to improve connection stability; furthermore, to resolve the stress concentration issues in pavement splicing, a 120~300 cm pavement overlap plan is utilized, optimizing the seam locations to avoid heavy vehicle wheel paths, enhancing splicing strength and durability; finally, to tackle the issue of water accumulation in low-lying areas affecting overall drainage, a water accumulation protection and centralized drainage system is established, eliminating some drainage ditches and using overflow pools and rapid channels to optimize water flow paths, effectively protecting the roadbed structure.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the issues of offset and linear adjustments in the widening of the roadbed, technology0 is used. By widening the roadbed on both sides, the construction complexity and settlement differences can be effectively reduced, and the amount of demolition can be minimized, meeting the demand for a bi-directional eight-lane road.

For analysis1, considering the potential issues of uneven settlement and cross-slope irregularities during the splicing of old and new roadbeds, technology1 will be used to implement a layered step-type splicing and the installation of steel-plastic grids to improve the connectivity and stability of both sides, thereby reducing settlement differences.

For analysis2, to avoid the problem of stress concentration leading to cracks during pavement splicing, technology2 is used, with a splicing plan that adopts an overlapping width of 120-300 cm, avoiding heavy vehicle wheel paths at the top layer seams to reduce stress concentration and improve durability.

Regarding analysis3, considering the impact of water accumulation in low-lying areas on the adaptation of the roadbed and drainage system, use technology3 to eliminate drainage ditches in low-lying areas, and construct a flume and overflow pool to form a drainage system, avoiding water accumulation that could damage the roadbed structure.

title: Design of the modification plan for highway wavy beam guardrails
requirement: Design of the modification plan for highway wavy beam guardrails Under the conditions of insufficient height and protective energy of the old highway w-beam guardrails, complete the design task for reinforcing and modifying the guardrails, aiming to improve the height and protective performance of the guardrails while meeting the requirements for Level 3 (Grade A) protective standards specified in the "Design Specifications for Highway Traffic Safety Facilities" (JTG D81—2017) and the "Safety Performance Evaluation Standard for Highway Guardrails" (JTG B05-01—2013).
solution: This article proposes a reinforcement and modification plan for the corrugated beam guardrails on highways. Specifically, first, considering that the modification of the guardrail requires an increase in height and protective capacity, composite corrugated beam structure technology and double-layer double-wave guardrail technology are used to optimize the rigidity and layering design of the guardrail, achieving enhanced protection for different vehicle types; second, addressing the issue of insufficient dimensions of the original guardrail posts, a modification technology using existing posts with additional casing is employed, which involves adding new posts to the outside of the original posts, thus meeting the regulatory requirements while fully utilizing existing materials and saving construction costs; finally, considering the need to verify that the guardrail performance meets the requirements of the Level 3 (A-level) protection rating, computer simulations of collision tests are combined with full-scale collision tests using real vehicles, through dynamic simulation and actual collision validation to assess the guardrail's blocking, buffering, and guiding functions, ultimately ensuring the scientific and feasibility of the modification plan.

explanation.content: Regarding analysis0, considering the insufficient height of the guardrail and low protective energy, using technology0 and technology2, a combination of wave beam structure and double-layer double-wave guardrail design has been employed to enhance the rigidity and protective effect of the guardrail, achieving improved protective capability against different vehicle types.

Regarding analysis1, considering that the modification of the existing guardrail needs to balance cost and performance, use technology1 to effectively utilize existing materials by encasing a larger diameter column around the original support posts, achieving the goal of meeting regulatory requirements while saving costs.

For analysis2, considering that the modification of the guardrail needs to verify its protective performance, use technology3 and technology4, through computer simulation experiments to optimize the detailed design, in conjunction with full-scale vehicle collision tests, to ensure that the guardrail meets the requirements for 160 kJ energy protection and vehicle deflection functionality.

title: Research on the Design Optimization of Soft Soil Subgrade Treatment Solutions for Highways
requirement: Research on the Design Optimization of Soft Soil Subgrade Treatment Solutions for Highways Under the conditions of thick soft soil layers, uneven burial depth, and low bearing capacity, complete the treatment tasks for the soft soil subgrade in the highway widening and reconstruction project, ensuring the overall stability of the subgrade and controlling the soft soil subgrade settlement to meet the requirements of the "Highway Subgrade Design Code," especially with settlement near the abutments ≤0.10m and subgrade segment settlement ≤0.30m.
solution: This article proposes an optimized treatment plan for the renovation and expansion of soft soil subgrade on highways. Specifically, first, considering the long-term settlement issues caused by the weak permeability and high water content of soft soil, as well as the risk of large deformations due to high compressibility and low compressive modulus, the cement-stabilized pile technology is applied to enhance the compressive modulus of soft soil and rapidly stabilize the soft soil foundation using piles with a diameter of 0.5m and spacing of 1.5m. Second, for conditions where the depth of deep soft soil is considerable and the geology is complex, either cement-stabilized piles or prestressed pipe pile solutions are chosen, particularly using prestressed pipe piles near bridge abutments. These piles, with a wall thickness of 6cm and a diameter of 0.4m, ensure that the settlement requirement of ≤0.10m is met. Lastly, calculations of post-treatment settlement indicate that both solutions comply with the standards, and economically, it is advisable to use cement-stabilized piles for general subgrade sections, while prestressed pipe piles should be prioritized near bridge abutments or culverts.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the long-term settlement issues caused by the weak permeability and high water content of soft soil, the drainage and consolidation method of technology0 can effectively reduce the water content. However, due to the long construction period, it is not suitable for projects with tight schedules. Therefore, technology1 is chosen to quickly enhance the bearing capacity of the soft soil and reduce settlement through cement mixing piles.

For analysis 1, considering that the high compressibility and low compressive modulus of soft soil can lead to significant deformation, the technology 1 cement mixing pile solution was adopted. Measures such as entering the bearing layer from the bottom of the pile improved the compression modulus of the subgrade and reduced the risk of settlement.

For analysis2, considering the characteristics of deep burial and significant thickness of soft soil, the replacement method incurs high costs and may disturb the existing roadbed. Therefore, the options of technology1 cement mixing piles or technology2 prestressed pipe piles are selected to treat the deep soft soil while ensuring that the reinforcement depth is controllable.

For analysis3, considering the high load requirements near the abutment and strict settlement control requirements, the technology2 prestressed pipe pile solution addresses the settlement issues near the abutment by leveraging its high rigidity and short construction period, while also avoiding disturbance to the existing roadbed.

title: Intelligent dimming control scheme design for highway tunnel entrances.
requirement: Intelligent dimming control scheme design for highway tunnel entrances. Due to the significant differences in light intensity inside and outside the tunnel, as well as variations in weather, traffic volume, and time periods, design an intelligent dimming control system to meet the needs of driving safety and energy conservation.
solution: This article presents an intelligent dimming control scheme for highway tunnels. Specifically, first, to address the significant disparity in illumination levels inside and outside the tunnel that may lead to the black hole effect, the L20 method and environmental diagram method are used to determine the brightness at the tunnel entrance, and the visual adaptation issue is resolved by dynamically adjusting the entrance lighting; secondly, to prevent the white hole effect caused by variations in low light intensity inside the tunnel, an intelligent dimming system adjusts brightness and color temperature based on real-time environmental conditions to avoid visual abrupt changes; finally, in response to dynamic changes due to external factors such as weather, seasons, and traffic flow, a combination of RS-485 communication technology, single lamp controllers, and a centralized software monitoring platform is utilized to control the brightness and lighting plan of the lamps by analyzing real-time data, achieving a safe and energy-efficient tunnel lighting solution.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the strong external light and the darker conditions inside the tunnel leading to the black hole effect, the brightness outside the tunnel was measured using technology0 and technology2 through the L20 method, combined with an environmental schematic method for a comprehensive analysis of the sky, road surface, and surrounding environment, to determine the reasonable brightness at the entrance section, thus resolving the issue of unclear visibility for drivers entering the tunnel.

For analysis1, considering the white hole effect caused by weak light inside the tunnel and strong external light, technologies 0 and 1 were employed to measure the brightness difference inside and outside the tunnel using the L20 method. Coupled with a smart dimming system, this dynamically adjusted the lighting at the tunnel entrance and transition sections, addressing the visual adaptation issues caused by abrupt changes in brightness.

For analysis2, considering the varying requirements for lighting brightness due to changes in weather, seasons, traffic volume, and time periods, use technology1, technology3, technology4, and technology5. Through an intelligent dimming system combined with RS-485 communication technology and individual lamp controllers, utilize central software and mobile real-time monitoring to adjust luminous flux and color temperature based on changing external environments, thereby achieving safe and energy-efficient lighting.

title: Design of the curtain grouting scheme for water-bearing sand layer sections in high-speed railway tunnels.
requirement: Design of the curtain grouting scheme for water-bearing sand layer sections in high-speed railway tunnels. Under the conditions of the recently formed uncemented water-bearing sand layer, complete the design and implementation of the grouting scheme for the tunnel curtain in the water-bearing sand layer section, ensuring the safety of tunnel construction and addressing issues of quicksand, collapse, and water permeability.
solution: This article presents a technical solution combining curtain grouting with surface drainage. Specifically, first, considering the issues of quicksand and collapse in the newly formed, unconsolidated water-sand layer, curtain grouting technology is employed to strengthen the surrounding rock by controlling the grouting thickness to 2.72 m outside the excavation profile. Secondly, to prevent uneven diffusion of the grout leading to collapse, a C20 concrete cutoff wall is designed, and deep well dewatering technology is implemented to ensure the groundwater level drops and the moisture content of the surrounding rock is reduced to below 11%. To address the problems of collapse and sand inflow, an advanced support system utilizing φ108 mm pipe roofs and φ42 mm small conduits is adopted to reinforce the arch section and face, in conjunction with radial grouting and back pressure backfilling technology, effectively mitigating the risk of cavity formation. Overall, this solution effectively advances tunnel construction progress while ensuring safety during construction.

explanation.content: In response to analysis0, considering that high moisture content may lead to flowing sand and the collapse of surrounding rock, technology0 curtain grouting technology is employed to strengthen the external consolidated body of the tunnel by controlling the grouting thickness and pressure, achieving the effect of suppressing flowing sand and collapses.

For analysis1, considering that the grouting body may not be strong enough and the grout fluid may diffuse unevenly, technology1 is used for the cutoff wall technique. By designing the wall thickness and material strength, it prevents fluid leakage and, combined with technology0, ensures steady consolidation effectiveness.

For analysis2, considering the untimely discharge of pore water from the surrounding rock and the risk of cavity collapse, technology3 pipe shed and small conduit advanced support were employed, in conjunction with technology2 dewatering technology, to improve the stability of the surrounding rock by lowering the groundwater level and enhancing reinforcement measures.

For analysis2, the risk of collapse is further addressed by using technology4 radial grouting and backfill technology, which compensates for weak areas in the curtain grouting by partially filling the collapse cavity and increasing the grouting strength, thereby enhancing the support capability of the surrounding rock.

title: Design of the monitoring plan for the deformation of high-speed railway bridges.
requirement: Design of the monitoring plan for the deformation of high-speed railway bridges. In the construction areas of the Jiqing High-Speed Railway, specifically from points 48 to 56 and the Beixin Shop connecting line from points 42 to 50, complete the real-time monitoring tasks for settlement deformation, lateral horizontal deformation, and longitudinal horizontal deformation of the nearby high-speed railway bridge piers. The monitoring accuracy must meet ±0.2 mm, and the sampling period can be dynamically adjusted. If the monitoring period reaches the warning value, timely feedback must be provided, and emergency measures must be initiated.
solution: This article proposes a solution for monitoring construction deformation of viaducts in high-speed rail projects. Specifically, first, considering that soil displacement in the construction area may affect the stability of bridge piers, an automated static leveling monitoring system and tilt monitoring system are employed. Through high-precision equipment and real-time monitoring technology, settling and horizontal deformation data are captured, ensuring monitoring accuracy and efficiency; second, to meet the demand for all-weather real-time monitoring and high precision, a differential pressure static level gauge and monitoring system software are used, ensuring reliable monitoring and timely abnormal alerts through automatic processing and data visualization analysis; finally, addressing the complexity of the measurement environment and the need for benchmark stability, a benchmark control network is designed, and second-class leveling technology is used for regular re-measurement to reduce errors caused by external factors or equipment, thereby achieving the goal of high-precision, all-weather construction deformation monitoring.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that soil displacement may occur in the construction area of high-speed rail bridge piers and further affect the stability of the piers, technology0 and technology1 were adopted. An automated static level monitoring system was used to monitor settlement deformation, while an inclination monitoring system precisely captured lateral and longitudinal horizontal deformations, ensuring real-time data and high precision, thereby enhancing monitoring efficiency and providing early warnings for potential risks.

For analysis1, considering the real-time monitoring requirements during construction and the high precision demands, technology0 was chosen for sampling and data transmission using a high-frequency differential pressure level gauge, combined with technology3 monitoring system software to achieve automatic processing of data, trend analysis, and multi-channel data synchronization display, thereby enabling precise all-weather management of deformation monitoring.

For analysis2, considering the complexity of the construction area and the requirements of the benchmark network for accuracy and stability, a technology2 benchmark control network was adopted. Leveling measurements of the second order were used to ensure the stability of the control points, combined with the expertise of technical personnel for the 'five fixed' control, effectively reducing various errors during the data measurement process and ensuring the reliability of the monitoring.
